4193165137,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-digital-analyst-at-fifty-five-4193165137?position=10&pageNum=2&refId=Ag0zMprHlpsH5ARsy9tz8g%3D%3D&trackingId=1AzEZU9KbhBOonkEEvP9DQ%3D%3D,Junior Digital Analyst,fifty-five,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","A proposito di fifty-five:

fifty-five è una data-company di un nuovo genere che aiuta i brand a sfruttare i dati per migliorare il marketing, i media e l'esperienza del cliente grazie a una combinazione di servizi di consulenza e tecnologia specializzata, pilastro del Brandtech Group nel settore data e marketing, propone un'ampia gamma di servizi che fondono consulenza strategica, services cloud, expertise media e miglioramento della customer experience.

fifty-five conta più di 400 esperti digitali. Consulenti digitali, specialisti di tracking e media, ingegneri e data scientist lavorano in sinergia per fornire consulenze di marketing di alto livello e assistenza tecnica ai brand in tutti i settori, in tutto il mondo.

Come partner fidato degli inserzionisti nella gestione dei dati per la loro raccolta, attivazione e valorizzazione,  supportiamo le organizzazioni nel divenire realtà omnicanale efficaci attraverso la gestione dell'ecosistema digitale e l'integrazione con il mondo fisico.

Con sede a Parigi, operiamo su 3 fusi orari dai nostri 10 uffici situati a Parigi, Londra, Ginevra, Milano, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Taipei, Singapore e New York. Fifty-five attribuisce particolare importanza al benessere dei suoi collaboratori.

Dopo una fase di onboarding approfondito nel nostro ufficio di Milano, utilizzerete la vostra expertise delle soluzioni di web analytics e dei tag management systems (TMS) per svolgere varie mansioni per i nostri clienti.
In qualità di Junior Digital Analyst, farete leva sulla vostra padronanza tecnica delle soluzioni di web analytics e dei tag manager (TMS) per svolgere varie mansioni per i nostri clienti.
Implementazione tecnica delle soluzioni tracking dei siti web/mobile o app del cliente, dalla raccolta delle esigenze alla raccolta effettiva dei dati di cui garantirete qualità e affidabilità
Gestire i progetti a contatto con il cliente (garantendo l'avanzamento delle missioni, pianificazione, strategia di test, consegne) sulle problematiche di raccolta dati Analytics e Media
Condividere le vostre conoscenze e competenze con i clienti e internamente
Mantenere un collegamento permanente con i diversi attori lato cliente/integratore
Sviluppare un know-how operativo dettagliato (TMS & Analytics)
Sviluppare nuove opportunità di business in collaborazione con i consulenti responsabili del conto
Partecipare alla definizione dei prodotti e degli strumenti interni dell'azienda
Partecipare alla concezione e al posizionamento dell'offerta tecnologica di fifty-five.
Laureato/a in discipline STEM o economia , con 1 o 2 anni di esperienza nella gestione di progetti di Tracking / Misurazione / Web Analytics.
Esperienza nella gestione progetti interfacciandosi con team digitali ed IT
Conoscenza dei principali strumenti di web analytics  (Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, AT Internet...)
column2: Tag Management System (GTM, Launch, Tealium, Commanders Act, ...)

column1: Conoscenze di JavaScript (comprensione e sviluppo di logiche semplici) e Web in generale
Grande passione per le tecnologie e il settore di internet
Competenze in ambiente mobile sono un plus
Conoscenze del funzionamento dei CMP sono un plus
Buona capacità di proporre soluzioni perfettamente in linea con le esigenze
Buon livello sia di italiano che di inglese.
I vantaggi di lavorare in fifty-five:
Particolare attenzione all'equilibrio vita privata / vita professionale nel rispetto del diritto alla disconnessione
Un ambiente multiculturale con collaboratori di oltre 20 nazionalità diverse
Valori interni incentrati sull'eccellenza, la benevolenza e la condivisione
Formazione continua (e riconosciuta) sull'ecosistema, le tecnologie digitali e sulle soft skills (es: public speaking, gestione del team ecc.)

Possibilità di partecipare a progetti interni come Data Hive (un progetto ""tech for good"" promosso dai dipendenti di fifty-five, il cui scopo è mettere le loro conoscenze e competenze a disposizione di organizzazioni benefiche), DEI@55 (un gruppo di lavoro sui temi della diversità e dell'inclusione all'interno di fifty-five e della tecnologia più in generale), Sustainability@55 (un team che aiuta a implementare pratiche sostenibili internamente e presso i nostri clienti).

In fifty-five, siamo convinti che la diversità e l'inclusione siano vere forze. Ci impegniamo a garantire parità di trattamento di tutte le candidature ricevute, senza distinzione di genere, età, origine, orientamento sessuale, stato di salute o opinione politica o religiosa. Incontra il team di fifty-five!
Localizzazione: Corso Giacomo Matteotti 1, CAP 20121 Milano
Tipo di contratto: Contratto di lavoro a tempo pieno e indeterminato

4157011802,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-engineer-analytics-engineer-bi-developer-intern-at-enpal-4157011802?position=1&pageNum=5&refId=1iN4cMJEgHrCjYeimJ3GLg%3D%3D&trackingId=pTSH3kA2k5skq23IhunzGA%3D%3D,Data Analyst & Engineer - Analytics Engineer - BI developer Intern,Enpal,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Descrizione dell'azienda
Enpal persegue il sogno di costruire la più grande community di energia rinnovabile al mondo.
Vendiamo impianti fotovoltaici, accumulatori di energia e wallbox con una tariffa all-inclusive, combinando una tariffa elettrica ecologica a basso costo con una soluzione integrata completa.
Fedele al motto ""digitale, decentralizzato e 100% rinnovabile"", il nostro cuore batte sia per il rapido sviluppo dell'azienda che per combattere il cambiamento climatico.

Stiamo cercando un/a stagista motivato/a per il ruolo di Data Analyst & Engineer - Analytics Engineer - BI developer all'interno del team di Sales Operations di Enpal Italia. In questo ruolo, lavorerai a stretto contatto con il nostro Head of Sales Operations per analizzare e ottimizzare il funnel di vendita, migliorando l'efficienza attraverso un’analisi dettagliata dei dati e dei processi aziendali. Se sei una persona curiosa, dinamica e pronta a contribuire con idee fresche in un ambiente startup non strutturato, questa è la tua opportunità!
Analizzare dati provenienti da fonti diverse e trasformarli in insight fruibili.
Sviluppare e gestire pipeline di dati utilizzando Python (preferibile conoscenza di Airflow per l’orchestrazione).
Creare dashboard e report in Power BI, sfruttando Power Query, DAX e una solida comprensione dei tipi di relazione e del modello semantico.
Utilizzare SQL per l’estrazione, la manipolazione e la gestione dei dati, specialmente in ambiente PostgreSQL e Snowflake.
Collaborare con diversi team interni per comprendere le esigenze di business e tradurle in soluzioni analitiche.
Essere curioso e disponibile ad apprendere nuove competenze tecniche in modo continuo.
Padronanza di Power BI: Power Query, DAX, comprensione delle relazioni tra tabelle e progettazione di modelli semantici.
Buona conoscenza di SQL e database relazionali.
Mentalità analitica, spirito di iniziativa e attitudine al problem solving.
Laurea STEM, Informatica, Ingegneria Informatica, Data Science o discipline affini, preferibilmente accompagnati da basi di programmazione e database.
Curiosità e voglia di sperimentare nuove tecnologie.
Capacità di lavoro in team e buona comunicazione con i diversi stakeholder.
Crescita professionale: Enpal è il posto ideale per crescere, imparare e svilupparsi in un settore in rapida evoluzione.
Ambiente stimolante: Siamo una startup internazionale, giovane e dinamica, con la possibilità di lavorare su progetti sfidanti e innovativi.
Impatto positivo: Contribuirai attivamente alla missione di portare l'energia solare e le soluzioni sostenibili a milioni di persone in tutto il mondo.
Tipologia di lavoro: Stage di 6 mesi con possibilità di stabilizzazione
Orario di lavoro 09:00 - 18:00 dal lunedì al venerdì

Descrizione dell'azienda

Enpal persegue il sogno di costruire la più grande community di energia rinnovabile al mondo.

Vendiamo impianti fotovoltaici, accumulatori di energia e wallbox con una tariffa all-inclusive, combinando una tariffa elettrica ecologica a basso costo con una soluzione integrata completa.

Fedele al motto ""digitale, decentralizzato e 100% rinnovabile"", il nostro cuore batte sia per il rapido sviluppo dell'azienda che per combattere il cambiamento climatico.

Descrizione del lavoro

Stiamo cercando un/a stagista motivato/a per il ruolo di Data Analyst &
column2:
Engineer - Analytics Engineer - BI developer all'interno del team di Sales Operations di Enpal Italia. In questo ruolo, lavorerai a stretto contatto con il nostro Head of Sales Operations per analizzare e ottimizzare il funnel di vendita, migliorando l'efficienza attraverso un’analisi dettagliata dei dati e dei processi aziendali. Se sei una persona curiosa, dinamica e pronta a contribuire con idee fresche in un ambiente startup non strutturato, questa è la tua opportunità!

Ruolo e responsabilità

  • Analizzare dati provenienti da fonti diverse e trasformarli in insight fruibili.
  • Sviluppare e gestire pipeline di dati utilizzando Python (preferibile conoscenza di Airflow per l’orchestrazione).
  • Creare dashboard e report in Power BI, sfruttando Power Query, DAX e una solida comprensione dei tipi di relazione e del modello semantico.
  • Utilizzare SQL per l’estrazione, la manipolazione e la gestione dei dati, specialmente in ambiente PostgreSQL e Snowflake.
  • Collaborare con diversi team interni per comprendere le esigenze di business e tradurle in soluzioni analitiche.
  • Essere curioso e disponibile ad apprendere nuove competenze tecniche in modo continuo.


Qualifiche

  • Conoscenze di base/intermedie di Python.
  • Padronanza di Power BI: Power Query, DAX, comprensione delle relazioni tra tabelle e progettazione di modelli semantici.
  • Familiarità con Excel.
  • Buona conoscenza di SQL e database relazionali.
  • Mentalità analitica, spirito di iniziativa e attitudine al problem solving.


Formazione

  • Laurea STEM, Informatica, Ingegneria Informatica, Data Science o discipline affini, preferibilmente accompagnati da basi di programmazione e database.


Soft Skill

  • Curiosità e voglia di sperimentare nuove tecnologie.
  • Capacità di lavoro in team e buona comunicazione con i diversi stakeholder.


Informazioni aggiuntive

  • Crescita professionale: Enpal è il posto ideale per crescere, imparare e svilupparsi in un settore in rapida evoluzione.
  • Ambiente stimolante: Siamo una startup internazionale, giovane e dinamica, con la possibilità di lavorare su progetti sfidanti e innovativi.
  • Impatto positivo: Contribuirai attivamente alla missione di portare l'energia solare e le soluzioni sostenibili a milioni di persone in tutto il mondo.


La Nostra Offerta

  • Lavoro in sede zona Centrale/Repubblica
  • Tipologia di lavoro: Stage di 6 mesi con possibilità di stabilizzazione
  • Indennità di partecipazione: 750€ lordi
  • Orario di lavoro 09:00 - 18:00 dal lunedì al venerdì

4172844859,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-analyst-at-pardgroup-4172844859?position=2&pageNum=5&refId=1iN4cMJEgHrCjYeimJ3GLg%3D%3D&trackingId=oFplOBn5NjIWaPt0jUmEHg%3D%3D,Business Intelligence Analyst,Pardgroup,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Pardgroup S.p.A, società leader operante nei settori del Marketing Operativo sulla GDO/GDS, dei Servizi Retail e delle vendite, in ottica di potenziamento del proprio organico, ricerca una figura di Business Intelligence Analyst da inserire in organico.
La risorsa, inserita all’interno della divisione Business Intelligence, dovrà svolgere le seguenti attività:
Analisi dati provenienti dal field e dal cliente
Aggregazione dati, individuando le metodologie di analisi più idonee
Progettazione Dashboard in Tableau e costruzione di Dataset
Interpretazione del dato e analisi critica dello stesso
Predisposizione di presentazioni relative alle analisi eseguite.
Il/la candidato/a ideale possiede i seguenti requisiti:
Precedente esperienza almeno di 1/2 anni in ruolo analogo
Buona conoscenza di almeno un tool di ETL (in particolar modo Prep)
Ottime capacità analitiche e di problem solving
Nice to have: conoscenza di Tableau e del linguaggio SQL
Completano il profilo attitudine nella gestione del cliente e spiccate capacità relazionali e comunicative.

Pardgroup Spa informa che la ricerca è rivolta ai candidati di ambo i sessi (L. 903/77 e L. 125/91). Ai sensi dell'art. 13 del Regolamento 679/2016 (GDPR) i dati sensibili e particolari comunicati dal candidato tramite l'invio del CV sono raccolti e trattati secondo quanto indicato nella normativa privacy accessibile al seguente link (https://www.pardgroup.com/privacy-policy) e per quanto occorrer possa, con l'invio dello stesso CV, il candidato ne autorizza il trattamento""

4184448402,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-platform-analyst-intern-at-italiaonline-4184448402?position=5&pageNum=5&refId=1iN4cMJEgHrCjYeimJ3GLg%3D%3D&trackingId=8MXHiNWB4Z%2BcNiYxxA2Flw%3D%3D,Data Platform Analyst Intern,Italiaonline,"Assago, Lombardy, Italy","Siamo Italiaonline, la più grande internet company italiana. La nostra mission è diffondere e accelerare la digitalizzazione del nostro Paese per garantire ai nostri Clienti la possibilità di ottenere risultati migliori nella loro vita digitale e nel loro business online attraverso servizi innovativi e di qualità.

La nostra direzione Information Technology ha il compito di supportare i processi dell’azienda attraverso la gestione dell’infrastruttura, lo sviluppo della Data Platform e dei sistemi di supporto al business e delle piattaforme dei nostri prodotti digitali. Garantisce inoltre la governance dei progetti di sviluppo e la sicurezza del nostro patrimonio di dati.
Entrerai a far parte del team IT Data Platform Development, nella nostra direzione Information Technology, come Data Platform Analyst Intern.
contribuire alla creazione, al collaudo e alla manutenzione di pipeline di dati scalabili per l'acquisizione, l'elaborazione e la trasformazione di dati provenienti da differenti fonti
collaborare con team interfunzionali per comprendere i requisiti dei dati e contribuire alla progettazione e all'ottimizzazione dei modelli e dell'architettura dei dati
contribuire all'implementazione della qualità dei dati e dei processi di governance per garantire l'accuratezza, la coerenza e l'affidabilità dei dati
collaborare a stretto contatto con colleghe e colleghi per supportare le loro esigenze e fornire competenze tecniche nell'analisi dei dati
contribuire alla creazione di report per la diffusione della Business Intelligence all'interno dell'azienda
rimanere aggiornati sulle tecnologie emergenti e sulle migliori pratiche di ingegneria dei dati e contribuire alle iniziative di miglioramento continuo all'interno del team.
diploma in informatica o laurea in sistemi informativi, ingegneria o affini
buone capacità di programmazione in linguaggi come Python, SQL
familiarità con i concetti di modellazione dei dati e con i sistemi di database (ad esempio, database relazionali, database NoSQL)
familiarità con le piattaforme cloud (ad esempio, AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform) e con tool di reportistica (come PowerBI, Tableu) è considerata un plus.
Cosa offriamo per la tua crescita professionale:
modalità di lavoro ibrida, per garantirti il giusto equilibrio tra lavoro e vita privata
possibilità di entrare in un’azienda italiana che si muove in un contesto digitale in continua trasformazione
percorso “Z Academy” pensato per la tua crescita professionale.
Z Academy: dove crescita e opportunità si incontrano!
Z Academy è un percorso formativo pensato e costruito per te.
Avrai la possibilità di confrontarti con il Leader e Manager del Gruppo Italiaonline, per stimolare idee creative ed innovative
column2: conoscere l’azienda, il business, i clienti e i trend del settore per diventare Italiaonline Brand Ambassador.

column1: L'obiettivo della Z Academy è trasferire un «metodo di lavoro» e sviluppare competenze chiave attraverso momenti dedicati a: project management, sviluppo personale, comunicazione efficace.
Grazie alla Z Academy avrai l’opportunità di iniziare a costruire il tuo futuro, esplorando insieme nuove prospettive e sfide.
Non lasciarti sfuggire questa occasione nel mondo digitale: candidati oggi e inizia un percorso unico in Italiaonline!

4199463044,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-mainstreaming-4199463044?position=6&pageNum=5&refId=1iN4cMJEgHrCjYeimJ3GLg%3D%3D&trackingId=7IEf8J%2FFjwr%2BtKrVqqPqmA%3D%3D,Data Analyst,MainStreaming,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","MainStreaming® is an intelligent media delivery company that empowers enterprises, media and gaming companies to ensure the best Quality of Experience to their audience, through its revolutionary AI-powered technology.

It optimizes the viewing experience with its Intelligent Media Deliver Platform (iMDP), the first platform designed to guarantee full governance over the streaming process, the highest Quality of Service and the best Return on Investment

We seek a results-driven Data Analyst to spearhead our company's performance management and analytical initiatives. In this key role, you will define KPIs across the organization, develop comprehensive performance frameworks, and deliver critical insights to our C-Level leadership team through data-driven analyses and quarterly business reviews.
Define and implement Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) across all departments to drive data-informed decision-making.
Develop and maintain a comprehensive performance management framework to monitor company objectives, analyze current operational performance metrics, and track progress against strategic goals.
Perform complex cross-functional analyses by extracting, combining, and interpreting data from multiple sources to uncover actionable insights.
Design and deliver quarterly business review presentations for C-Level executives, highlighting performance trends, identifying areas for improvement, and recommending data-driven solutions.

Extract, transform, and clean data from various sources and databases to ensure data integrity and consistency for analysis. Collaborate with stakeholders across departments to understand business requirements and translate them into analytical frameworks.
Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to visualize key metrics and facilitate data-driven discussions.
Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or related field
column2: Master's degree preferred.

column1: 3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or similar analytical roles.
Experience in conducting analyses and analyzing performance data within the Content Delivery Network (CDN) or ISP industry is a plus.
Strong analytical skills with demonstrated ability to transform complex data into actionable insights.
Proficient in SQL for data extraction and manipulation from various database systems.
Working knowledge of Python for data cleaning, analysis, and visualization (pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib).
Experience in designing and implementing KPIs and performance-tracking frameworks
Excellent data visualization skills and experience with BI tools (such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker).
Fluent English and outstanding written and verbal communication abilities are required.
Execution & Precision: Strong attention to detail, ability to meet deadlines, and accuracy in financial reporting.
Ownership & Accountability: Taking responsibility for work, following through on commitments, and delivering high-quality results.
Adaptability & Resilience: Thriving in a fast-paced environment, responding well to change, and maintaining professionalism under pressure.
Collaboration & Influence: Working effectively across teams, promoting knowledge sharing, and fostering a culture of transparency.
Continuous Learning: Proactively seeking opportunities to enhance financial expertise and industry knowledge.
A young, dynamic and entrepreneurial environment that promotes self-development and growth.
Breakfast, lunch and snacks in the office.
Salary and benefits will be assessed in relation to the candidate's experience and skills

In MainStreaming you will be part of a dynamic, flexible, young, tight-knit and international environment and will have the chance to work in a company that values innovation, out of the box thinking, its employees and is committed to making the world a better place.

MainStreaming is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

I candidati interessati possono inviare un curriculum vitae con l'autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali ai sensi del D.Lgs 196/03 e “Codice in materia di protezione dei dati personali” e dell’art. 13 GDPR 679/16 – “Regolamento europeo sulla protezione dei dati personali”.

MainStreaming® is an intelligent media delivery company that empowers enterprises, media and gaming companies to ensure the best Quality of Experience to their audience, through its revolutionary AI-powered technology.

It optimizes the viewing experience with its Intelligent Media Deliver Platform (iMDP), the first platform designed to guarantee full governance over the streaming process, the highest Quality of Service and the best Return on Investment


Data Analyst


Job Description:


We seek a results-driven Data Analyst to spearhead our company's performance management and analytical initiatives. In this key role, you will define KPIs across the organization, develop comprehensive performance frameworks, and deliver critical insights to our C-Level leadership team through data-driven analyses and quarterly business reviews.


Key Responsibilities:


  • Define and implement Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) across all departments to drive data-informed decision-making.
  • Develop and maintain a comprehensive performance management framework to monitor company objectives, analyze current operational performance metrics, and track progress against strategic goals.
  • Perform complex cross-functional analyses by extracting, combining, and interpreting data from multiple sources to uncover actionable insights.
  • Design and deliver quarterly business review presentations for C-Level executives, highlighting performance trends, identifying areas for improvement, and recommending data-driven solutions.
  • Extract, transform, and clean data from various sources and databases to ensure data integrity and consistency for analysis. Collaborate with stakeholders across departments to understand business requirements and translate them into analytical frameworks.
  • Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to visualize key metrics and facilitate data-driven discussions.


Qualifications:


  • Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or related field
column2:
Master's degree preferred.
  • 3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or similar analytical roles.
  • Experience in conducting analyses and analyzing performance data within the Content Delivery Network (CDN) or ISP industry is a plus.


    • Skills:


    • Strong analytical skills with demonstrated ability to transform complex data into actionable insights.
    • Proficient in SQL for data extraction and manipulation from various database systems.
    • Working knowledge of Python for data cleaning, analysis, and visualization (pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib).
    • Experience in designing and implementing KPIs and performance-tracking frameworks
    • Excellent data visualization skills and experience with BI tools (such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker).
    • Fluent English and outstanding written and verbal communication abilities are required.


    Competencies:


    • Execution &
column3:
Precision: Strong attention to detail, ability to meet deadlines, and accuracy in financial reporting.
  • Ownership &
column4:
Accountability: Taking responsibility for work, following through on commitments, and delivering high-quality results.
  • Adaptability &
column5:
Resilience: Thriving in a fast-paced environment, responding well to change, and maintaining professionalism under pressure.
  • Collaboration &
column6:
Influence: Working effectively across teams, promoting knowledge sharing, and fostering a culture of transparency.
  • Continuous Learning: Proactively seeking opportunities to enhance financial expertise and industry knowledge.


    • What we offer:


    • A young, dynamic and entrepreneurial environment that promotes self-development and growth.
    • Flexible working hours.
    • Breakfast, lunch and snacks in the office.
    • Access to E-Learning platform.
    • Health Insurance


    Salary and benefits will be assessed in relation to the candidate's experience and skills


    In MainStreaming you will be part of a dynamic, flexible, young, tight-knit and international environment and will have the chance to work in a company that values innovation, out of the box thinking, its employees and is committed to making the world a better place.

    MainStreaming is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

    I candidati interessati possono inviare un curriculum vitae con l'autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali ai sensi del D.Lgs 196/03 e “Codice in materia di protezione dei dati personali” e dell’art. 13 GDPR 679/16 – “Regolamento europeo sulla protezione dei dati personali”.

4190957551,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-engineer-analytics-engineer-bi-developer-m-f-d-at-enpal-4190957551?position=7&pageNum=5&refId=1iN4cMJEgHrCjYeimJ3GLg%3D%3D&trackingId=UM38ZENvdyHsTB3ciAkcrQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst & Engineer - Analytics Engineer - BI developer (m/f/d),Enpal,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Descrizione dell'azienda
Enpal persegue il sogno di costruire la più grande community di energia rinnovabile al mondo.
Vendiamo impianti fotovoltaici, accumulatori di energia e wallbox con una tariffa all-inclusive, combinando una tariffa elettrica ecologica a basso costo con una soluzione integrata completa.
Fedele al motto ""digitale, decentralizzato e 100% rinnovabile"", il nostro cuore batte sia per il rapido sviluppo dell'azienda che per combattere il cambiamento climatico.

Stiamo cercando un profilo valido per il ruolo di Data Analyst & Engineer - Analytics Engineer - BI developer all'interno del team di Sales Operations di Enpal Italia. In questo ruolo, lavorerai a stretto contatto con il nostro Head of Sales Operations per analizzare e ottimizzare il funnel di vendita, migliorando l'efficienza attraverso un’analisi dettagliata dei dati e dei processi aziendali. Se sei una persona curiosa, dinamica e pronta a contribuire con idee fresche in un ambiente startup non strutturato, questa è la tua opportunità!
Analizzare dati provenienti da fonti diverse e trasformarli in insight fruibili.
Sviluppare e gestire pipeline di dati utilizzando Python (preferibile conoscenza di Airflow per l’orchestrazione).
Creare dashboard e report in Power BI, sfruttando Power Query, DAX e una solida comprensione dei tipi di relazione e del modello semantico.
Utilizzare SQL per l’estrazione, la manipolazione e la gestione dei dati, specialmente in ambiente PostgreSQL e Snowflake.
Collaborare con diversi team interni per comprendere le esigenze di business e tradurle in soluzioni analitiche.
Essere curioso e disponibile ad apprendere nuove competenze tecniche in modo continuo.
Padronanza di Power BI: Power Query, DAX, comprensione delle relazioni tra tabelle e progettazione di modelli semantici.
Buona conoscenza di SQL e database relazionali.
Mentalità analitica, spirito di iniziativa e attitudine al problem solving.
Laurea STEM, Informatica, Ingegneria Informatica, Data Science o discipline affini, preferibilmente accompagnati da basi di programmazione e database.
Se ti riconosci in questo profilo e desideri contribuire all’espansione di una realtà innovativa, applica per entrare a far parte del nostro team e fare la differenza!
Passione per la sostenibilità – Facciamo parte della rivoluzione solare in Europa, rendendo l'energia rinnovabile alla portata di tutti.
Un team internazionale – Un ambiente diversificato, con oltre 65 nazionalità.
Crescita e sviluppo – Un contesto dinamico che promuove il miglioramento continuo e la valorizzazione delle idee.
Inclusività e rispetto – Enpal promuove un ambiente di lavoro equo e inclusivo, impegnandosi per garantire pari opportunità e il rispetto della diversità.

Descrizione dell'azienda

Enpal persegue il sogno di costruire la più grande community di energia rinnovabile al mondo.

Vendiamo impianti fotovoltaici, accumulatori di energia e wallbox con una tariffa all-inclusive, combinando una tariffa elettrica ecologica a basso costo con una soluzione integrata completa.

Fedele al motto ""digitale, decentralizzato e 100% rinnovabile"", il nostro cuore batte sia per il rapido sviluppo dell'azienda che per combattere il cambiamento climatico.

Descrizione del lavoro

Stiamo cercando un profilo valido per il ruolo di Data Analyst &
column2:
Engineer - Analytics Engineer - BI developer all'interno del team di Sales Operations di Enpal Italia. In questo ruolo, lavorerai a stretto contatto con il nostro Head of Sales Operations per analizzare e ottimizzare il funnel di vendita, migliorando l'efficienza attraverso un’analisi dettagliata dei dati e dei processi aziendali. Se sei una persona curiosa, dinamica e pronta a contribuire con idee fresche in un ambiente startup non strutturato, questa è la tua opportunità!

Ruolo e responsabilità

  • Analizzare dati provenienti da fonti diverse e trasformarli in insight fruibili.
  • Sviluppare e gestire pipeline di dati utilizzando Python (preferibile conoscenza di Airflow per l’orchestrazione).
  • Creare dashboard e report in Power BI, sfruttando Power Query, DAX e una solida comprensione dei tipi di relazione e del modello semantico.
  • Utilizzare SQL per l’estrazione, la manipolazione e la gestione dei dati, specialmente in ambiente PostgreSQL e Snowflake.
  • Collaborare con diversi team interni per comprendere le esigenze di business e tradurle in soluzioni analitiche.
  • Essere curioso e disponibile ad apprendere nuove competenze tecniche in modo continuo.


Qualifiche

  • Buona conoscenza di Python.
  • Padronanza di Power BI: Power Query, DAX, comprensione delle relazioni tra tabelle e progettazione di modelli semantici.
  • Familiarità con Excel.
  • Buona conoscenza di SQL e database relazionali.
  • Mentalità analitica, spirito di iniziativa e attitudine al problem solving.


Formazione

  • Laurea STEM, Informatica, Ingegneria Informatica, Data Science o discipline affini, preferibilmente accompagnati da basi di programmazione e database.


Informazioni aggiuntive

Se ti riconosci in questo profilo e desideri contribuire all’espansione di una realtà innovativa, applica per entrare a far parte del nostro team e fare la differenza!

La Nostra Filosofia

  • Passione per la sostenibilità – Facciamo parte della rivoluzione solare in Europa, rendendo l'energia rinnovabile alla portata di tutti.
  • Un team internazionale – Un ambiente diversificato, con oltre 65 nazionalità.
  • Crescita e sviluppo – Un contesto dinamico che promuove il miglioramento continuo e la valorizzazione delle idee.
  • Inclusività e rispetto – Enpal promuove un ambiente di lavoro equo e inclusivo, impegnandosi per garantire pari opportunità e il rispetto della diversità.

4191469252,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst%E2%80%94interest-registration-at-bending-spoons-4191469252?position=8&pageNum=5&refId=1iN4cMJEgHrCjYeimJ3GLg%3D%3D&trackingId=gj6Xpr7hYz2K%2BsPtzoZAFg%3D%3D,Data Analyst—Interest registration,Bending Spoons,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","⚠️ This position isn’t open at the moment, but we’re always on the lookout for exceptional talent. Register your interest today, and you’ll be among the first we consider when recruitment begins.

At Bending Spoons, we’re striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform—which comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor’s attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That’s our promise to such a candidate.
A few examples of your responsibilities
Collaborate with Product and Business teams to determine the most pressing questions that big data can help answer, and then figure out how to uncover those insights.
Query and analyze massive sets of usage data to identify product-improvement opportunities and actionable insights to profoundly impact our product strategy and roadmap.
Create brief, high-quality reports to explain your findings and discuss their implications with the relevant team members.
Screen the app stores and study competing products in search of insights and ideas we could learn from.
Help direct the development of our technologies devoted to the acquisition, storage, and manipulation of big data, supporting our efforts to constantly break new ground in this field.

Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.

Drive. You’re extremely ambitious in everything you do—and your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high—and rising—bar.

Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You’re reliable, honest, and transparent.
Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.
Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You’ll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.

An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential—then, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you’ve got what it takes, you’ll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.

Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of €52,246. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.

All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.

Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We’re extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don’t hesitate to apply.

We welcome applications in English and Italian. If you pass our screening, we’ll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you’re successful with those, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.

Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested at accommodations-ext@bendingspoons.com.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn’t a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

4195842991,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/stage-junior-business-data-analyst-adkaora-at-mondadori-group-4195842991?position=1&pageNum=7&refId=ZR8e8%2BtIK26hhgRG2csdow%3D%3D&trackingId=A%2FoQq2daPymaxY5GrYBnsw%3D%3D,Stage Junior Business Data Analyst | AdKaora,Mondadori Group,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","AdKaora

AdKaora, parte del Gruppo Mondadori, è una digital company leader nell’innovazione mobile. Offriamo strumenti e soluzioni multicanale efficaci per brand e publisher, mirati a raggiungere, coinvolgere e influenzare il target, ottenendo risultati concreti e misurabili. AdKaora Value Network è la nostra innovativa concessionaria pubblicitaria, che fa dell'innovazione tecnologica il suo cavallo di battaglia. Con oltre 1500 partner globali, realizziamo e proponiamo al mercato formati pubblicitari innovativi, utilizzati dai più grandi publisher italiani e internazionali.
Siamo alla ricerca di un/a Junior Business Analyst da inserire in stage nel nostro team.

Introduzione al contesto di Business e studio dei processi aziendali: Familiarizzare con l'azienda, il settore e i flussi di lavoro aziendali per comprendere come i dati possano supportare le decisioni aziendali.
Sviluppare e mantenere dashboard PowerBi, garantendo che riflettano sempre i dati aggiornati e soddisfino le esigenze aziendali.
Esplorare le connessioni tra diverse fonti di dati per avere una visione completa e coerente delle informazioni aziendali.
Studio, scrittura e ottimizzazione di script Python per l'elaborazione dei dati.
Power BI (conoscenza base/intermedia, capacità di creare report e dashboard)
Conoscenza di base dei DBMS - SQL (conoscenza base, capacità di scrivere query semplici)
Conoscenza di base di database NoSQL (MongoDB, Redis)
Esperienza con strumenti di cloud (es. AWS)
6 mesi di stage con possibilità di proroga per ulteriori 6 mesi.
Rimborso spese, possibilità di smart working, buoni pasto nei giorni di presenza in sede, convenzioni aziendali.
Sede di lavoro: Via San Gregorio 1, Milano

Siamo felici di ricevere candidature da profili diversi per genere, età e cultura, perché crediamo nelle pari opportunità, ma ancor più nel valore aggiunto che ogni individuo, con la propria unicità, può apportare al nostro Gruppo. (Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91 e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03)

AdKaora

AdKaora, parte del Gruppo Mondadori, è una digital company leader nell’innovazione mobile. Offriamo strumenti e soluzioni multicanale efficaci per brand e publisher, mirati a raggiungere, coinvolgere e influenzare il target, ottenendo risultati concreti e misurabili. AdKaora Value Network è la nostra innovativa concessionaria pubblicitaria, che fa dell'innovazione tecnologica il suo cavallo di battaglia. Con oltre 1500 partner globali, realizziamo e proponiamo al mercato formati pubblicitari innovativi, utilizzati dai più grandi publisher italiani e internazionali.


Di cosa ti occuperai

Siamo alla ricerca di un/a Junior Business Analyst da inserire in stage nel nostro team.

Come tale ti occuperai di:

  • Introduzione al contesto di Business e studio dei processi aziendali: Familiarizzare con l'azienda, il settore e i flussi di lavoro aziendali per comprendere come i dati possano supportare le decisioni aziendali.
  • Sviluppare e mantenere dashboard PowerBi, garantendo che riflettano sempre i dati aggiornati e soddisfino le esigenze aziendali.
  • Esplorare le connessioni tra diverse fonti di dati per avere una visione completa e coerente delle informazioni aziendali.
  • Studio, scrittura e ottimizzazione di script Python per l'elaborazione dei dati.


Il tuo profilo

Professionalmente hai:

  • Power BI (conoscenza base/intermedia, capacità di creare report e dashboard)
  • Conoscenza di base dei DBMS - SQL (conoscenza base, capacità di scrivere query semplici)
  • Python (conoscenza base: variabili, funzioni)
  • Lingua Inglese (almeno B2)

Nice to Have:

  • Python (moduli come pandas, pymongo, s3fs/boto3)
  • Conoscenza di base di database NoSQL (MongoDB, Redis)
  • Esperienza con strumenti di cloud (es. AWS)


Cosa ti offriamo

  • 6 mesi di stage con possibilità di proroga per ulteriori 6 mesi.
  • Rimborso spese, possibilità di smart working, buoni pasto nei giorni di presenza in sede, convenzioni aziendali.


Sede di lavoro: Via San Gregorio 1, Milano

Siamo felici di ricevere candidature da profili diversi per genere, età e cultura, perché crediamo nelle pari opportunità, ma ancor più nel valore aggiunto che ogni individuo, con la propria unicità, può apportare al nostro Gruppo. (Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91 e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03)

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 9l5.93-4L15 6.54l-6.15 4.2a1.5 1.5 0 01-1.69 0L1 6.54 2.07 5z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

NATO’s Public Diplomacy efforts serve a vital function within the Alliance by communicating its purpose and priorities to audiences worldwide. In fulfilling this role, the Public Diplomacy Division (PDD) actively strengthens NATO’s public image, thereby fostering trust in and support for the Alliance. The Division also acts as coordinator for strategic communication activities across all NATO civilian and military bodies and commands.

The Data Insights and Information Threats section sits within PDD. It comprises the Information Environment Assessment (IEA) Unit, Audience Research Team, and a team managing strategic communications policy and NATO’s work on countering information threats. The Information Environment Assessment Unit, comprised of an Analysis and a Data Team, is the engine that provides data and evidence-based analysis of, and insights into, the information environment. The Unit develops action-orientated reporting and alerting to help NATO improve its Strategic Communications, as well as engagement with relevant stakeholders internally and externally.

The incumbent carries out the duties of IEA Data Analyst in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment. They are responsible for applying data analytics to the collection and analysis of multiple publicly and commercially available data sources and services. Additionally, the incumbent produces analytical products with actionable recommendations, supporting data-driven decision making and helping to ensure a strategic approach to PDD’s multifaceted communications. They also help to shape the acquisition and adoption of cutting-edge analytical tools to help NATO’s IEA capability evolve.
possess a university degree, from an institute of a recognized standing, in a field relevant for the role (preferably such as data science or international relations)
have 2 years of professional experience in data analytics, and qualitative and quantitative research methods
possess proven experience applying data analytics to the collection and analysis of traditional and social media
possess proven experience in developing reporting products for senior and/or executive audiences
be able to explain data as a convincing story
have excellent communication, drafting and oral presentation skills
have strong interpersonal skills, and the ability to interact within a multicultural team and with diverse stakeholders across the Organization
possess the following minimum levels of NATO’s official languages (English/French): V (“Advanced”) in one
column2: I (“Beginner”) in the other.

column1: The following would be considered an advantage:
experience with quantitative methods and their application to trend analysis
basic knowledge of programming languages, such as Python
geographic expertise (Russia, China or/and Middle East North Africa)
experience with methods and techniques to evaluate and assess communications activities, including relevant measurement and assessment frameworks and tools

knowledge of and/or experience in analysing information threats, using publicly and commercially available data sources and services to characterize threat actors’ campaigns, capabilities, and their tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs)
knowledge of and/or experience in implementing best-practice analytical methodologies to structure and scale data models for analysing information threats.

Contribute in an active, timely and well-coordinated manner to PDD’s work in the area of Information Environment Assessment, by delivering high quality reports including actionable recommendations based on the assessment of the information environment. Glean and share insights with PDD leadership on information threats targeting NATO.

Keep abreast of industry developments relevant to Information Environment Assessment, including emerging best practice analytical methodologies. Provide clear insight and recommendations to civilian and military staffs from multiple disciplines, including those directly responsible for analysing and evaluating information and communications products. Ensure that this expertise is translated into effective Information Environment Assessments reporting. Use sound political judgement when making recommendations on adjusting NATO’s communications based on regular analysis and assessment.

Apply data analytics to the collection and analysis of traditional and social media. Contribute to improving the quality, scope and operational relevance of the IEA reports delivered by PDD. Identify and analyse trends, and distil actionable insights to brief NATO communicators and decision-makers. Test traditional media, social media and disinformation analysis tools and advise on procurement and contracted services.

Work closely with the IEA Unit, Audience Research Team and StratCom policy team within the section to integrate IEA into the communications planning process and coordinate seamlessly with other sections within PDD. Develop and maintain professional relationships across the civilian and military staff to promote synergies within and between different disciplines, including intelligence, cyber, operations, data policy, logistics, and information management. Work with Allies and partners, including the European External Acton Service and G7 Rapid Response Mechanism, to exchange expertise related to analysing information threats. Coordinate effectively with various stakeholders in order to get useful inputs with actionable recommendations for the delivery of regular IEA reports. Identify, strengthen and build relationships with partners, researchers and other experts to become better informed on IEA.

Plan and deliver reports within tight deadlines on issues of relevance to PDD and senior NATO leadership. Demonstrate political acumen when selecting topics and analysing and assessing trends in the information environment. Work with other divisions at NATO to deliver briefings for senior NATO staff. Use initiative to recommend opportunities for Information Environment Assessment.
Perform any other related duty as assigned.

The incumbent carries out their duties under the overall direction of the Head, Information Environment Assessment Unit, and following day-to-day guidance of the Lead, Data Team . The incumbent maintains a close working relationship with other staff in the Unit, members of PDD, as well as counterparts in other Divisions, other NATO entities and in Allied Delegations and capitals.
Clarity and Accuracy: Checks own work.
Customer Service Orientation: Takes personal responsibility for correcting problems.
Empathy: Is open to others’ perspectives.
Impact and Influence: Takes multiple actions to persuade.
Initiative: Is decisive in a time-sensitive situation.
Teamwork: Solicits inputs and encourages others
Contract to be offered to the successful applicant (if non-seconded): Definite duration contract of three years
column2: possibility of renewal for up to three years, during which the incumbent may apply for conversion to an indefinite duration contract.

column1: In accordance with the contract policy, this is a post in which turnover is desirable for political reasons in order to be able to accommodate the Organisation's need to carry out its tasks as mandated by the Nations in a changing environment, for example by maintaining the flexibility necessary to shape the Organisation's skills profile, and to ensure appropriate international diversity.

The maximum period of service foreseen in this post is 6 years. The successful applicant will be offered a 3-year definite duration contract, which may be renewed for a further period of up to 3 years. However, according to the procedure described in the contract policy the incumbent may apply for conversion to an indefinite contract during the period of renewal and no later than one year before the end of contract.

If the successful applicant is seconded from the national administration of one of NATO’s member States, a 3-year definite duration contract will be offered, which may be renewed for a further period of up to 3 years subject also to the agreement of the national authority concerned. The maximum period of service in the post as a seconded staff member is six years.
Serving staff will be offered a contract in accordance with the NATO Civilian Personnel Régulations.
USEFUL INFORMATION REGARDING APPLICATION AND RECRUITMENT PROCESS
Please note that we can only accept applications from nationals of NATO member countries. Applications must be submitted using e-recruitment system, as applicable:
For NATO civilian staff members only: please apply via the internal recruitment portal ( link )
Before you apply to any position, we encourage you to click here and watch our video providing 6 tips to prepare you for your application and recruitment process.
Do you have questions on the application process in the system and not sure how to proceed? Click here for a video containing the information you need to successfully submit your application on time.
More information about the recruitment process and conditions of employment, can be found at our website (http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/recruit-hq-e.htm)

Appointment will be subject to receipt of a security clearance (provided by the national Authorities of the selected candidate), approval of the candidate’s medical file by the NATO Medical Adviser, verification of your study(ies) and work experience, and the successful completion of the accreditation and notification process by the relevant authorities.

NATO will not accept any phase of the recruitment and selection prepared, in whole or in part, by means of generative artificial-intelligence (AI) tools, including and without limitation to chatbots, such as Chat Generative Pre-trained Transformer (Chat GPT), or other language generating tools. NATO reserves the right to screen applications to identify the use of such tools. All applications prepared, in whole or in part, by means of such generative or creative AI applications may be rejected without further consideration at NATO’s sole discretion, and NATO reserves the right to take further steps in such cases as appropriate.

NATO is committed to diversity and inclusion, and strives to provide equal access to employment, advancement and retention, independent of gender, age, nationality, ethnic origin, religion or belief, cultural background, sexual orientation, and disability. NATO welcomes applications of nationals from all member Nations, and strongly encourages women to apply. NATO is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible working environment, where all candidates living with disabilities can fully participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require reasonable accommodation, please inform us during your selection process. Candidates will be required to provide documented medical evidence to support their request for accommodation. Building Integrity is a key element of NATO’s core tasks. As an employer, NATO values commitment to the principles of integrity, transparency and accountability in accordance with international norms and practices established for the defence and related security sector. Selected candidates are expected to be role models of integrity, and to promote good governance through ongoing efforts in their work. Due to the broad interest in NATO and the large number of potential candidates, telephone or e-mail enquiries cannot be dealt with. Applicants who are not successful in this competition may be offered an appointment to another post of a similar nature, albeit at the same or a lower grade, provided they meet the necessary requirements. The nature of this position may require the staff member at times to be called upon to travel for work and/or to work outside normal office hours. The organization offers several work-life policies including Teleworking and Flexible Working arrangements (Flexitime) subject to business requirements. Please note that the International Staff at NATO Headquarters in Brussels, Belgium is a non-smoking environment. For information about the NATO Single Salary Scale (Grading, Allowances, etc.) please visit our website . Detailed data is available under the Salary and Benefits tab. NATO does not charge any application, processing, training, interviewing, testing or other fee in connection with the application or recruitment process. For more info please click here .

Primary Location

Belgium-Brussels

NATO Body

NATO International Staff (NATO IS)

Schedule

Full-time

Application Deadline

20-Apr-2025, 11:59:00 PM

Salary (Pay Basis)

6,467.30

Grade

NATO Grade G15

  • SUMMARY


NATO’s Public Diplomacy efforts serve a vital function within the Alliance by communicating its purpose and priorities to audiences worldwide. In fulfilling this role, the Public Diplomacy Division (PDD) actively strengthens NATO’s public image, thereby fostering trust in and support for the Alliance. The Division also acts as coordinator for strategic communication activities across all NATO civilian and military bodies and commands.

The Data Insights and Information Threats section sits within PDD. It comprises the Information Environment Assessment (IEA) Unit, Audience Research Team, and a team managing strategic communications policy and NATO’s work on countering information threats. The Information Environment Assessment Unit, comprised of an Analysis and a Data Team, is the engine that provides data and evidence-based analysis of, and insights into, the information environment. The Unit develops action-orientated reporting and alerting to help NATO improve its Strategic Communications, as well as engagement with relevant stakeholders internally and externally.

The incumbent carries out the duties of IEA Data Analyst in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment. They are responsible for applying data analytics to the collection and analysis of multiple publicly and commercially available data sources and services. Additionally, the incumbent produces analytical products with actionable recommendations, supporting data-driven decision making and helping to ensure a strategic approach to PDD’s multifaceted communications. They also help to shape the acquisition and adoption of cutting-edge analytical tools to help NATO’s IEA capability evolve.

  • QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE


Essential

The incumbent must:

  • possess a university degree, from an institute of a recognized standing, in a field relevant for the role (preferably such as data science or international relations)
column2: • have 2 years of professional experience in data analytics, and qualitative and quantitative research methods
column3: • possess proven experience applying data analytics to the collection and analysis of traditional and social media
column4: • possess proven experience in developing reporting products for senior and/or executive audiences
column5: • be able to explain data as a convincing story
column6: • have excellent communication, drafting and oral presentation skills
column7: • demonstrate sound political judgment
column8: • have strong interpersonal skills, and the ability to interact within a multicultural team and with diverse stakeholders across the Organization
column9: • possess the following minimum levels of NATO’s official languages (English/French): V (“Advanced”) in one
column10:
I (“Beginner”) in the other.


DESIRABLE

The following would be considered an advantage:

  • experience with quantitative methods and their application to trend analysis
column11: • experience with natural language processing
column12: • basic knowledge of programming languages, such as Python
column13: • geographic expertise (Russia, China or/and Middle East North Africa)
column14: • experience with methods and techniques to evaluate and assess communications activities, including relevant measurement and assessment frameworks and tools
column15: • knowledge of and/or experience in analysing information threats, using publicly and commercially available data sources and services to characterize threat actors’ campaigns, capabilities, and their tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs)
column16:
• knowledge of and/or experience in implementing best-practice analytical methodologies to structure and scale data models for analysing information threats.
  • MAIN ACCOUNTABILITIES


    • Information Management

    Contribute in an active, timely and well-coordinated manner to PDD’s work in the area of Information Environment Assessment, by delivering high quality reports including actionable recommendations based on the assessment of the information environment. Glean and share insights with PDD leadership on information threats targeting NATO.

    Knowledge Management

    Keep abreast of industry developments relevant to Information Environment Assessment, including emerging best practice analytical methodologies. Provide clear insight and recommendations to civilian and military staffs from multiple disciplines, including those directly responsible for analysing and evaluating information and communications products. Ensure that this expertise is translated into effective Information Environment Assessments reporting. Use sound political judgement when making recommendations on adjusting NATO’s communications based on regular analysis and assessment.

    Expertise Development

    Apply data analytics to the collection and analysis of traditional and social media. Contribute to improving the quality, scope and operational relevance of the IEA reports delivered by PDD. Identify and analyse trends, and distil actionable insights to brief NATO communicators and decision-makers. Test traditional media, social media and disinformation analysis tools and advise on procurement and contracted services.

    Stakeholder Management

    Work closely with the IEA Unit, Audience Research Team and StratCom policy team within the section to integrate IEA into the communications planning process and coordinate seamlessly with other sections within PDD. Develop and maintain professional relationships across the civilian and military staff to promote synergies within and between different disciplines, including intelligence, cyber, operations, data policy, logistics, and information management. Work with Allies and partners, including the European External Acton Service and G7 Rapid Response Mechanism, to exchange expertise related to analysing information threats. Coordinate effectively with various stakeholders in order to get useful inputs with actionable recommendations for the delivery of regular IEA reports. Identify, strengthen and build relationships with partners, researchers and other experts to become better informed on IEA.

    Project Management

    Plan and deliver reports within tight deadlines on issues of relevance to PDD and senior NATO leadership. Demonstrate political acumen when selecting topics and analysing and assessing trends in the information environment. Work with other divisions at NATO to deliver briefings for senior NATO staff. Use initiative to recommend opportunities for Information Environment Assessment.

    Perform any other related duty as assigned.

    • INTERRELATIONSHIPS


    The incumbent carries out their duties under the overall direction of the Head, Information Environment Assessment Unit, and following day-to-day guidance of the Lead, Data Team . The incumbent maintains a close working relationship with other staff in the Unit, members of PDD, as well as counterparts in other Divisions, other NATO entities and in Allied Delegations and capitals.

    Direct reports: N/a

    Indirect reports: N/a.

    • COMPETENCIES


    The incumbent must demonstrate:

    • Achievement: Works to meet standards.
    • Analytical Thinking: Sees multiple relationships.
    • Clarity and Accuracy: Checks own work.
    • Conceptual Thinking: Applies learned concepts.
    • Customer Service Orientation: Takes personal responsibility for correcting problems.
    • Empathy: Is open to others’ perspectives.
    • Impact and Influence: Takes multiple actions to persuade.
    • Initiative: Is decisive in a time-sensitive situation.
    • Teamwork: Solicits inputs and encourages others


    6. CONTRACT

    Contract to be offered to the successful applicant (if non-seconded): Definite duration contract of three years
column17:
possibility of renewal for up to three years, during which the incumbent may apply for conversion to an indefinite duration contract.

Contract clause applicable:

In accordance with the contract policy, this is a post in which turnover is desirable for political reasons in order to be able to accommodate the Organisation's need to carry out its tasks as mandated by the Nations in a changing environment, for example by maintaining the flexibility necessary to shape the Organisation's skills profile, and to ensure appropriate international diversity.

The maximum period of service foreseen in this post is 6 years. The successful applicant will be offered a 3-year definite duration contract, which may be renewed for a further period of up to 3 years. However, according to the procedure described in the contract policy the incumbent may apply for conversion to an indefinite contract during the period of renewal and no later than one year before the end of contract.

If the successful applicant is seconded from the national administration of one of NATO’s member States, a 3-year definite duration contract will be offered, which may be renewed for a further period of up to 3 years subject also to the agreement of the national authority concerned. The maximum period of service in the post as a seconded staff member is six years.

Serving staff will be offered a contract in accordance with the NATO Civilian Personnel Régulations.

  • USEFUL INFORMATION REGARDING APPLICATION AND RECRUITMENT PROCESS


Please note that we can only accept applications from nationals of NATO member countries. Applications must be submitted using e-recruitment system, as applicable:

For NATO civilian staff members only: please apply via the internal recruitment portal ( link )
column18:
For all other applications: www.nato.int/recruitment

Before you apply to any position, we encourage you to click here and watch our video providing 6 tips to prepare you for your application and recruitment process.

Do you have questions on the application process in the system and not sure how to proceed? Click here for a video containing the information you need to successfully submit your application on time.

More information about the recruitment process and conditions of employment, can be found at our website (http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/recruit-hq-e.htm)

Appointment will be subject to receipt of a security clearance (provided by the national Authorities of the selected candidate), approval of the candidate’s medical file by the NATO Medical Adviser, verification of your study(ies) and work experience, and the successful completion of the accreditation and notification process by the relevant authorities.

NATO will not accept any phase of the recruitment and selection prepared, in whole or in part, by means of generative artificial-intelligence (AI) tools, including and without limitation to chatbots, such as Chat Generative Pre-trained Transformer (Chat GPT), or other language generating tools. NATO reserves the right to screen applications to identify the use of such tools. All applications prepared, in whole or in part, by means of such generative or creative AI applications may be rejected without further consideration at NATO’s sole discretion, and NATO reserves the right to take further steps in such cases as appropriate.

  • ADDITIONAL INFORMATION


NATO is committed to diversity and inclusion, and strives to provide equal access to employment, advancement and retention, independent of gender, age, nationality, ethnic origin, religion or belief, cultural background, sexual orientation, and disability. NATO welcomes applications of nationals from all member Nations, and strongly encourages women to apply. NATO is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible working environment, where all candidates living with disabilities can fully participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require reasonable accommodation, please inform us during your selection process. Candidates will be required to provide documented medical evidence to support their request for accommodation. Building Integrity is a key element of NATO’s core tasks. As an employer, NATO values commitment to the principles of integrity, transparency and accountability in accordance with international norms and practices established for the defence and related security sector. Selected candidates are expected to be role models of integrity, and to promote good governance through ongoing efforts in their work. Due to the broad interest in NATO and the large number of potential candidates, telephone or e-mail enquiries cannot be dealt with. Applicants who are not successful in this competition may be offered an appointment to another post of a similar nature, albeit at the same or a lower grade, provided they meet the necessary requirements. The nature of this position may require the staff member at times to be called upon to travel for work and/or to work outside normal office hours. The organization offers several work-life policies including Teleworking and Flexible Working arrangements (Flexitime) subject to business requirements. Please note that the International Staff at NATO Headquarters in Brussels, Belgium is a non-smoking environment. For information about the NATO Single Salary Scale (Grading, Allowances, etc.) please visit our website . Detailed data is available under the Salary and Benefits tab. NATO does not charge any application, processing, training, interviewing, testing or other fee in connection with the application or recruitment process. For more info please click here .

4167914953,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/client-insights-data-analyst-at-louis-vuitton-4167914953?position=2&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=ArM3IL3eo%2BwrUwDAlJ2Qtw%3D%3D,CLIENT INSIGHTS DATA ANALYST,Louis Vuitton,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","About The Job

Within our Clienteling team, you will play a key role in transforming customer data into in-depth business analyses and strategic recommendations. Your main mission will be to detect opportunities for customer loyalty and engagement thanks to your mastery of data analysis and your sharp understanding of customer behavior.
Your Mission: Transform Data into Levers for Growth and Customer Loyalty
As a Client Insights Data Analyst, your mission will be to inform strategic decisions through your analytical expertise applied to customer data:
Conduct in-depth studies on the profile and behavior of our customers in both retail and e-retail.
Track customer trends and transform demographic, transactional, and engagement data into relevant insights and recommendations for business activations.
Measure commercial performance through precise KPIs and recommend areas for improvement.
Define and monitor precise KPIs to measure the performance of commercial actions and identify areas for improvement
Contribute to the development of targeted Clienteling campaigns, monitor their implementation, and analyze their results
Collaborate closely with business specialists from several departments to meet their needs for customer data analysis and optimize business opportunities
Lead the network of regional correspondents in developing their customer knowledge: train them, provide them with simplified and automated reports, and support them in their ad hoc analyses

Act as a proactive force for the Team Managers in developing the business and be a key contributor for sales, supporting teams on localized clienteling reporting and support with action plan, and regularly present your analyses and recommendations to the management teams

column2: leverage all the clienteling tools to engage and build long term Client relationships

column1: Create and implement specific action plans to pro-actively drive the business
Reporting on client evolution and local clienteling KPIs on weekly/Monthly/quarterly basis for Front and DPCA teams
Audience creation for EMEA wide and local activities for front and DPCA teams
Clienteling Efficiency: collaborate with performance and experts' team to report accurate conversion for all clienteling campaigns
Managing Clienteling time with RTA based on the project and priorities
Develop data visualizations that will allow monitoring performance
Acting as Icons and Power BI project owner
Coaching and training on tools-Icons device distribution and usage
Streamlining internal requests processes and managing incoming Icons requests.
You have at least 3 years of similar experience
Your analytical mind is your strength, combined with a sharp understanding of customer marketing
Proven expertise in the daily use of SQL. Knowledge of Dataiku would be a plus
Ability to present your analyses strategically orally and via PowerPoint
You enjoy working in a team and being in direct contact with business teams. Interpersonal soft skills and ease in working daily with business contacts who are not data specialists

About The Job

Your main mission will be to detect opportunities for customer loyalty and engagement thanks to your mastery of data analysis and your sharp understanding of customer behavior.
