4194918664,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/internship-data-analyst-at-unilever-4194918664?position=3&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=aiGIcH%2FFtpq68ocx9X%2BDQg%3D%3D,Internship Data Analyst,Unilever,"Anderlecht, Brussels Region, Belgium","Internship Data & Analytics
Looking for a challenging internship in the Data & Analytics team, starting in July, August or September 2025? It’s time to apply!

At Unilever, we share one simple purpose: To make sustainable living commonplace. Through our powerhouse brands such as Dove, Axe and Lipton, we are creating a bright future for our business and our planet – and you can be part of it!

We believe that companies with purpose last, people with purpose thrive and brands with purpose grow.  We meet every day needs for nutrition, hygiene and personal care with brands that help people feel good, look good and get more out of life.

When joining Unilever in Belgium, you will get the opportunity to have an impact on a leading-edge company and our outstanding brands. During this internship you will get real responsibilities that will provide you with a good insight into the organisation and support your personal development.

Our Data & Analytics team ensures that Unilever makes data-driven decisions to optimize product availability, supply chain efficiency, and consumer insights across global markets. During this internship, you will gain a deep understanding of how advanced analytics supports business operations, identify market trends through data, and learn how to transform raw information into actionable strategies that drive product success in a fast-paced consumer goods environment
Your Key Responsibilities And Accountabilities Could Be (amongst Others)
Collecting and cleaning up data to ensure quality is up to standard
Thinking collectively on how to present the analysis best towards our business colleagues and external stakeholders

You must be enrolled as a Bachelor or Master student from a University, Business School or equivalent during the entire internship. Your studies must have an analytic component. For example: courses on Statistics, Market Assessment, Marketing research or Marketing intelligence.
You are available for a minimum of 3 months and ideally for 6 months (37 hours a week).
You are fluent in English + Dutch or French.
You are a team player with a strong sense of responsibility.
You are a self-starter, able to work autonomously.
You are a pro-active and dynamic person, able to anticipate the needs of your team.
You are curious, eager to learn new things and to explore new ideas and approaches to solving challenges.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills and feel comfortable with data analysis.
You are able to work with a diversity of people and teams.
You are familiar with MS office tools in particular Excel.
Experience with Power BI / Tableau is a big plus!
You can successfully identify all Unilever iced tea products while blindfolded in a taste test (we won't actually test this, but impressive if true!)
An outstanding chance to bring our unique purpose to life!
An opportunity to take a look behind the scenes at one of the biggest FMCG-corporations in the world.
An opportunity to learn from a variety of concrete projects.
A wealth of experience, where you will be at the heart of the business.
Lots of responsibility, but also good guidance during your internship.
To apply, please send your CV and a motivation letter where your preferred internship topics, internship duration and ideal start date are highlighted.
We look forward to meeting you!

Unilever is an organisation committed to equity, inclusion and diversity to drive our business results and create a better future, every day, for our diverse employees, global consumers, partners, and communities. We believe a diverse workforce allows us to match our growth ambitions and drive inclusion across the business. At Unilever we are interested in every individual bringing their ‘Whole Self’ to work and this includes you! Thus if you require any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of your application so that we can support you through your recruitment journey.

column2:
Analytics

Looking for a challenging internship in the Data &
column3:
Analytics team, starting in July, August or September 2025? It’s time to apply! 

Who are we?

 

At Unilever, we share one simple purpose: To make sustainable living commonplace. Through our powerhouse brands such as Dove, Axe and Lipton, we are creating a bright future for our business and our planet – and you can be part of it!

 

We believe that companies with purpose last, people with purpose thrive and brands with purpose grow.  We meet every day needs for nutrition, hygiene and personal care with brands that help people feel good, look good and get more out of life.

 

Main Purpose Of The Internship

 

When joining Unilever in Belgium, you will get the opportunity to have an impact on a leading-edge company and our outstanding brands. During this internship you will get real responsibilities that will provide you with a good insight into the organisation and support your personal development.

Our Data &
column4:
Analytics team ensures that Unilever makes data-driven decisions to optimize product availability, supply chain efficiency, and consumer insights across global markets. During this internship, you will gain a deep understanding of how advanced analytics supports business operations, identify market trends through data, and learn how to transform raw information into actionable strategies that drive product success in a fast-paced consumer goods environment

 

Your Key Responsibilities And Accountabilities Could Be (amongst Others)

 

  • Market data analysis
  • Promotional follow-up and analysis
  • Collecting and cleaning up data to ensure quality is up to standard
  • Thinking collectively on how to present the analysis best towards our business colleagues and external stakeholders
  • Update &
column5:
creation of new reports

 

 

What We Ask

 

  • You must be enrolled as a Bachelor or Master student from a University, Business School or equivalent during the entire internship. Your studies must have an analytic component. For example: courses on Statistics, Market Assessment, Marketing research or Marketing intelligence.
  • You are available for a minimum of 3 months and ideally for 6 months (37 hours a week).
  • You are fluent in English + Dutch or French.
  • You are a team player with a strong sense of responsibility.
  • You are a self-starter, able to work autonomously.
  • You are a pro-active and dynamic person, able to anticipate the needs of your team.
  • You are curious, eager to learn new things and to explore new ideas and approaches to solving challenges.
  • You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills and feel comfortable with data analysis.
  • You are able to work with a diversity of people and teams.
  • You are familiar with MS office tools in particular Excel.
  • Experience with Power BI / Tableau is a big plus!
  • You can successfully identify all Unilever iced tea products while blindfolded in a taste test (we won't actually test this, but impressive if true!)

 

 

What We Offer

 

  • An outstanding chance to bring our unique purpose to life!
  • An opportunity to take a look behind the scenes at one of the biggest FMCG-corporations in the world.
  • An opportunity to learn from a variety of concrete projects.
  • A wealth of experience, where you will be at the heart of the business.
  • Lots of responsibility, but also good guidance during your internship.

 

 

EXCITED ABOUT THE ROLE?

 

To apply, please send your CV and a motivation letter where your preferred internship topics, internship duration and ideal start date are highlighted.

 

We look forward to meeting you! 

Unilever is an organisation committed to equity, inclusion and diversity to drive our business results and create a better future, every day, for our diverse employees, global consumers, partners, and communities. We believe a diverse workforce allows us to match our growth ambitions and drive inclusion across the business. At Unilever we are interested in every individual bringing their ‘Whole Self’ to work and this includes you! Thus if you require any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of your application so that we can support you through your recruitment journey.

4183639369,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-power-bi-at-laco-4183639369?position=4&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=0FSan9%2BUU3F9M0amj%2BcZXg%3D%3D,Data Analyst - Power BI,LACO,"Flemish Region, Belgium","Wij zoeken een Data Analyst / Power BI-expert om ons Microsoft-team te versterken!

LACO is een Belgisch bedrijf dat gespecialiseerd is in business intelligence en data-analyse, met meer dan 35 jaar ervaring. Als Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner hebben we uitgebreide expertise op gebieden zoals Microsoft BI en Data Governance. Met meer dan 120 consultants helpen we bedrijven succesvol te zijn met data. Bij LACO combineren we toewijding met een vleugje plezier in alles wat we doen.

Bij ons staan langetermijnrelaties met klanten en collega’s centraal. Onlangs hebben we enkele grote projecten binnengehaald bij belangrijke klanten, en daarom willen we ons Microsoft-team versterken om samen met het LACO-team end-to-endprojecten te realiseren.
Als Data Analyst/Power BI-expert bij LACO ben je verantwoordelijk voor:
Het begrijpen en in kaart brengen van de bedrijfsvereisten.
Het verzamelen, opschonen en voorbewerken van gegevens uit diverse bronnen.
Het nauw samenwerken met multifunctionele teams en je expertise in Power BI inzetten om overtuigende visualisaties en rapporten te maken.
Het ontwerpen, optimaliseren en ontwikkelen van Power BI-rapporten en dashboards die voldoen aan de bedrijfsbehoeften en -vereisten.
Het samenwerken met stakeholders om gegevensvereisten te verzamelen en te begrijpen, en zorgen voor nauwkeurige en consistente data.
Het oplossen van problemen met Power BI-rapporten en het omzetten van complexe datasets in bruikbare inzichten door middel van datavisualisaties.
Het up-to-date blijven met de nieuwste Power BI- en Microsoft Fabric-functionaliteiten en best practices om uit te blinken in deze rol.
Je hebt een bachelor- en/of masterdiploma in computerwetenschappen of een gelijkwaardige opleiding.
Je hebt minstens 3 jaar aantoonbare ervaring als Power BI Developer of in een vergelijkbare rol.
Je bent bekend met programmeertalen zoals SQL, DAX en Python.
Je kunt data modelleren met technieken zoals Kimball, Dimensional Modelling en Data Vault.
Je bent bedreven in Power BI, inclusief DAX, datamodellering en custom visuals.
Goede kennis hebt van Azure Synapse, Data Factory en Databricks.
Vertrouwd bent met diverse soorten gegevensopslag voor gestructureerde data.
Een sterke communicator bent en goed in teamverband kunt werken.
Vloeiend bent in Nederlands en Engels.
We werken graag samen met zowel werknemers als freelancers.
Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk salarispakket en uitstekende extralegale voordelen.
Je krijgt toegang tot opleidingsmogelijkheden om je kennis te vergroten en je carrière verder te ontwikkelen.
Je werkt mee aan innovatieve Microsoft-trajecten die je uitdagen en inspireren.
Geniet van een geweldige bedrijfscultuur met ruimte voor leuke evenementen zoals familiedagen, jaarlijkse skireizen, sportevenementen, spelavonden, …
Laat deze kans niet aan je datavingers voorbijgaan!
Neem contact op met ons Talent Acquisition-team en begin jouw avontuur naar succes.

Wij zoeken een Data Analyst / Power BI-expert om ons Microsoft-team te versterken!


Over LACO

LACO is een Belgisch bedrijf dat gespecialiseerd is in business intelligence en data-analyse, met meer dan 35 jaar ervaring. Als Microsoft Data &
column2:
AI Solutions Partner hebben we uitgebreide expertise op gebieden zoals Microsoft BI en Data Governance. Met meer dan 120 consultants helpen we bedrijven succesvol te zijn met data. Bij LACO combineren we toewijding met een vleugje plezier in alles wat we doen.


Bij ons staan langetermijnrelaties met klanten en collega’s centraal. Onlangs hebben we enkele grote projecten binnengehaald bij belangrijke klanten, en daarom willen we ons Microsoft-team versterken om samen met het LACO-team end-to-endprojecten te realiseren.


Jouw rol

Als Data Analyst/Power BI-expert bij LACO ben je verantwoordelijk voor:

  • Het begrijpen en in kaart brengen van de bedrijfsvereisten.
  • Het verzamelen, opschonen en voorbewerken van gegevens uit diverse bronnen.
  • Het nauw samenwerken met multifunctionele teams en je expertise in Power BI inzetten om overtuigende visualisaties en rapporten te maken.
  • Het ontwerpen, optimaliseren en ontwikkelen van Power BI-rapporten en dashboards die voldoen aan de bedrijfsbehoeften en -vereisten.
  • Het samenwerken met stakeholders om gegevensvereisten te verzamelen en te begrijpen, en zorgen voor nauwkeurige en consistente data.
  • Het oplossen van problemen met Power BI-rapporten en het omzetten van complexe datasets in bruikbare inzichten door middel van datavisualisaties.
  • Het up-to-date blijven met de nieuwste Power BI- en Microsoft Fabric-functionaliteiten en best practices om uit te blinken in deze rol.


Jouw vaardigheden

  • Je hebt een bachelor- en/of masterdiploma in computerwetenschappen of een gelijkwaardige opleiding.
  • Je hebt een analytische mindset.
  • Je hebt minstens 3 jaar aantoonbare ervaring als Power BI Developer of in een vergelijkbare rol.
  • Je bent bekend met programmeertalen zoals SQL, DAX en Python.
  • Je kunt data modelleren met technieken zoals Kimball, Dimensional Modelling en Data Vault.
  • Je bent bedreven in Power BI, inclusief DAX, datamodellering en custom visuals.


Bonuspunten als je …

  • Goede kennis hebt van Azure Synapse, Data Factory en Databricks.
  • Vertrouwd bent met diverse soorten gegevensopslag voor gestructureerde data.
  • Een sterke communicator bent en goed in teamverband kunt werken.
  • Vloeiend bent in Nederlands en Engels.


Ons aanbod

  • We werken graag samen met zowel werknemers als freelancers.
  • Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk salarispakket en uitstekende extralegale voordelen.
  • Je krijgt toegang tot opleidingsmogelijkheden om je kennis te vergroten en je carrière verder te ontwikkelen.
  • Je werkt mee aan innovatieve Microsoft-trajecten die je uitdagen en inspireren.
  • Geniet van een geweldige bedrijfscultuur met ruimte voor leuke evenementen zoals familiedagen, jaarlijkse skireizen, sportevenementen, spelavonden, …


Laat deze kans niet aan je datavingers voorbijgaan!

Neem contact op met ons Talent Acquisition-team en begin jouw avontuur naar succes.

4152717081,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-cream-consulting-4152717081?position=5&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=iCS3VYp4BH%2FY3qU2%2BYxboQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Cream Consulting,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"Permanent position only

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.
And Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues :-)
WHAT IS A DATA ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Benjamin, Data Analyst, you participate in the construction of the data strategy of our clients. You have a key role by helping them to deliver valuable insight based on their data. You are part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team.
You dive into a large amount of data :
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets
Producing strategic data analysis and reporting to the business
You contribute to the selection and implementation of the different data analysis tools
In the end, you help the business to optimize the use of their data
HOW WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT:
You have at least 1-year experience in data analysis
You are passionate about data and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business
You are used to work with different data tools such as SQL, SAS, Python, R, Tableau, QlikView, PowerBI, …
You have an analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
You are fluent in French and English
column2: good knowledge of Dutch is an asset

You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with and experiment every day
We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!

4186592784,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/associate-data-analyst-brussels-at-politico-europe-4186592784?position=6&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=SAIkDm3JQHNmnkZNHDAJFg%3D%3D,Associate Data Analyst (Brussels),POLITICO Europe,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Company: POLITICO

Politico is looking for an Associate Data Analyst to join the Data Analytics team based in our Brussels office. The team is responsible for understanding and delivering reporting, analyses and other data capabilities that will enable Politico to achieve its strategic goals. This role will support all of Politico’s business operations, including newsletters, websites, paid-for services and more.
Support Politico’s commercial operations across European and US markets
Gather requirements from business, technical and editorial stakeholders
Discover, clean and organize data into usable datasets
Produce analyses, build reporting and present to stakeholders
Generate visualizations and dashboards that aid business decision-making
Develop materials to explain project findings
Work with the wider team in Brussels and Washington DC to develop skills and knowledge
The following requirements describe an ideal candidate, so we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every single item:
Passionate about Politico’s mission to deliver nonpartisan journalism on politics and policy
Experience with BI tools a plus
Familiarity with modern data warehouses (Snowflake) and cloud platforms (AWS)
Ability to translate business requests into workable analytical tasks
Ability to creatively draw upon available resources to respond to business questions and anticipate potential challenges and how to overcome them
Ability to work with data to produce useful and insightful analysis
Ability to communicate complex analysis to a non-technical audience
Ability to work collaboratively and learn from the wider team

POLITICO is a global news and information company at the intersection of politics and policy. It is the essential online, mobile and print destination for the most influential people in the world. With publications based in Washington, D.C., New York, London, and Brussels, POLITICO boasts an enormous roster of the most talented reporters and editors in the world.

It is POLITICO's policy to provide equal employment opportunity to all qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, age or any other characteristic protected by local laws and regulations.
If you are interested in this opportunity, please send a cover letter and CV in English using the Apply button. Please note that we will only consider complete applications.

Company: POLITICO

Politico is looking for an Associate Data Analyst to join the Data Analytics team based in our Brussels office. The team is responsible for understanding and delivering reporting, analyses and other data capabilities that will enable Politico to achieve its strategic goals. This role will support all of Politico’s business operations, including newsletters, websites, paid-for services and more.

What You’ll Do

  • Support Politico’s commercial operations across European and US markets
  • Gather requirements from business, technical and editorial stakeholders
  • Discover, clean and organize data into usable datasets
  • Produce analyses, build reporting and present to stakeholders
  • Generate visualizations and dashboards that aid business decision-making
  • Develop materials to explain project findings
  • Work with the wider team in Brussels and Washington DC to develop skills and knowledge

What You'll Need

The following requirements describe an ideal candidate, so we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every single item:

  • Passionate about Politico’s mission to deliver nonpartisan journalism on politics and policy
  • Proficiency in SQL
  • Proficiency in Python
  • Experience with BI tools a plus
  • Familiarity with modern data warehouses (Snowflake) and cloud platforms (AWS)
  • Knowledge of Git
  • Knowledge of ETL fundamentals

Skills &
column2:

  • Ability to translate business requests into workable analytical tasks
  • Ability to creatively draw upon available resources to respond to business questions and anticipate potential challenges and how to overcome them
  • Ability to work with data to produce useful and insightful analysis
  • Ability to communicate complex analysis to a non-technical audience
  • Ability to work collaboratively and learn from the wider team

POLITICO is a global news and information company at the intersection of politics and policy. It is the essential online, mobile and print destination for the most influential people in the world. With publications based in Washington, D.C., New York, London, and Brussels, POLITICO boasts an enormous roster of the most talented reporters and editors in the world.

4189900137,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-analyst-at-nipro-corporation-global-4189900137?position=7&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=kPNnyQneQatRlNc9PBuMCg%3D%3D,Business Intelligence Analyst,Nipro Corporation - Global,"Mechelen, Flemish Region, Belgium","About the company:

As a total solution provider of medical devices and pharmaceutical packaging, Nipro Europe Group Companies is continuously committed to improving patient outcomes and quality of life. We are part of a large global network headed by Nipro Corporation Japan, an industry-leading healthcare company with over 38,000 employees worldwide. Our European headquarters in Mechelen, Belgium covers a wide geographical reach (Europe, Africa, India, the Americas) and is home to Nipro Medical EMEA, Nipro PharmaPackaging International, and the Institute for Medical Practice (iMEP) Belgium.

To accommodate our growth, Nipro EMEA is looking for a BI Analyst/Engineer who is dynamic, hands-on, and collaborative to join us in our Data Analytics team, based in our European headquarters office in Mechelen, Belgium.

You will be working in a team that designs, develops, and maintains data warehouses and data lakes. You will integrate various data sources, develop interactive dashboards, and analyse large datasets to provide valuable business insights.
Design, develop, and maintain data warehouses and data lakes.
Integrate various data sources ensuring accuracy and integrity.
Develop interactive dashboards and reports to visualize insights.
Analyse large datasets to identify trends and opportunities.
Collaborate with departments to understand data needs.
Document data processes and support data-related queries.
Bachelor's or master's degree in Computer Science or related field.
5+ years of experience as a BI analyst/engineer.
Experience with Azure, Snowflake, and PowerBI.
Join a global leader in healthcare with a commitment to improving patient outcomes.
Be part of a dynamic and growing team in a supportive work environment.
Opportunity to make a significant impact on data strategies and operations.
Career growth and development opportunities within a global network.

About the company:

As a total solution provider of medical devices and pharmaceutical packaging, Nipro Europe Group Companies is continuously committed to improving patient outcomes and quality of life. We are part of a large global network headed by Nipro Corporation Japan, an industry-leading healthcare company with over 38,000 employees worldwide. Our European headquarters in Mechelen, Belgium covers a wide geographical reach (Europe, Africa, India, the Americas) and is home to Nipro Medical EMEA, Nipro PharmaPackaging International, and the Institute for Medical Practice (iMEP) Belgium.


To accommodate our growth, Nipro EMEA is looking for a BI Analyst/Engineer who is dynamic, hands-on, and collaborative to join us in our Data Analytics team, based in our European headquarters office in Mechelen, Belgium.


About the role

You will be working in a team that designs, develops, and maintains data warehouses and data lakes. You will integrate various data sources, develop interactive dashboards, and analyse large datasets to provide valuable business insights.


What you’ll do

  • Design, develop, and maintain data warehouses and data lakes.
  • Integrate various data sources ensuring accuracy and integrity.
  • Develop interactive dashboards and reports to visualize insights.
  • Analyse large datasets to identify trends and opportunities.
  • Collaborate with departments to understand data needs.
  • Document data processes and support data-related queries.


What you’ll need

  • Bachelor's or master's degree in Computer Science or related field.
  • 5+ years of experience as a BI analyst/engineer.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Knowledge of SQL and/or Python.
  • Experience with Azure, Snowflake, and PowerBI.
  • Hands-on mentality and proactive mindset.


Why you should apply

  • Join a global leader in healthcare with a commitment to improving patient outcomes.
  • Be part of a dynamic and growing team in a supportive work environment.
  • Opportunity to make a significant impact on data strategies and operations.
  • Competitive salary and benefits package.
  • Career growth and development opportunities within a global network.

4180259991,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/marketing-data-analyst-at-innova-solutions-4180259991?position=11&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=lozEAZ2Nl%2F%2BAP73HMm7QWQ%3D%3D,Marketing Data Analyst,Innova Solutions,"Brussels Region, Belgium","💼Job Title: Data Scientist
🌐Language: English: Fluent spoken and written Dutch: Fluent/Good level OR French: Fluent/Good level
🔥Keywords: Predictive Analytics, AI Models, Data Science, Python, Marketing Campaigns

Our client is a is a prominent telecommunications company known for its extensive network infrastructure and comprehensive range of services. It provides innovative solutions in internet, mobile, and television communications, catering to both residential and business customers.

The Predictive Analytics team within the Marketing and Communication department aims to provide predictive AI models to enable impactful and efficient campaigns by optimizing reach and relevance for customers and augmenting employees in the campaigning process.

We are looking for a medior/senior data scientist with a proven track record in building and deploying data science models to support marketing campaigns. You will be part of a data science team and will work on the following:
Tackle various business challenges by creating AI models to enhance client experiences, empower employees, and optimize internal processes.
Utilize a range of analytical methodologies within predictive AI, including large language models, classical statistical/machine learning techniques, and uplift modeling.
Capture business needs, perform data analyses, build models, and identify relevant target groups to achieve business objectives. Set up tests to measure model impact.
Inform, advise, and support Marketing & Communications Managers on the use of predictive models.
Present complex technical concepts as clear, actionable insights for Marketing & Communication Managers.
Follow up on production runs from data preparation, scoring, and validation of AI models. Maintain and monitor model performance to detect quality issues.
Support the creation of new variables (data engineering) and continuous improvement cycles of models.
Demonstrate extensive experience in programming with Python and contribute to deploying AI models in production using a comprehensive stack of tools.
Apply guidelines and best practices for responsible AI.
Collaborate with a team of motivated data scientists eager to learn, share expertise, and work together.

At least a Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline such as statistics, mathematics, or computer science. Candidates with other academic backgrounds with substantial experience in data science are also encouraged to apply.
At least 3 years of relevant experience.
Mandatory: Strong expertise in Python and Python data science environment (e.g., deep learning), Git, bash, SQL.
Preferable: Experience with Domino Data Science Platform, SAS, recommender systems, language models, optimization under constraints, Django.
Preferable: Experience in campaigning, direct marketing, A/B testing.

Innova Solutions is a diverse and award-winning global technology services partner. We provide our clients with strategic technology, talent, and business transformation solutions, enabling them to be leaders in their field.
Founded in 1998, headquartered in Atlanta (Duluth), Georgia.
Employs over 50,000 professionals worldwide, with annual revenue approaching $3.0B.
Delivers strategic technology and business transformation solutions globally.
Operates through global delivery centers across North America, Asia, and Europe.
Provides services for data center migration and workload development for cloud service providers.
Women’s Choice Awards - Best Companies to Work for Women & Millennials, 2024
Forbes, America’s Best Temporary Staffing and Best Professional Recruiting Firms, 2023
American Best in Business, Globee Awards, Healthcare Vulnerability Technology Solutions, 2023
Global Health & Pharma, Best Full Service Workforce Lifecycle Management Enterprise, 2023
Received 3 SBU Leadership in Business Awards
Stevie International Business Awards, Denials Remediation Healthcare Technology Solutions, 2023

The responsibility of the Insights Analyst is to analyze in store customer behavior to address customer questions and provide KPIs to customers. They will also address custom questions from customers using video analysis and python to model customer behavior and provide aggregated insights into customer behavior and performance of various areas in store. They will work closely with the AA Lead to ensure solutions and projects are ready to be delivered to customers.
Have a strong ability to visualize how our data represents shoppers moving through spaces, and to use the best methodology to draw out the right answer, or develop new methodologies as needed
Identifying and surfacing challenges in the data or timelines to the Analytics Lead and providing thoughtful solutions
Be a technical counterpart to REM team, translating pre-defined project specifications into accurate, clear and properly formatted outputs within established timelines
Apply expertise in quantitative analysis and data visualization to surface any potential challenges with data, project scope or timelines
Attend meetings with the Retail Engagement Manager teams as needed to understand their needs and explain results, methodologies etc.
Ability to be a data expert and successfully create and use best methodologies to solve customer questions or requests
Understanding of Python in order to best address specific customer needs
Understanding of the RetailNext product to better answer customer questions as needed
Ability to problem solve through customer issues and requests using RetailNext data
What's It Like to Work Here?
Remote-First Hybrid: Work anywhere + office access.
90-Day Work Anywhere: Work from anywhere for 90 days yearly.
Autonomy & Growth: Flexible schedules, ownership, career investment.
Customer Obsessed: Everything we do is for our clients.
Best Self Allowance: Annual stipend for personal growth.
Recharge Days: Monthly company-wide day off.
Career Growth: We invest in you.
Join us and transform retail with data-driven insights! Apply now

Job Summary:

The responsibility of the Insights Analyst is to analyze in store customer behavior to address customer questions and provide KPIs to customers. They will also address custom questions from customers using video analysis and python to model customer behavior and provide aggregated insights into customer behavior and performance of various areas in store. They will work closely with the AA Lead to ensure solutions and projects are ready to be delivered to customers.

Responsibilities:

  • Data Expertise
    • Have a strong ability to visualize how our data represents shoppers moving through spaces, and to use the best methodology to draw out the right answer, or develop new methodologies as needed
    • Identifying and surfacing challenges in the data or timelines to the Analytics Lead and providing thoughtful solutions
  • Project Work
    • Be a technical counterpart to REM team, translating pre-defined project specifications into accurate, clear and properly formatted outputs within established timelines
    • Apply expertise in quantitative analysis and data visualization to surface any potential challenges with data, project scope or timelines
    • Attend meetings with the Retail Engagement Manager teams as needed to understand their needs and explain results, methodologies etc.
Skills:

  • Ability to be a data expert and successfully create and use best methodologies to solve customer questions or requests

Knowledge:

  • Understanding of Python in order to best address specific customer needs
  • Understanding of the RetailNext product to better answer customer questions as needed

Talents:

  • Ability to problem solve through customer issues and requests using RetailNext data

4202456599,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-koda-staff-4202456599?position=13&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=nhLQbLVTTkbHaSHuVtES4A%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Koda Staff,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Job Title: Permanent Data Analyst
Location: Brussels (3 days per week onsite)

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our team. This role requires a strong technical background, the ability to work with complex data, and experience engaging with multiple stakeholders.
Work within a feature team, analyzing large and complex datasets.
Write and optimize Python and SQL queries to extract, transform, and analyze data.
Utilize ETL processes and work within Azure Databricks.
Collaborate closely with Data Engineers and other technical teams.
Interpret and translate business needs into actionable insights.
Engage with multiple stakeholders across different departments.
Ensure data accuracy and contribute to decision-making processes.
4+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, working with complex datasets.
Strong proficiency in Python, SQL, ETL, and Azure Databricks.
Ability to understand and dive into the technical aspect of data pipelines and code.
Experience working in large teams rather than small teams with a single analyst.
Strong stakeholder management skills, with the ability to explain technical insights in a business-friendly manner.
Retail industry experience or a strong affinity for customer-related data.
Fluency in English and French (spoken and written).
Experience working with cloud platforms and modern data infrastructures.
Familiarity with customer analytics and behavioral data.
First stage: Interview with HR and CTO.
Second stage: Technical interview with team members.

Job Title: Permanent Data Analyst


Location: Brussels (3 days per week onsite)

Languages: English &
column2:
French

Seniority Level: 4+ years of experience

Reports to: Head of Analytics


About the Role

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our team. This role requires a strong technical background, the ability to work with complex data, and experience engaging with multiple stakeholders.


Key Responsibilities

  • Work within a feature team, analyzing large and complex datasets.
  • Write and optimize Python and SQL queries to extract, transform, and analyze data.
  • Utilize ETL processes and work within Azure Databricks.
  • Collaborate closely with Data Engineers and other technical teams.
  • Interpret and translate business needs into actionable insights.
  • Engage with multiple stakeholders across different departments.
  • Ensure data accuracy and contribute to decision-making processes.


Requirements

  • 4+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, working with complex datasets.
  • Strong proficiency in Python, SQL, ETL, and Azure Databricks.
  • Ability to understand and dive into the technical aspect of data pipelines and code.
  • Experience working in large teams rather than small teams with a single analyst.
  • Strong stakeholder management skills, with the ability to explain technical insights in a business-friendly manner.
  • Retail industry experience or a strong affinity for customer-related data.
  • Fluency in English and French (spoken and written).


Nice-to-Have

  • Experience working with cloud platforms and modern data infrastructures.
  • Familiarity with customer analytics and behavioral data.


Interview Process

  1. First stage: Interview with HR and CTO.
  2. Second stage: Technical interview with team members.

Nexeo Belgium is a consultancy company that supports its clients in the banking, finance and insurance sectors in all phases of their transformation projects: from business consulting to the implementation of IT solutions.
As a consultant you will have the opportunity to be part of Nexeo:
International environment ( Offices in France, Belgium, Luxembourg, Switzerland & Canada)

The ideal candidate will use their passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users.
Understand the day-to-day issues that the bank faces
Performs cleansing of data quality issues through the analysi
Monitors the data quality based on data quality dashboards, supports redesign & upgrade

Contributes to raising awareness of the importance of data quality
Will be involved in all the topics related to Customer Data
Work in collaboration with other technical teams to share data
Industrialize the process to run define periodicity
Document the project (functional and technical part)
Contribute to the achievement of the team objectives
At least 3 years of experience in Data Analysis (focus data quality & data governance)
Understand data lifecycle and data usage
Good experience working with SQL Queries & SAS
English Fluent & French or Dutch native

4181347734,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analytics-analyst-at-etex-4181347734?position=15&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=oDgBBSHEU7xr%2FiLpyBaQaA%3D%3D,Analytics Analyst,Etex,"Kapelle-op-den-Bos, Flemish Region, Belgium","At Etex, our purpose is to inspire new ways of living. We are an international leader in sustainable construction, driven by a passion for excellence, but it's our people that are our top priority. We connect, collaborate, and champion the well-being of our employees, forming partnerships and pioneering change in our ever-evolving industry.
At Etex, we seek to make a meaningful impact in the lives of our customers and our communities.

Are you looking for a company where you can learn, grow & lead? Join us as Analytics Analyst and drive digital excellence!You will join the Analytics Operations domain, covering functional domains like Supply Chain, Manufacturing and ESG.
Understand the purpose & goal of the data product and the value it brings to business.
Build a prototype with the support of a BI Developer and/or Data Engineer to get the requirements right.
Design the reporting data model (I.e. star schema) that is fit for the requirements.
Detail & document the requirements coming from the demand intake (discovery phase) to a level of granularity so the BI Developer and/or Data Engineer can start executing their designs and builds.
Interact closely with the BPO areas to clarify requirements and understand value creation.
Work closely together with the IT application owners to align on the source data model and the way data will be provided (data exchange agreement).
Translate and documents requirements into a high-level solution design mapped on the current Data Platform architecture.
Bridge the gap between BPO areas and the technical delivery team (BI Developers / Data Engineers).
Knowledge of data analysis, incl. collecting and elaborating business requirements.
Basic knowledge of the agile way of working.
Experience with creating reports and dashboards.
Knowledge of BI-tools and databases (like Power BI, Databricks, DAX, etc.).

We are named the world's #1 most trustworthy company in the construction sector by Newsweek and Statista in 2023! And one of the top companies to grow your career in Belgium in 2023 according to LinkedIn!

Our culture – we connect & care about those around us. We nurture teamwork, communities, partnerships and new ways of working, placing the highest importance on the safety and working environment of our people.

Our ‘Road to Sustainability 2030’ is our plan to help build a better, sustainable future. We work towards this vision by caring about our social and environmental impacts and developing innovative solutions

We have a strong conviction that diversity of thinking helps us to deliver a strong and sustainable performance. It is also essential for us that everyone feels part of the team. In this spirit, we are committed to equal opportunities and zero tolerance towards discrimination
Flexibility: For us, hybrid and flexible working is all about trust, and we want you to be able to do your best work.

At Etex, our purpose is to inspire new ways of living. We are an international leader in sustainable construction, driven by a passion for excellence, but it's our people that are our top priority. We connect, collaborate, and champion the well-being of our employees, forming partnerships and pioneering change in our ever-evolving industry.

At Etex, we seek to make a meaningful impact in the lives of our customers and our communities.

4183871626,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-data-consultant-at-capco-4183871626?position=17&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=lQno6ZZ%2BEB4uc5UaHjUMFg%3D%3D,Data Analyst / Data Consultant,Capco,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Data Analyst / Data consultant
Are you interested in expanding your consulting exposure? Do you want to move away from an operations role and make an impact on the business?
Do you often feel like processes and ways of working could be better or more efficient?
Capco is a global management consultancy specialising in driving transformation across investment banking, securities services, and insurance.
We have the people, the vision, and the passion.

We are going through a significant growth journey, and now is a very good time to join us as we expand geographically, increase headcount and disrupt the consulting market across Central Europa with entrepreneurial and agile thinking.
In your role as a Consultant at Capco, you play a key role in the delivery of projects and gain wider exposure to our wider Investment Banking business.
You will work closely with senior clients to deliver large-scale change initiatives for leading global banks.
Fitting that description, you will also need to be a supremely motivated person and able to work in a team where clients become colleagues too.
We Are Looking For Talent With The Following
Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis
Professional experience of minimum 2 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the financial industry or a consultancy firm
Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
Fluency in French or Dutch AND excellent knowledge of English
The opportunity to join a growing, thought leading, global team of data professionals

An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers

Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts. Our learning materials cover all areas of data (Governance, Management, Manipulation, Decision science, Engineering)
A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients

Data Analyst / Data consultant

Are you interested in expanding your consulting exposure? Do you want to move away from an operations role and make an impact on the business?

Do you often feel like processes and ways of working could be better or more efficient?

Capco is a global management consultancy specialising in driving transformation across investment banking, securities services, and insurance.

We have the people, the vision, and the passion.

We are going through a significant growth journey, and now is a very good time to join us as we expand geographically, increase headcount and disrupt the consulting market across Central Europa with entrepreneurial and agile thinking.

In your role as a Consultant at Capco, you play a key role in the delivery of projects and gain wider exposure to our wider Investment Banking business.

You will work closely with senior clients to deliver large-scale change initiatives for leading global banks.

Fitting that description, you will also need to be a supremely motivated person and able to work in a team where clients become colleagues too.

We Are Looking For Talent With The Following

  • Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
  • Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
  • Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
  • Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
  • Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
  • Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
  • Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis

Skills &
column2:
Expertise

  • Professional experience of minimum 2 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the financial industry or a consultancy firm
  • Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
  • Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
  • Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
  • Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
  • You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
  • Fluency in French or Dutch AND excellent knowledge of English

What We Offer You

  • The opportunity to join a growing, thought leading, global team of data professionals
  • An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers
  • Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts. Our learning materials cover all areas of data (Governance, Management, Manipulation, Decision science, Engineering)
  • A hybrid (on-site/remote) work environment
  • A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
  • A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
  • A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture

4142330133,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/digital-intelligence-data-analyst-at-ogilvy-social-lab-belgium-4142330133?position=18&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=6SdNzZwVnWf9yxNWFkFPBA%3D%3D,Digital Intelligence & Data Analyst,Ogilvy Social.Lab Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","About Ogilvy

Ogilvy has been creating impact for brands through iconic, culture-changing, value-driving ideas since the company was founded by David Ogilvy 75 years ago. It builds on that rich legacy through Borderless Creativity – innovating at the intersections of its advertising, public relations, relationship design, consulting, and health capabilities with experts collaborating seamlessly across over 120 offices in nearly 90 countries. Ogilvy currently ranks as the #1 global agency network for creative excellence and effectiveness by WARC, signifying its ability to deliver creative solutions that drive unreasonable impact for clients and communities. Ogilvy is a WPP company (NYSE: WPP). For more information, visit Ogilvy.com, and follow us on LinkedIn, X, Instagram, and Facebook.

Ogilvy Social.Lab (OSL) is a full-service advertising agency headquartered in Brussels’ WPP Campus. As part of the international Ogilvy network, our operations span four continents with over 15 nationalities on the 130-strong team working in our offices – our mindset is borderless.

We proudly collaborate with prominent international and regional clients, including Absolut, Unilever, Mondelez, Ford, IKEA, Lidl, Orange, EU and Belgian institutions, fueling their success locally & internationally.

Entrepreneurship pulses through our veins, embodying our name with a ""lab” mentality. We constantly innovate and experiment, staying in sync with the ever-evolving digital media landscape we specialize in.

Analyse social and digital data through a set of tools (Social Listening tools like Synthesio, Competitive Analysis tools like RivalIQ, Audience Analysis tools like Profiler or Global Web Index, Trends and Search Analysis tools like Semrush or Social Lab Proprietary Tools, etc.) based on a client briefing. Develop custom approaches leveraging available data sets and technologies to deliver on actionable insights to inform strategic recommendations.
Support planners in developing data-validated strategies bringing data richness to what consumers, communities or creators are ‘saying’, ‘sharing’ and ‘searching’ online.
Design insightful reports and audits with strategic recommendations.
Deliver high-quality service to local and international clients.
Participate in the creation of new, commercially viable data products.
Work with our clients and present the intelligence work.
Collaborate with WPP and external data providers.
A first experience in Social/Digital/Search Data Analytics, Insights and Digital/Social Strategy
Always-on social listening analysis and insights generation.
Cultural tracking (including trends) and insights generation for always-on and campaign use.
A strong understanding of today’s social media landscape and internet culture (Social 3.0, culture-first, community and creators led, audience-first) and new channels’ codes.
A strong understanding of Social media performance metrics/KPIs for both organic and paid media.
You understand how to apply qualitative and quantitative learnings and turn them into actionable insights
Eye for innovation and the next emerging platform or partner.
Comfortable using social and digital monitoring technologies such as Synthesio, Brandwatch, Meltwater, Semrush, etc.
Expert in the understanding of social media and established understanding of the wider digital communication landscape.
Ability to work effectively, proactively and seamlessly amongst an integrated agency team.
Fulltime opportunity in an ever-growing, trendsetting advertising agency based in the greenest building in Brussels – the new WPP Campus.
Work alongside a team of diverse and people-focused individuals, on impactful projects and with an array of local, regional and global clients.
We are committed to keeping our environmental footprint low and ensuring that our work is ethical.
We thrive on transparency – Our words and promises produce actions.
As an Ogilvy Social.Lab employee, you will be provided with continuous opportunities to grow through training and career conversations while doing strong work that works.

At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression.
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose - and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality.

Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve. This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.

Ogilvy is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to particular characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.

If you need any assistance seeking a job opportunity, or if you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please contact us at accommodations@ogilvy.com. Please note that this contact is only for candidates who are requesting accommodation. Emails for other purposes, including application status requests, will not receive a response.

4184908872,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-analyst-power-bi-at-capgemini-engineering-4184908872?position=20&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=ehGl6c4JuzZcSS6wlIKKtQ%3D%3D,Business Analyst (Power BI),Capgemini Engineering,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"About the Job

Joining Capgemini Engineering means becoming part of a global organization that drives innovation and growth. With over 55 years of experience, a presence in 30 countries, and more than 55 000 employees, we offer an environment where you can elevate your career to new heights.

And that’s not all! As a Business Analyst (Power BI), you will play a key role for the Business planning process and product management activities for several accessories (for example winter complete wheels, styling accessories, multimedia accessories, transport accessories, safety and comfort accessories) for vehicle models. Together with your team, you will work on exciting projects in the automotive industry!
Capgemini Engineering: Get The Future You Want
In this role, you will be responsible for:
Collaborating with diverse teams to identify, clarify, document and communicate business requirements according to client’s business needs.
Actively contributing to the success of projects by doing Market analysis/Competitor analysis/Sales analysis.
Building strong, sustainable relationships to coordinate and communicate with stakeholders to translate their needs into business requirements.
At Capgemini Engineering, we’re looking for someone who:
Has a passion for Data and business intelligence project.
Brings at least 1 year of experience in Business intelligence tools (Power BI, …).
Knowledge of project management tools (Jira, MS Project…).
Language Skills: Fluent in English. French and/or Dutch is a plus.
Master’s degree Business Engineering, Computer Sciences, Business Administration, Business Management, Suppy Chain or equivalent.
Success in this role often comes down to:
Strong communication skills: You can convey complex ideas clearly and persuasively.
Teamwork: You excel at collaborating and building meaningful relationships.
Organizational talent: You maintain oversight and prioritize effectively in a dynamic environment.
Problem-solving ability: You think creatively and tackle challenges proactively.
At Capgemini Engineering, we offer more than just a job:
A full-time position with attractive secondary benefits.
A competitive salary package, including a company car, laptop, meal vouchers, bonus system, and more.
Training and development: Access to courses and certifications to enhance your skills.
Flexibility: A hybrid work model that supports work-life balance.
Regular company outings and events to celebrate success together.
Our recruitment process includes the following steps:
An initial interview with a Talent Acquisition Professional.
A discussion with one of our People Managers to ensure the right fit.
A meeting with our Technical Colleagues to assess your skills and experience.
Ready for the next step? Apply now and explore how your future could look at Capgemini Engineering!

About the Job

Joining Capgemini Engineering means becoming part of a global organization that drives innovation and growth. With over 55 years of experience, a presence in 30 countries, and more than 55 000 employees, we offer an environment where you can elevate your career to new heights.

And that’s not all! As a Business Analyst (Power BI), you will play a key role for the Business planning process and product management activities for several accessories (for example winter complete wheels, styling accessories, multimedia accessories, transport accessories, safety and comfort accessories) for vehicle models. Together with your team, you will work on exciting projects in the automotive industry!

Capgemini Engineering: Get The Future You Want

Your Responsibilities

In this role, you will be responsible for:

  • Collaborating with diverse teams to identify, clarify, document and communicate business requirements according to client’s business needs.
  • Actively contributing to the success of projects by doing Market analysis/Competitor analysis/Sales analysis.
  • Building strong, sustainable relationships to coordinate and communicate with stakeholders to translate their needs into business requirements.
  • Business case and financial analysis.
  • Project management – Stakeholder management.
  • Data analysis.


Your Profile

At Capgemini Engineering, we’re looking for someone who:

  • Has a passion for Data and business intelligence project.
  • Brings at least 1 year of experience in Business intelligence tools (Power BI, …).
  • Knowledge of project management tools (Jira, MS Project…).
  • Language Skills: Fluent in English. French and/or Dutch is a plus.
  • Master’s degree Business Engineering, Computer Sciences, Business Administration, Business Management, Suppy Chain or equivalent.


Success in this role often comes down to:

Strong communication skills: You can convey complex ideas clearly and persuasively.

Teamwork: You excel at collaborating and building meaningful relationships.

Organizational talent: You maintain oversight and prioritize effectively in a dynamic environment.

Problem-solving ability: You think creatively and tackle challenges proactively.


What We Offer

At Capgemini Engineering, we offer more than just a job:

  • A full-time position with attractive secondary benefits.
  • A competitive salary package, including a company car, laptop, meal vouchers, bonus system, and more.
  • Training and development: Access to courses and certifications to enhance your skills.
  • Flexibility: A hybrid work model that supports work-life balance.
  • Regular company outings and events to celebrate success together.


Recruitment Process

Our recruitment process includes the following steps:

  1. A first screening via phone
  2. An initial interview with a Talent Acquisition Professional.
  3. A discussion with one of our People Managers to ensure the right fit.
  4. A meeting with our Technical Colleagues to assess your skills and experience.


Ready for the next step? Apply now and explore how your future could look at Capgemini Engineering!

As a Big Data Analyst, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing big data solutions to support business objectives. You will work with large, complex data sets and be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to identify trends and insights. . You would join various teams working in the Energy, Retail, Banking or Telecom sectors.

SII is a European digital and engineering services company of 16,000 experts. SII Belgium supports large businesses in adopting new technologies and innovation management. SII values empowerment and entrepreneurship, providing a fulfilling work environment for employees. Our mission is to contribute to the design and development of future products and services for customers. SII is committed to a sustainable digital world and is recognized as a Great Workplace.
Develop and maintain big data solutions to support business objectives
Analyze and interpret large, complex data sets to identify trends and insights
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement data-driven solutions
Create and maintain data visualization and reporting tools to support decision-making
Integration between enterprise architecture and data collection.
Stay up to date with industry trends and technologies to identify new opportunities for data analysis
You hold a bachelor’s or master’s degree in IT.
Minimum of 3 years of experience working with data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Hive…
Strong analytical skills and experience using statistical techniques to interpret data
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools such as Tableau and Power BI
Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French, and fluent in English.
A challenging and varied role in a growing company
Opportunity to work with the latest technologies
Opportunity to improve your skills and knowledge through training and education
Warm and open company culture, supported by an international group
If you are passionate about Data and want to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at SII Belgium.

SII Belgium is currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Big Data to join our team. As a Big Data Analyst, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing big data solutions to support business objectives. You will work with large, complex data sets and be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to identify trends and insights. . You would join various teams working in the Energy, Retail, Banking or Telecom sectors.

SII is a European digital and engineering services company of 16,000 experts. SII Belgium supports large businesses in adopting new technologies and innovation management. SII values empowerment and entrepreneurship, providing a fulfilling work environment for employees. Our mission is to contribute to the design and development of future products and services for customers. SII is committed to a sustainable digital world and is recognized as a Great Workplace.  

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and maintain big data solutions to support business objectives
  • Analyze and interpret large, complex data sets to identify trends and insights
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement data-driven solutions
  • Create and maintain data visualization and reporting tools to support decision-making
  • Integration between enterprise architecture and data collection.
  • Stay up to date with industry trends and technologies to identify new opportunities for data analysis

Qualifications:

  • You hold a bachelor’s or master’s degree in IT.
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience working with data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Hive…
  • Strong analytical skills and experience using statistical techniques to interpret data
  • Experience with data visualization and reporting tools such as Tableau and Power BI
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills
  • Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
  • You are fluent in Dutch and/or French, and fluent in English.

We offer:

  • A challenging and varied role in a growing company
  • Opportunity to work with the latest technologies
  • Competitive salary and benefits
  • Opportunity to improve your skills and knowledge through training and education
  • Warm and open company culture, supported by an international group

If you are passionate about Data and want to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at SII Belgium.

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

At KPMG, we believe in harnessing the power of data to drive better business decisions. Our team of consultants works alongside clients to help them transform raw data into actionable insights that fuel strategic growth. As a global leader in audit, tax, and advisory services, we combine deep industry expertise with cutting-edge technologies to deliver innovative solutions.

As a Business Intelligence (BI) Consultant, you will play a key role in helping our clients unlock the potential of their data. You will work on a variety of projects across different industries, focusing on improving decision-making processes, enhancing reporting capabilities, and developing data-driven strategies. You will collaborate closely with both internal teams and clients to ensure that data is collected, structured, and visualized in a way that drives value.
Partner with clients to understand their data challenges and business objectives
Design and implement BI solutions, including dashboards and reports
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and optimize data models
Conduct data analysis to identify trends, anomalies, and insights
Provide recommendations to improve data management and reporting processes
Stay updated with the latest BI tools and technologies
Contribute to project management by ensuring timely and quality delivery
Strong experience in data analysis, reporting, and BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Qlik) Proficiency in SQL and data modeling techniques
Ability to translate complex data into clear and actionable insights
Good communication skills to interact effectively with clients and teams
A passion for problem-solving and a detail-oriented approach
Team player with a collaborative mindset
Willingness to learn and adapt to new challenges
A good communication knowledge of Dutch & English
A corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other’s beliefs and background.
Professional experiences in an international and dynamic working environment with inspiring colleagues.
Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working on different locations: home office, on-site or on the go.
A wide range of teambuilding activities and social events that enable new joiners to meet colleagues within the wider KPMG community and have some fun along the way.

At KPMG, we believe in harnessing the power of data to drive better business decisions. Qualifications

  • Strong experience in data analysis, reporting, and BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Qlik) Proficiency in SQL and data modeling techniques
  • Ability to translate complex data into clear and actionable insights
  • Good communication skills to interact effectively with clients and teams
  • A passion for problem-solving and a detail-oriented approach
  • Team player with a collaborative mindset
  • Willingness to learn and adapt to new challenges
  • A good communication knowledge of Dutch &
column4:
English

We offer

  • A corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
  • An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other’s beliefs and background.
  • Professional experiences in an international and dynamic working environment with inspiring colleagues.
  • Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working on different locations: home office, on-site or on the go.
  • A wide range of teambuilding activities and social events that enable new joiners to meet colleagues within the wider KPMG community and have some fun along the way.

4165278033,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-analytics-lead-at-semetis-4165278033?position=24&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=5nKsDNQAq9GHxQVgLN04hw%3D%3D,Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead,Semetis,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"📄 Type: Full-time | 📊 Experience: Mid-Senior (4-7 years experience)

At Semetis, we turn data into business growth. We are looking for a Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead to bridge the gap between raw data, marketing intelligence, and strategic decision-making. You will be at the heart of our strategic department, ensuring insights drive real marketing and business impact.
Translate complex data into actionable insights for marketing and business decisions.
Scope and optimize analytics, measurement, and dashboarding projects for top clients.
Work closely with consultants and leadership to define and refine key business KPIs.
Ensure data quality, build meaningful reports, and provide strategic recommendations.
Coach and train teams, fostering a strong data-driven culture at Semetis.
4-7 years experience in analytics, data insights, measurement, or BI.
Expertise in web analytics (GA4, Adobe Analytics, Piwik Pro) and dashboarding (Looker, Power BI, Tableau).
Understanding of business KPIs, ensuring analytics drive marketing and revenue growth.
Strong autonomy and ownership, able to take initiative and drive projects forward.
Some SQL knowledge (or willingness to learn) and familiarity with cloud solutions (Google Cloud, AWS, Azure).
Critical thinker, able to assess what analytics services should and shouldn’t be offered.

At Semetis, we do more than analyse data—we turn it into a competitive advantage. As Belgium’s leading digital agency, we are known for our expertise, innovation, and strong market presence. We are on a mission to push the boundaries of marketing intelligence, shaping the way brands make data-driven decisions.

This is a role with real business impact. You will work closely with leadership, ensuring that analytics isn’t just a reporting tool but a driver of strategic growth. We operate in a fast-moving, entrepreneurial environment where bold ideas, innovation, and experimentation are encouraged. Unlike traditional agencies, Semetis fosters a culture of autonomy, giving you the space to take ownership and make a tangible difference.
If you are passionate about turning analytics into actionable business impact, we would love to hear from you.
Full job description & application details here.
Ready to make an impact? Let’s talk.

📄 Type: Full-time | 📊 Experience: Mid-Senior (4-7 years experience)


At Semetis, we turn data into business growth. We are looking for a Business Intelligence &
column2:
Analytics Lead to bridge the gap between raw data, marketing intelligence, and strategic decision-making. You will be at the heart of our strategic department, ensuring insights drive real marketing and business impact.


Your Mission:

What You Bring:

Why Join Semetis?

At Semetis, we do more than analyse data—we turn it into a competitive advantage. As Belgium’s leading digital agency, we are known for our expertise, innovation, and strong market presence. We are on a mission to push the boundaries of marketing intelligence, shaping the way brands make data-driven decisions.


This is a role with real business impact. You will work closely with leadership, ensuring that analytics isn’t just a reporting tool but a driver of strategic growth. We operate in a fast-moving, entrepreneurial environment where bold ideas, innovation, and experimentation are encouraged. Unlike traditional agencies, Semetis fosters a culture of autonomy, giving you the space to take ownership and make a tangible difference.


If you are passionate about turning analytics into actionable business impact, we would love to hear from you.
