4190173326,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/game-data-analyst-at-gameplay-galaxy-4190173326?position=25&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=xmZmM1hKB4gSH3pK%2FHPBeQ%3D%3D,Game Data Analyst,Gameplay Galaxy,European Economic Area,"Department: Data

We are looking for a talented Game Data Analyst to join our dynamic analytics team. You'll work closely with game teams, using data to drive player retention, improve monetization strategies, and optimize user experience. If you’re excited by data and games, this is the role for you.
All The Responsibilities We'll Trust You With
You’ll collaborate with game development teams to analyze player behavior, identify trends, and provide actionable insights to drive game performance and player engagement.
You’ll create dashboards and visualizations that support key business decisions by presenting clear and data-driven recommendations to senior stakeholders.
You’ll design, implement, and analyze A/B tests to measure the effectiveness of new game features and mechanics.
You’ll work on projects related to the blockchain, analyzing how players engage with decentralized features and in-game economies.
You’ll contribute to advanced analytics projects, including game economy analysis, to enhance monetization strategies and game progression.
You’ll build out new ways to map in-game events, such as stunts, crashes, and progression to optimize player experience.
You’ll continuously drive data literacy within the company, helping stakeholders leverage data effectively for decision-making.
What You'll Bring To The Team
At least 2-3 years of experience in data analytics, preferably within a gaming environment.
Proficient in SQL and Python (or R) for data exploration and analysis.
Strong experience with A/B testing and applied statistics (bonus if familiar with Bayesian statistics).
Experience building dashboards using tools like Metabase, Looker, or Tableau.
Strong analytical skills and a proactive mindset.
A fast learner, able to balance immediate needs with long-term projects.
A collaborative team player, comfortable working with cross-functional teams.
Why You'll Love Working With Us
We’re 100% remote, work wherever you want forever!

We offer unlimited holidays and sick days. Take as much time off as you need, to spend time with your family and friends or just because you feel like playing games all day. We trust our team and want to offer a modern work life balance that allows you to thrive both at work and in your personal life.
You’ll be able to make an impact, to work closely with the rest of the team and its leads to work on one of the most promising upcoming games in the mobile gaming industry and the Web3 space.
You’ll have a comfortable work schedule and stable workload. With a variety of tasks that will allow your constant professional development.
We want our team to grow personally and professionally and support learning opportunities, especially with a focus around new AI tools and methods.
We have a culture that puts our people first. We believe in open communication, creativity and the value of unique contributions from everyone in the team.
We offer a competitive salary in addition to equity option plans.

Department: Data

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote

Description

We are looking for a talented Game Data Analyst to join our dynamic analytics team. You'll work closely with game teams, using data to drive player retention, improve monetization strategies, and optimize user experience. If you’re excited by data and games, this is the role for you.

All The Responsibilities We'll Trust You With

  • You’ll collaborate with game development teams to analyze player behavior, identify trends, and provide actionable insights to drive game performance and player engagement.
  • You’ll create dashboards and visualizations that support key business decisions by presenting clear and data-driven recommendations to senior stakeholders.
  • You’ll design, implement, and analyze A/B tests to measure the effectiveness of new game features and mechanics.
  • You’ll work on projects related to the blockchain, analyzing how players engage with decentralized features and in-game economies.
  • You’ll contribute to advanced analytics projects, including game economy analysis, to enhance monetization strategies and game progression.
  • You’ll build out new ways to map in-game events, such as stunts, crashes, and progression to optimize player experience.
  • You’ll continuously drive data literacy within the company, helping stakeholders leverage data effectively for decision-making.

What You'll Bring To The Team

  • At least 2-3 years of experience in data analytics, preferably within a gaming environment.
  • Proficient in SQL and Python (or R) for data exploration and analysis.
  • Strong experience with A/B testing and applied statistics (bonus if familiar with Bayesian statistics).
  • Experience building dashboards using tools like Metabase, Looker, or Tableau.
  • Strong analytical skills and a proactive mindset.
  • A fast learner, able to balance immediate needs with long-term projects.
  • A collaborative team player, comfortable working with cross-functional teams.

Why You'll Love Working With Us

  • We’re 100% remote, work wherever you want forever!
  • We offer unlimited holidays and sick days. Take as much time off as you need, to spend time with your family and friends or just because you feel like playing games all day. We trust our team and want to offer a modern work life balance that allows you to thrive both at work and in your personal life.
  • You’ll be able to make an impact, to work closely with the rest of the team and its leads to work on one of the most promising upcoming games in the mobile gaming industry and the Web3 space.
  • You’ll have a comfortable work schedule and stable workload. With a variety of tasks that will allow your constant professional development.
  • We want our team to grow personally and professionally and support learning opportunities, especially with a focus around new AI tools and methods.
  • We have a culture that puts our people first. We believe in open communication, creativity and the value of unique contributions from everyone in the team.
  • We offer a competitive salary in addition to equity option plans.

A leading automotive company based in Brussels, known for delivering innovative, data-driven solutions in the industry. They are expanding their team and looking for a skilled BI Analyst to join them on a freelance basis.

We are looking for a Freelance BI Analyst to help the automotive company unlock the power of data to support strategic decisions. This role will involve analyzing large datasets, creating dashboards, and collaborating with business stakeholders to drive impactful insights.
Analyze large datasets and generate actionable insights.
Develop reports and dashboards to support decision-making.
Work with business teams to understand their data needs.
Translate business requirements into BI solutions.
Use BI tools (Power BI, Tableau, QlikView) to create user-friendly dashboards and reports.
Design and implement data models and ETL processes for accurate reporting.

SQL: Advanced SQL skills for querying and manipulating data.
Data Analysis: Strong analytical skills, with the ability to translate complex data into clear insights.
Please forward your CV to Bilal.Tariq@g2recruitment.com

4152730331,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-analyst-at-cream-consulting-4152730331?position=27&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=CW3274vgdC%2BFGcvEz%2B5ngg%3D%3D,Business Intelligence Analyst,Cream Consulting,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Permanent position only

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.
WHAT IS A BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Jean, Business Analyst Business Intelligence, translate the BI needs of the business teams in specifications for the IT department, for both small demands or as part of larger projects (contributions or BI project).
Act as person of contact between Business Engineering Teams and the Development Team
Define the business specifications for BI needs

Participation in (or management of) BI projects, or on the BI tracks of other projects for the engineering activities (requirement definition, impact analysis, process definition), while representing the BI vision (and BI target architecture) that has been defined
Collaboration with data delivery experts to deliver on projects
Understand business requirements and build a functional analysis which covers needs of the business according to our BI reference architecture
HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?
You have a Master degree in Computer Sciences or equivalent by experience
You have good knowledge in BI techniques and tools (BO, SAS, Cognos...)
You have a cultural openness and adaptability, you are rigorous, customer oriented, and you have high communication skills and analytical skills
You are polyvalent and can adapt easily to quickly changing environment
You are capable to think out of the box and maintain in the meantime a pragmatic approach
You are able to work with autonomy while being also a great team player
You are fluent in French and English
column2: a good knowledge of Dutch is also required

column1: You are committed to travelling abroad occasionally upon the client’s request
An experience in concepts: ETL, DWHSE, data & process mining, reporting… could be a real asset
WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?
A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day
We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!
THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,
CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY""

WHAT IS A BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST AT CREAM?

  • Define the business specifications for BI needs
  • Participation in (or management of) BI projects, or on the BI tracks of other projects for the engineering activities (requirement definition, impact analysis, process definition), while representing the BI vision (and BI target architecture) that has been defined
  • Collaboration with data delivery experts to deliver on projects
  • Understand business requirements and build a functional analysis which covers needs of the business according to our BI reference architecture
  • Collaborate with the development team


HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

  • You have a Master degree in Computer Sciences or equivalent by experience
  • You have good knowledge in BI techniques and tools (BO, SAS, Cognos...)
  • You have a cultural openness and adaptability, you are rigorous, customer oriented, and you have high communication skills and analytical skills
  • You are polyvalent and can adapt easily to quickly changing environment
  • You are capable to think out of the box and maintain in the meantime a pragmatic approach
  • You are able to work with autonomy while being also a great team player
  • You are fluent in French and English

4023511495,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-m-f-at-littlebigcode-4023511495?position=29&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=Hde01jLyhn7UrQjwsBA26Q%3D%3D,Data Analyst M/F,LittleBigCode,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","LittleBigCode is a digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by co-building useful applications with our customers for the Society of the future, particularly on subjects related to health, mobility or the environment. For this, we deliver turnkey projects and also work on consulting assignments while developing our own solutions. Finally, we combine Cloud technologies, AGILE methods and DevOps culture to facilitate industrialization and scaling up.
A community of more than 50 enthusiasts of Data Science & Data Engineering domains
International presence & missions – we are launching our new office in Belgium!
Workshops, Innovation contests, customers challenges taken up
As such, we are looking to build our technical team in Belgium ! Join us !
What will be your tasks with us ?
You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data and analysis. You will be working in the following areas:
Business case study with business teams, understanding of business requirements
Analysis of customer data and processes in order to study their valuation
Support Data Scientists & Data Engineers on deployment of AI applications
Creation of dashboards & visualization solutions in order to bring business teams valuable & dynamic insights
Support your customers in the use of the applications you developed
Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations
You have a Master in Engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics…) and you have some experiences as a Data Analyst
You have bases in the realization of dashboards/reporting, the development of Data solutions models and applications starting from-scratch
You are comfortable working with both technical & business stakeholders, thanks to your nice communication skills!
You are fully proficient in Python, SQL and DataViz tools
You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)
Note that we are also big devotees of DevOps so the more you are comfortable with it, all the better!
Fluent in English + in Dutch and/or French

4195458275,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-lending-data-analyst-at-ing-belgium-4195458275?position=30&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=1CNeLtgYZp0qkH0tZTtflQ%3D%3D,Business Lending Data Analyst,ING Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Your role & work environment
As part of the development towards a “More Digital- and Data driven Bank”, ING is renewing the data management capabilities globally.

As a data analyst in Business Lending, you work on a daily basis with (cross-border) colleagues having different expertise in self-steering feature teams (squads), contributing to the objectives of the tribe Business Lending which are supporting the business overall. These objectives are challenging, as regulatory and risk requirements are strengthening, client expectations are changing and there is a continuous pressure to increase efficiency. Within this context, you contribute to the design of an efficient and customer-oriented value proposition thanks to an extensive use of data analytics, but also including products and services, harmonized when possible between Belgium and the Netherlands. You will cover several customer segments from self-employed to mid-corporates.

Develop and automate Management Information reports (1) enabling the senior leaders to make appropriate decisions or (2) helping the bank to follow-up it’s compliancy against regulations or internal policies.
Translating the bank and tribe strategy to concrete initiatives within the scope of your squad
Analyzing the feasibility and the value of opportunities
Evaluating our way of working with the aim to continuously improve
Liaise with Customer Journey Experts to ensure reporting & data quality requirements are covered as from the design of the process.
Actively participating and taking initiative to improve the collaboration between different stakeholders and colleagues in other teams
Understanding and applying business principles and ensure compliancy with external regulation and internal minimum requirements

A colleague with a talent for taking it on and making it happen, enthusiasm for helping others to be successful and a knack for always being a step ahead. In other words, you strive to bring fresh ideas to life and embrace challenges in a fast changing and complex environment. You are a naturally collaborative person who listens and invests in others to achieve common goals. You love to challenge the status quo and are eager to propose creative solutions to problems.
As a Business Lending Data Analyst you will also need:
To be customer driven and focused, loving to collaborate with different people, ready to explore
An entrepreneurial attitude – taking initiative and making things happen, manage and solve problems with the support of senior colleague
To act as process owner in the business lending domain with the support of a more senior colleague
To be interested in innovation in the domain, experiment by challenging existing trends, be curious
To manage projects involving one or 2 stakeholders with the support of a more senior colleague
affinity with data and good analytical skills, previous experience with data management/analysis
Knowledge of reporting software such as SAS Enteprise Guide, SAS Visual Analyics, PowerBI, Cognos, …
Planning & organizational skills and ability to develop them with coaching
Clear communication skills : written and oral, be able to adapt your speech to the audience with the help of a more senior colleague
Previous experience in a (credit) risk oriented role is a plus
Knowledge of business lending products/services is recommended
Fluent in English and Dutch or French
Master degree or Bachelor degree with relevant work experience (e.g. Business Analyst, Data Analyst, .. )

column2:
work environment

As part of the development towards a “More Digital- and Data driven Bank”, ING is renewing the data management capabilities globally.

As a data analyst in Business Lending, you work on a daily basis with (cross-border) colleagues having different expertise in self-steering feature teams (squads), contributing to the objectives of the tribe Business Lending which are supporting the business overall. These objectives are challenging, as regulatory and risk requirements are strengthening, client expectations are changing and there is a continuous pressure to increase efficiency. Within this context, you contribute to the design of an efficient and customer-oriented value proposition thanks to an extensive use of data analytics, but also including products and services, harmonized when possible between Belgium and the Netherlands. You will cover several customer segments from self-employed to mid-corporates.

Your Key Responsibilities

  • Develop and automate Management Information reports (1) enabling the senior leaders to make appropriate decisions or (2) helping the bank to follow-up it’s compliancy against regulations or internal policies.
  • Translating the bank and tribe strategy to concrete initiatives within the scope of your squad
  • Analyzing the feasibility and the value of opportunities
  • Evaluating our way of working with the aim to continuously improve
  • Liaise with Customer Journey Experts to ensure reporting &

4196526853,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/functional-data-analyst-at-orange-business-4196526853?position=31&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=wEue0bhMVt98y8VgiOafNg%3D%3D,Functional Data Analyst,Orange Business,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Functional Data Analyst Consultant

Ever wondered what it feels like to be at the cutting edge of digital innovation? Our Digital Services team at Orange Business is a dynamic community of expert consultants revolutionizing Customer Experience, Cloud, Data, and AI across various sectors, including retail, finance, manufacturing, life sciences, and public services.

We have a significant international presence, with 20% of our activity extending beyond Belgium, and this number continues to grow. In this role, you will act as a key member of the dynamic Functional Data Architecture Consulting team (19 enthusiastic consultants). You’ll dive into exciting data and functional analysis missions across diverse and impactful projects.
Check out some of our ongoing projects:
Rebuilding the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and Customer Data Platform (CDP) systems in the aviation industry.
Refactoring the Fund Management application in a financial institution by modernizing data storage for improved efficiency and enhancing data visualization.
Data Management projects in retail, transport, and financial sectors.
If you want to take part in this exciting journey, please take a look at the following requirements and let’s meet up if they match your profile!
Your Key Areas of Responsibility as a Functional Data Analyst Consultant:
Driving Data Innovation through Data Modelling, Data Process Improvement, and Data Analysis.
Collecting business and technical requirements and performing gap analysis.
Building documentation and testing implementations of the innovative solutions.
Stakeholder management: Meeting and managing customer needs and expectations.
Forge trust and credibility by communicating with business users and IT stakeholders at different levels.
A good affinity with and interest in technological solutions, with the capability to communicate effectively with different stakeholders.
Effectively operate in workshop and interview contexts.
Strong communication and presentation skills in French and/or Dutch+ English.
At least 4-5 years hands-on experience in Data & Functional analysis in the context of large-scale implementation projects.
Experience in the following domains: Functional analysis, design and testing, Data modelling (classical data modelling as well as star schema modelling), Data change management.

Experience in one or more of the following operational or analytical business areas: Marketing Automation & optimization, Digital and social Marketing, sales force automation, Marketing analysis, sales reporting, dashboarding, benchmarking, customer servicing dashboarding, general reporting & analysis, Data analytics & visualization, data quality, data analysis and data science, GDPR compliance.
Experience in working in an Agile environment.
Experience in tool implementation: CRM tools, BI reporting & analysis tools, Portal environments and tools, Data Governance (metadata, MDM, data quality).
Fluency in SQL and other programming languages is highly desirable.
Some of the rewards of working at Orange Business

A community of experts - as Digital Natives, we put innovation at the heart of our expertise. Continuously seeking new ideas, we proudly host regular “Guild” workshops and knowledge-sharing sessions through our Data Meetups.
We may work with tomorrow’s technology, but at our core we are a people-oriented organization and we are proud to have our Great Place to Work certification
An open and inclusive culture, that enables us to reach our full potential.
Hybrid way of working and modern & collaborative office in Brussels
Compelling advantages including a yearly bonus scheme, a flexible mobility with possibility for a housing budget, representation and expense allowances…
We can’t wait to meet you!
Check out our website for even more or connect with us on LinkedIn.

4205809206,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-recurv-4205809206?position=32&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=gRgfKIuzusaXZxBJn2fAGQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst,recurv,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"📊 Vacature: Freelance Data Analyst
Je analyseert complexe datasets en vertaalt deze naar heldere inzichten.
Je ontwikkelt dashboards en rapporten in Power BI en/of Tableau die stakeholders ondersteunen in hun beslissingen.
Je werkt nauw samen met collega’s uit verschillende teams om data-driven strategieën te ondersteunen.
Je optimaliseert datastromen en schrijft efficiënte SQL-query’s om de juiste informatie boven te halen.
Je hebt ervaring als Data Analyst of in een gelijkaardige functie.
Je bent sterk in SQL en weet hoe je data uit verschillende bronnen efficiënt kunt combineren.
Je hebt ervaring met Power BI en/of Tableau.
Je werkt zelfstandig, maar bent ook een teamplayer.
Je spreekt vlot Engels. Kennis van Nederlands en/of Frans is een plus.
Hybride werkmodel: een mooie balans tussen werken op kantoor (regio Zaventem) en van thuis uit.
Dynamische en maatschappelijk relevante sector: je komt terecht in een organisatie die een cruciale rol speelt in nationale en internationale connectiviteit.
Innovatie en duurzaamheid staan centraal in de bedrijfsstrategie.
Je werkt in een moderne werkomgeving met veel aandacht voor persoonlijke groei, opleiding en samenwerking.
Snelle opstart mogelijk – we zoeken iemand die op korte termijn beschikbaar is.

📊 Vacature: Freelance Data Analyst


Wat?

  • Je analyseert complexe datasets en vertaalt deze naar heldere inzichten.
  • Je ontwikkelt dashboards en rapporten in Power BI en/of Tableau die stakeholders ondersteunen in hun beslissingen.
  • Je werkt nauw samen met collega’s uit verschillende teams om data-driven strategieën te ondersteunen.
  • Je optimaliseert datastromen en schrijft efficiënte SQL-query’s om de juiste informatie boven te halen.


Wie ben jij?

  • Je hebt ervaring als Data Analyst of in een gelijkaardige functie.
  • Je bent sterk in SQL en weet hoe je data uit verschillende bronnen efficiënt kunt combineren.
  • Je hebt ervaring met Power BI en/of Tableau.
  • Je werkt zelfstandig, maar bent ook een teamplayer.
  • Je spreekt vlot Engels. Kennis van Nederlands en/of Frans is een plus.


Voor jou:

  • Hybride werkmodel: een mooie balans tussen werken op kantoor (regio Zaventem) en van thuis uit.
  • Dynamische en maatschappelijk relevante sector: je komt terecht in een organisatie die een cruciale rol speelt in nationale en internationale connectiviteit.
  • Innovatie en duurzaamheid staan centraal in de bedrijfsstrategie.
  • Je werkt in een moderne werkomgeving met veel aandacht voor persoonlijke groei, opleiding en samenwerking.
  • Snelle opstart mogelijk – we zoeken iemand die op korte termijn beschikbaar is.


Interesse? buna@recurv.be

4195546931,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-quality-expert-at-laco-4195546931?position=33&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=MEiG%2FAm4UHO4XLLoYDhsOQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst - Quality Expert,LACO,"Flemish Region, Belgium","Data Analyst / Data Quality Expert

Do you have the supernatural ability to turn raw data into gold? Are you passionate about data and convinced that data quality is the key enabler for organizations to create value from their data? If so, brace yourself, because LACO has a data-driven adventure tailor-made for you! As our Data Analyst / Data Quality Expert, you'll be the Sherlock Holmes of numbers, deciphering business requirements like clues in a mystery novel. You'll be the architect of insights, sculpting data into strategies that steer the ship.

So step into the world of LACO, because we're not just your average Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company. We're the superheroes of many realms including Microsoft, SAS and Data Advisory, which earned us the rank of Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner. With a squad of over 120 consultants, we're on a mission to unravel the secrets of data and lead businesses from all walks of life through the digital wilderness. Join LACO, and you're not just an employee: you're family. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do, making every day at LACO a thrilling adventure.
As a Data Analyst with focus on Quality at LACO, you’ll be responsible for:
Gather and analyse data from different sources to identify inconsistency and trends.
Identifying data quality issues and clearly communicate their business impact
Clean the data and identify the route causes of data quality issues
Design and build data quality controls to support data stewards and other business stakeholders
Build (Power BI) data quality dashboards to monitor the overall data quality
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI, data quality frameworks and data platforms
Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
Troubleshooting and resolving data quality issues by identifying root causes and implementing solutions.
Staying up to date with the latest technologies and best practices to excel in this role.
You have a Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in computer science or equivalent.
You have good communication skills, used to work with business stakeholders.
You have an analytical mindset for analysing business requirements.
You have proven experience with data quality projects.
You have an extended experience with Business Glossary, Data Catalog, Data Lineage or Reporting Governance
You know all about the SQL
You have experience in Power BI, including DAX, data modeling techniques, minimum Star Schemas (Kimball) and others are nice to have.
You get even more bonus points if …
You have a good Experience with master data management
You are familiar with data quality tool like Azure Purview (Collibra, Informatica, Soda)
Other Security protocols like CLS (column Level Security, Object Level Security)
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.
Receive an attractive salary package, including a company car, along with excellent benefits.
Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
Get involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
Guided by our expert LACO coaches, you'll have the support and motivation to grow and build a sustainable career.
We practice participative management, as we extend a warm invitation to you to embrace ownership and play an active role in shaping both your future and that of LACO.
Have a say in which project placement you’ll get, enabling you to work remotely, in the office, in a hybrid fashion, or based on your geographical preferences.
A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, …

Don't let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our one and only Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success. Hurry up and smash that button, before your dream job becomes someone else's journey!

Data Analyst / Data Quality Expert

Unleash your data Quality enthusiasm!


Do you have the supernatural ability to turn raw data into gold? Are you passionate about data and convinced that data quality is the key enabler for organizations to create value from their data? If so, brace yourself, because LACO has a data-driven adventure tailor-made for you! As our Data Analyst / Data Quality Expert, you'll be the Sherlock Holmes of numbers, deciphering business requirements like clues in a mystery novel. You'll be the architect of insights, sculpting data into strategies that steer the ship.


So step into the world of LACO, because we're not just your average Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company. We're the superheroes of many realms including Microsoft, SAS and Data Advisory, which earned us the rank of Microsoft Data &
column2:
AI Solutions Partner. With a squad of over 120 consultants, we're on a mission to unravel the secrets of data and lead businesses from all walks of life through the digital wilderness. Join LACO, and you're not just an employee: you're family. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do, making every day at LACO a thrilling adventure.


YOUR JOB

As a Data Analyst with focus on Quality at LACO, you’ll be responsible for:


  • Gather and analyse data from different sources to identify inconsistency and trends.
  • Identifying data quality issues and clearly communicate their business impact
  • Clean the data and identify the route causes of data quality issues
  • Design and build data quality controls to support data stewards and other business stakeholders
  • Build (Power BI) data quality dashboards to monitor the overall data quality
  • Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
  • Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI, data quality frameworks and data platforms
  • Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
  • Troubleshooting and resolving data quality issues by identifying root causes and implementing solutions.
  • Staying up to date with the latest technologies and best practices to excel in this role.


YOUR SKILLS


  • You have a Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in computer science or equivalent.
  • You have good communication skills, used to work with business stakeholders.
  • You have an analytical mindset for analysing business requirements.
  • You have proven experience with data quality projects.
  • You have an extended experience with Business Glossary, Data Catalog, Data Lineage or Reporting Governance
  • You know all about the SQL
  • You have experience in Power BI, including DAX, data modeling techniques, minimum Star Schemas (Kimball) and others are nice to have.


You get even more bonus points if …


  • You have a good Experience with master data management
  • You are familiar with data quality tool like Azure Purview (Collibra, Informatica, Soda)
  • Python, Spark, PySpark, Spark SQL
  • Other Security protocols like CLS (column Level Security, Object Level Security)
  • You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.


OUR OFFER


  • Receive an attractive salary package, including a company car, along with excellent benefits.
  • Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
  • Get involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
  • Guided by our expert LACO coaches, you'll have the support and motivation to grow and build a sustainable career.
  • We practice participative management, as we extend a warm invitation to you to embrace ownership and play an active role in shaping both your future and that of LACO.
  • Have a say in which project placement you’ll get, enabling you to work remotely, in the office, in a hybrid fashion, or based on your geographical preferences.
  • A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, …


Don't let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our one and only Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success. Hurry up and smash that button, before your dream job becomes someone else's journey!

4190417094,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-data-kwaliteit-at-laco-4190417094?position=36&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=qZGDPrfD2E7pAAUp9Oz7Vg%3D%3D,Data Analyst - Data Kwaliteit,LACO,"Flemish Region, Belgium","Wij zoeken een Data Analyst - Data Kwaliteit expert om ons Microsoft-team te versterken!

LACO is een Belgisch bedrijf dat gespecialiseerd is in business intelligence en data-analyse, met meer dan 35 jaar ervaring. Als Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner hebben we uitgebreide expertise op gebieden zoals Microsoft BI en Data Governance. Met meer dan 120 consultants helpen we bedrijven succesvol te zijn met data. Bij LACO combineren we toewijding met een vleugje plezier in alles wat we doen.

Bij ons staan langetermijnrelaties met klanten en collega’s centraal. Onlangs hebben we enkele grote projecten binnengehaald bij belangrijke klanten, en daarom willen we ons Microsoft-team versterken om samen met het LACO-team end-to-endprojecten te realiseren.

Heb jij de bovennatuurlijke gave om ruwe data om te zetten in goud? Ben je gepassioneerd door data en overtuigd dat datakwaliteit dé sleutel is om organisaties waarde uit hun data te laten halen? Dan heeft LACO een data-gedreven avontuur op maat voor jou!

Als onze Data Analyst / Data Kwaliteit Expert ben jij de Sherlock Holmes van cijfers: je ontrafelt bedrijfsvereisten alsof het aanwijzingen in een mysterie zijn. Je bouwt niet alleen inzichten op, maar vormt ook strategische data-oplossingen die bedrijven naar succes leiden.
Als Data Analyst / Data Kwaliteit Expert bij LACO ben je verantwoordelijk voor:
Verzamelen en analyseren van data uit verschillende bronnen om inconsistenties en trends te identificeren
Signaleren van datakwaliteitsproblemen en de impact ervan op de business
Schoonmaken van data en het achterhalen van de oorzaken van kwaliteitsproblemen
Opzetten van Power BI dashboards om datakwaliteit te monitoren
Samenwerken met stakeholders en verschillende teams rond data kwaliteit en dataplatformen
Ontwerpen, optimaliseren en ontwikkelen van Power BI rapporten en dashboards volgens de behoeften van de business
Identificeren van oorzaken van datakwaliteitsproblemen en implementeren van oplossingen.
Op de hoogte blijven van de nieuwste technologieën en best practices binnen data-analyse en datakwaliteit
Je hebt een bachelor- en/of masterdiploma in computerwetenschappen of een gelijkwaardige opleiding
Je bent communicatief sterk en gewend om met business stakeholders samen te werken
Je hebt een analytische mindset en kan business vereisten vertalen naar data-oplossingen
Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring met datakwaliteit projecten
Je hebt uitgebreide kennis van Business Glossary, Data Catalog, Data Lineage en Reporting Governance
Je hebt een sterke kennis van SQL
Je hebt ervaring met Power BI, inclusief DAX, datamodellering en Star Schemas (Kimball)
Ervaring hebt met Master Data Management.
Bekend bent met datakwaliteitstools zoals Azure Purview, Collibra, Informatica of Soda.
Kennis hebt van Python, Spark, PySpark, Spark SQL.
Ervaring met security protocollen zoals Column Level Security (CLS) en Object Level Security.
We werken graag samen met zowel werknemers als freelancers.
Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk salarispakket en uitstekende extralegale voordelen.
Je krijgt toegang tot opleidingsmogelijkheden om je kennis te vergroten en je carrière verder te ontwikkelen.
Je werkt mee aan innovatieve Microsoft-trajecten die je uitdagen en inspireren.
Geniet van een geweldige bedrijfscultuur met ruimte voor leuke evenementen zoals familiedagen, jaarlijkse skireizen, sportevenementen, spelavonden, …
Laat deze kans niet aan je datavingers voorbijgaan!
Neem contact op met onze recruiters en begin jouw avontuur naar succes.

Wij zoeken een Data Analyst - Data Kwaliteit expert om ons Microsoft-team te versterken!


Over LACO

LACO is een Belgisch bedrijf dat gespecialiseerd is in business intelligence en data-analyse, met meer dan 35 jaar ervaring. Als Microsoft Data &
column2:
AI Solutions Partner hebben we uitgebreide expertise op gebieden zoals Microsoft BI en Data Governance. Met meer dan 120 consultants helpen we bedrijven succesvol te zijn met data. Bij LACO combineren we toewijding met een vleugje plezier in alles wat we doen.


Bij ons staan langetermijnrelaties met klanten en collega’s centraal. Onlangs hebben we enkele grote projecten binnengehaald bij belangrijke klanten, en daarom willen we ons Microsoft-team versterken om samen met het LACO-team end-to-endprojecten te realiseren.


Heb jij de bovennatuurlijke gave om ruwe data om te zetten in goud? Ben je gepassioneerd door data en overtuigd dat datakwaliteit dé sleutel is om organisaties waarde uit hun data te laten halen? Dan heeft LACO een data-gedreven avontuur op maat voor jou!

Als onze Data Analyst / Data Kwaliteit Expert ben jij de Sherlock Holmes van cijfers: je ontrafelt bedrijfsvereisten alsof het aanwijzingen in een mysterie zijn. Je bouwt niet alleen inzichten op, maar vormt ook strategische data-oplossingen die bedrijven naar succes leiden.


Jouw rol

Als Data Analyst / Data Kwaliteit Expert bij LACO ben je verantwoordelijk voor:

  • Verzamelen en analyseren van data uit verschillende bronnen om inconsistenties en trends te identificeren
  • Signaleren van datakwaliteitsproblemen en de impact ervan op de business
  • Schoonmaken van data en het achterhalen van de oorzaken van kwaliteitsproblemen
  • Ontwikkelen en implementeren van datakwaliteitscontroles
  • Opzetten van Power BI dashboards om datakwaliteit te monitoren
  • Samenwerken met stakeholders en verschillende teams rond data kwaliteit en dataplatformen
  • Ontwerpen, optimaliseren en ontwikkelen van Power BI rapporten en dashboards volgens de behoeften van de business
  • Identificeren van oorzaken van datakwaliteitsproblemen en implementeren van oplossingen.
  • Op de hoogte blijven van de nieuwste technologieën en best practices binnen data-analyse en datakwaliteit


Jouw vaardigheden

  • Je hebt een bachelor- en/of masterdiploma in computerwetenschappen of een gelijkwaardige opleiding
  • Je bent communicatief sterk en gewend om met business stakeholders samen te werken
  • Je hebt een analytische mindset en kan business vereisten vertalen naar data-oplossingen
  • Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring met datakwaliteit projecten
  • Je hebt uitgebreide kennis van Business Glossary, Data Catalog, Data Lineage en Reporting Governance
  • Je hebt een sterke kennis van SQL
  • Je hebt ervaring met Power BI, inclusief DAX, datamodellering en Star Schemas (Kimball)


Bonuspunten als je …

  • Ervaring hebt met Master Data Management.
  • Bekend bent met datakwaliteitstools zoals Azure Purview, Collibra, Informatica of Soda.
  • Kennis hebt van Python, Spark, PySpark, Spark SQL.
  • Ervaring met security protocollen zoals Column Level Security (CLS) en Object Level Security.


Ons aanbod

  • We werken graag samen met zowel werknemers als freelancers.
  • Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk salarispakket en uitstekende extralegale voordelen.
  • Je krijgt toegang tot opleidingsmogelijkheden om je kennis te vergroten en je carrière verder te ontwikkelen.
  • Je werkt mee aan innovatieve Microsoft-trajecten die je uitdagen en inspireren.
  • Geniet van een geweldige bedrijfscultuur met ruimte voor leuke evenementen zoals familiedagen, jaarlijkse skireizen, sportevenementen, spelavonden, …


Laat deze kans niet aan je datavingers voorbijgaan!

Neem contact op met onze recruiters en begin jouw avontuur naar succes.

column1: <icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

4197243513,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-fsma-4197243513?position=37&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=C2a3ux4TlIwegIgE0XEDxg%3D%3D,Data Analyst,FSMA,"Brussels Region, Belgium","Would you like to contribute as a data analyst to better consumer protection and to increasing public trust in the financial sector?
Come and join our FSMA team and become a data analyst at the ‘Data analytics expertise centre’

The ‘Data analytics expertise centre’ occupies a key role in developing and rolling out data-driven supervision at the FSMA. As a data analyst, you will conduct project-based data analyses, provide advice and support for the implementation of innovative projects in various supervisory areas, and search for new data-driven applications that can support supervision.
You will be working on various innovative projects that help the different supervisory areas work in a data-driven manner.
You will be involved in conducting analyses as part of financial supervision, for which you will make use of external or internal data (MiFIR database, EMIR, textual data etc.).
You will assist the operational supervisory services in developing and implementing risk models and will thereby contribute to a risk-based approach to supervision.
You will search for new applications of data-driven supervision at the FSMA, and to this end will be in contact with various supervisory areas.
WHAT KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS DO YOU BRING?
A Master’s degree in a highly data-driven field (e.g. master in economics, business engineer, actuarial sciences, applied sciences, statistics or a similar discipline)
column2: a doctorate is an asset.

column1: Preferably several years of professional experience as a data analyst or in the academic world.
Strong data processing skills and practical experience with R and/or Python.
Affinity and experience with Natural Language Processing (NLP) is a plus.
An explicit interest in financial markets and products, as well as in the various new developments in those areas.
Strong adaptability and interpersonal skills. Ability to work on a team and to show initiative.
Strong analytical skills and a capacity for synthesis. Ability to communicate in a logical, structured manner both verbally and in writing.
Goal-orientedness, assertiveness and persuasive powers of argumentation.
Affinity with the tasks in the public interest entrusted to the FSMA.
Solid competence in Dutch and a good knowledge of French and English.
A full-time job with a permanent contract.
The chance to do your bit for consumer protection.

A competitive salary package with many fringe benefits (e.g. group and hospitalization insurance, full reimbursement of the cost of commuting to/from work, budget-friendly company dining room, contribution to your mobile phone and internet subscriptions, additional non-statutory holidays, bank holidays, etc.).
A wide range of opportunities for learning and development.
Good work/life balance (teleworking a few days a week).
Offices within easy reach of Brussels city centre.
Please note that each member of the FSMA staff is subject to a strict code of ethics and is bound by the obligation of professional secrecy.

Would you like to contribute as a data analyst to better consumer protection and to increasing public trust in the financial sector?


Come and join our FSMA team and become a data analyst at the ‘Data analytics expertise centre’


WHERE WILL YOU BE WORKING?


The ‘Data analytics expertise centre’ occupies a key role in developing and rolling out data-driven supervision at the FSMA. As a data analyst, you will conduct project-based data analyses, provide advice and support for the implementation of innovative projects in various supervisory areas, and search for new data-driven applications that can support supervision.


WHAT WILL YOUR JOB ENTAIL?


  • You will be working on various innovative projects that help the different supervisory areas work in a data-driven manner.
  • You will be involved in conducting analyses as part of financial supervision, for which you will make use of external or internal data (MiFIR database, EMIR, textual data etc.).
  • You will assist the operational supervisory services in developing and implementing risk models and will thereby contribute to a risk-based approach to supervision.
  • You will search for new applications of data-driven supervision at the FSMA, and to this end will be in contact with various supervisory areas.


WHAT KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS DO YOU BRING?


  • A Master’s degree in a highly data-driven field (e.g. master in economics, business engineer, actuarial sciences, applied sciences, statistics or a similar discipline)
column2:
a doctorate is an asset.
  • Preferably several years of professional experience as a data analyst or in the academic world.
  • Strong data processing skills and practical experience with R and/or Python.
  • Affinity and experience with Natural Language Processing (NLP) is a plus.
  • An explicit interest in financial markets and products, as well as in the various new developments in those areas.
  • Strong adaptability and interpersonal skills. Ability to work on a team and to show initiative.
  • Strong analytical skills and a capacity for synthesis. Ability to communicate in a logical, structured manner both verbally and in writing.
  • Goal-orientedness, assertiveness and persuasive powers of argumentation.
  • Affinity with the tasks in the public interest entrusted to the FSMA.
  • Solid competence in Dutch and a good knowledge of French and English.


    • WHAT DO WE OFFER YOU?


    • A full-time job with a permanent contract.
    • The chance to do your bit for consumer protection.
    • A competitive salary package with many fringe benefits (e.g. group and hospitalization insurance, full reimbursement of the cost of commuting to/from work, budget-friendly company dining room, contribution to your mobile phone and internet subscriptions, additional non-statutory holidays, bank holidays, etc.).
    • A wide range of opportunities for learning and development.
    • Flexible working hours.
    • Good work/life balance (teleworking a few days a week).
    • Opportunities for internal mobility.
    • Offices within easy reach of Brussels city centre.


    Please note that each member of the FSMA staff is subject to a strict code of ethics and is bound by the obligation of professional secrecy.

column1: <icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 9l5.93-4L15 6.54l-6.15 4.2a1.5 1.5 0 01-1.69 0L1 6.54 2.07 5z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>
Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital transformation. We help our clients leverage technology to achieve their business goals.

Our longstanding partnerships with leaders like AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft, and ServiceNow amplify our capabilities, allowing us to deliver top-tier expertise and award-winning services. We complement these partnerships with in-depth Cyber, Data & AI, Software development and multi cloud expertise.
For 30 years, we have always been guiding our customers on the next tech wave. Devoteam has guided organizations through the Internet and cloud. The next revolution? AI.
With 11,000 tech natives working in 25+ countries, we bring you highly skilled IT experts across Europe
At Devoteam, tech is in our DNA, and it’s the people we empower with tech. Now, with responsible AI, we’re ready to unlock a future where technology drives positive change.
If you like these keywords, you’ll love this role:

Dreaming about exploring the data understanding how the business works? Do you enjoy telling a story around data? Do you enjoy figuring out how to calculate the needed KPI? We are currently looking for an Azure Data Analyst who can support our customers by telling a story around data by creating reports and dashboards.

Do you have experience with Power BI or with a similar reporting tool? Are you also interested in supporting our Azure Data Engineer team computing the right data set? Are you attracted by new technologies and new methodologies? You’re a good candidate to be our future colleague!

As an Azure Data Analyst, you will be a crucial part of our key projects for our data solutions. You will be in front of the customer understanding their need, creating the correct report and guiding our Azure Data Engineer to prepare properly the needed data.
For this position, we’re looking for all seniority levels.
[Must-have] Hands-on experience with Power BI, SQL Server Reporting Services or Tableau
[Must-have] Hands-on experience with MS SQL querying language (T-SQL)
[Must-have] Hands-on experience modeling a datawarehouse/datamart in Star Schema
[Must-have] Knowledge about modeling techniques like data vault, Merise/3NF
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience creating Azure resources for a data cloud solution.
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience building data pipeline with some Azure data tools (Azure Data Factory, Synapse, Azure Data Lake…)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with the DataBricks environment (Delta Live Table, Workflows, SQL Warehouse)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with MS SQL Server suite (SSIS, SSAS)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with Python and PySpark
[Nice-to-have] You’re ready to drive change and bring creative tech ideas to life.
[Nice-to-have] You’re either proficient in Dutch or French (or you want to learn) and fluent in English.
[Bonus-points] Azure certified (or willing to obtain). Certifications in scope: PL-300, DP-203

If you do not feel fully confident that you meet the requirements above, please don’t worry. Just apply. Together we’ll discover what you can bring to the table, in which role you would fit best and how you could potentially grow at Devoteam.
As a digital native you will have a positive impact at top organizations in Belgium.
Direct access to the Microsoft organization and programs thanks to our global partnership.
Prepare to inspire and be inspired by other Devoteamers in tech communities.
We enable local and international collaboration and exchange with other tech leaders and specialists, knowledge sharing, peer-to-peer coaching.
A personalized career plan with training offers in soft- & hard skills and certifications aligned to your needs & expertise.
Our servant leadership supports opportunities to grow your personal brand through blogs, keynote sessions, and more.
#techies in our minds, #creatives in our hearts, #change in our DNA.

Cutting-edge Technology: Embrace the latest advancements in IT and digital technologies as we constantly innovate to stay ahead of the competition. Our commitment to adopting state-of-the-art tools and methodologies ensures that you'll work on projects at the forefront of the industry.

Entrepreneur mindset: We value our people over processes. You will develop and grow in an agile and ambitious company where it’s okay to take risks, make mistakes and change plans to find transformative solutions. At the same time, you will learn from the best, building relationships and skills that will last your entire career.

Endless Learning Opportunities: We value personal and professional growth. Through workshops, conferences, and certifications, we offer the resources needed to expand your skill set and reach new heights in your career.
Connect with amazing people: You will become part of a network of +10,000 Devoteamers spread over 20 countries.

Collaborative Culture: Teamwork is at the heart of our organisation. You'll be working side by side with a diverse group of IT experts who share your passion for excellence and will inspire you to think outside the box.

Impactful Projects: Tackle real-world challenges that matter! From revolutionising business processes to developing innovative solutions, you'll have the chance to make a genuine and positive impact on our clients and the community.
Work-Life Balance: We believe in a healthy work-life balance, ensuring that you have time to unwind, pursue your hobbies, and spend quality time with loved ones.

Inspiring and eco-friendly workplace: We just moved to an amazing new building. We believe an inspiring workspace fuels creativity and fosters a positive work culture, allowing our employees to reach their full potential. The Wings building is also designed with eco-friendly features and energy-efficient systems. By reducing our ecological footprint, we are contributing to a greener future and aligning our business practices with our environmental values. The building is also very easily accessible by public transportation.

Competitive package: We offer a competitive salary package with additional benefits like a company car, smartphone, medical insurance, pension plan, net allowance, laptop, meal vouchers, etc. We review our salary grid twice a year to ensure we are in line with the market.
At Devoteam, we combine strong values – respect, frankness, ambition, entrepreneurship & collaboration - with a fun environment that empowers you to innovate and succeed.
>>> Does all this sound compelling to you? Go for it and click that apply button!

4142273794,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-senior-h-f-at-extia-4142273794?position=39&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=uwXpRuEeJu0PdMUAdCvIGw%3D%3D,Data Analyst Senior (H/F),Extia,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

Bon(ne) communiquant(e), vous créez facilement du lien avec les nouvelles personnes que vous rencontrez, Méthodique, les plans d’action sont dans votre ADN, Ayant le goût du résultat, avec vous il n’y a pas de problème, il n’y a que des solutions. Attiré(e) par le challenge, vous souhaitez gagner en compétences au sein d’une équipe originale, ambitieuse et très dynamique ?

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.
Vous serez notamment en charge de :
Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises
Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 8 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :
Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,

Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.
Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence

Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération
Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay 🌏 Envie d’évoluer ? Grâce à notre politique de mobilité interne, explorez de nouvelles opportunités en France ou dans l’un de nos 7 autres pays !

Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui

Bon(ne) communiquant(e), vous créez facilement du lien avec les nouvelles personnes que vous rencontrez, Méthodique, les plans d’action sont dans votre ADN, Ayant le goût du résultat, avec vous il n’y a pas de problème, il n’y a que des solutions. Attiré(e) par le challenge, vous souhaitez gagner en compétences au sein d’une équipe originale, ambitieuse et très dynamique ?

Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :

  • Comprendre les problématiques métier,
  • Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
  • Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
  • Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
  • Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises

PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 8 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :

  • Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
  • Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
  • Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.

PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT

  • Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
  • Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
  • Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence

Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas &
column2:
Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

LES PETITS PLUS

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay 🌏 Envie d’évoluer ? Grâce à notre politique de mobilité interne, explorez de nouvelles opportunités en France ou dans l’un de nos 7 autres pays !

4203153361,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-analyst-at-g2-recruitment-4203153361?position=41&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=KLRK7YRVwr%2Fk5%2F%2BiqGTUFQ%3D%3D,Business Intelligence Analyst,g2 Recruitment,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","My client based in Brussels who work in the retail sector are looking for a BI analyst to work on multiple active projects. One of the projects is a major new application for a store checkout system. The selected consultant will be working with existing data that needs gathering from the application to put them into datasets that can be used for dashboarding for whole organization.
A consultant who has data gathering experience

This role is a long-term freelance mission with a hybrid set up with only 1 day per week on sight required. We are hosting interviews for this position over the next two weeks so please get in touch if you are interested.

My client based in Brussels who work in the retail sector are looking for a BI analyst to work on multiple active projects. One of the projects is a major new application for a store checkout system. The selected consultant will be working with existing data that needs gathering from the application to put them into datasets that can be used for dashboarding for whole organization.

Key skills

  • A consultant who has data gathering experience
  • BI experience
  • SQL
  • Dashboard Building experience.
  • English speaking

Logistics

  • Hybrid
  • Freelance
  • English Speaking

This role is a long-term freelance mission with a hybrid set up with only 1 day per week on sight required. We are hosting interviews for this position over the next two weeks so please get in touch if you are interested.

4204216373,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-norriq-financial-services-4204216373?position=42&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=USoQZZOqvKd6gSwlOJ6Piw%3D%3D,Data Analyst,NORRIQ Financial Services,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"Data Analyst / Data Visualisation Consultant

NORRIQ is a leading international consulting firm headquartered in Denmark and Belgium, with 350+ consultants driving business transformation through technology. Our Financial Services practice includes 100+ specialists supporting banks, insurers, and financial institutions in navigating regulatory challenges, embracing emerging technologies, and meeting evolving client demands. We prioritize growth, innovation, and excellence, offering abundant opportunities for professional development and collaboration.

NORRIQ is seeking to grow its Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence team with additional Data Analyst / Data Visualisation Consultants to improve the business performance of financial institutions. You will help our clients to optimize the value they can get from their internal and external data, through improved business performance monitoring and enhanced reporting quality and readability. Join us to work on impactful projects that shape the future of finance.
Collecting and interpreting internal and external data about customer behaviour via the digital platforms (Web and mobile) and their digital transactions with the bank.
Translate data insight into actionable recommendations in order to coordinate the business needs around data and improve the bank’s digital and marketing strategy and optimize future campaigns.
Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations
Develop and maintain complex data models, databases, data warehouses and data marts .
Create data visualizations and reports to communicate insights to stakeholders.
Perform data quality checks and ensure data integrity, develop and implement data governance policies and procedures
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies in data analysis and visualization
Master’s degree (or equivalent work experience) in mathematics or statistics, business intelligence, computer engineering, economy.
1-3 years of experience in data projects, preferably within the financial services industry.
Technical Expertise & Tooling: SQL (mandatory), SAS (nice to have), Python & R (to support our AI team), Reporting & Visualisation tools (Power BI, Tableau, Adobe Analytics, ...),.
ETL Processes: Affinity with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, including an understanding of data preparation, cleansing, and integration from multiple sources.
Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Business Analysis Skills: Experience in requirements gathering, process design and developing action plans.
AI knowledge: AI knowledge & interest to connect easily with our data scientist and machine learning engineers.

column2: ability to work well in cross-functional teams and engage effectively with stakeholders.

column1: Languages: Fluent in English and native in French or Dutch.
Dynamic Work Environment: High-impact projects with leading financial institutions in a fast-growing consulting firm.
Career Development: Continuous learning and growth opportunities to advance your career.
Collaborative Culture: A supportive, innovative team environment that encourages new ideas and professional development.
Global Exposure: International experience working on cross-border projects that shape the financial services industry.

At NORRIQ, we are shaping the future of finance through transformation and innovation. If you're passionate about improving financial processes, driving change, and delivering value to clients, this is the perfect opportunity for you.

Data Analyst / Data Visualisation Consultant



Who We Are:

NORRIQ is a leading international consulting firm headquartered in Denmark and Belgium, with 350+ consultants driving business transformation through technology. Our Financial Services practice includes 100+ specialists supporting banks, insurers, and financial institutions in navigating regulatory challenges, embracing emerging technologies, and meeting evolving client demands. We prioritize growth, innovation, and excellence, offering abundant opportunities for professional development and collaboration.


The Opportunity:

NORRIQ is seeking to grow its Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence team with additional Data Analyst / Data Visualisation Consultants to improve the business performance of financial institutions. You will help our clients to optimize the value they can get from their internal and external data, through improved business performance monitoring and enhanced reporting quality and readability. Join us to work on impactful projects that shape the future of finance.


Responsibilities:

  • Collecting and interpreting internal and external data about customer behaviour via the digital platforms (Web and mobile) and their digital transactions with the bank.
  • Translate data insight into actionable recommendations in order to coordinate the business needs around data and improve the bank’s digital and marketing strategy and optimize future campaigns.
  • Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations
  • Develop and maintain complex data models, databases, data warehouses and data marts .
  • Create data visualizations and reports to communicate insights to stakeholders.
  • Perform data quality checks and ensure data integrity, develop and implement data governance policies and procedures
  • Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies in data analysis and visualization




Your Profile:

  • Master’s degree (or equivalent work experience) in mathematics or statistics, business intelligence, computer engineering, economy.
  • 1-3 years of experience in data projects, preferably within the financial services industry.
  • Technical Expertise &
column2: Tooling: SQL (mandatory), SAS (nice to have), Python &
column3: R (to support our AI team), Reporting &

Visualisation tools (Power BI, Tableau, Adobe Analytics, ...),.
  • ETL Processes: Affinity with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, including an understanding of data preparation, cleansing, and integration from multiple sources.
  • Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities to translate complex data into actionable insights.
  • Business Analysis Skills: Experience in requirements gathering, process design and developing action plans.
  • AI knowledge: AI knowledge &

  • Communication &
column6: Collaboration: Excellent communication skills
column7:
ability to work well in cross-functional teams and engage effectively with stakeholders.
  • Languages: Fluent in English and native in French or Dutch.


    • What We Offer:

    • Dynamic Work Environment: High-impact projects with leading financial institutions in a fast-growing consulting firm.
    • Career Development: Continuous learning and growth opportunities to advance your career.
    • Collaborative Culture: A supportive, innovative team environment that encourages new ideas and professional development.
    • Global Exposure: International experience working on cross-border projects that shape the financial services industry.


    Why Join Us?

    At NORRIQ, we are shaping the future of finance through transformation and innovation. If you're passionate about improving financial processes, driving change, and delivering value to clients, this is the perfect opportunity for you.

4142276479,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-bi-engineer-data-analyst-%C2%A0-september-2025-at-capgemini-4142276479?position=43&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=WeNxkXyAmc7W5Idiecl9UA%3D%3D,Junior BI Engineer / Data Analyst -  September 2025,Capgemini,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided everyday by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of over 350,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong 55-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.
Get The Future You Want | https://www.capgemini.com/be-en

Data Analyst and BI Engineers are the foundation of the Data and AI profession, applying their expertise to ensure governance and management, and influencing business decisions by the stories they tell with data.
At Capgemini, this multifaceted specialism has significant experience across traditional warehousing technologies and databases, Big Data and Cloud. There is never a dull moment in this career path!
As a junior Data Analyst & Bi Engineer, you will be responsible for:
Integrate, transform and consolidate data from various structured and unstructured data systems.
Translate functional requirements into a scalable, fit-for-use technical design.
Own the delivery of data modelling and data pipelines.
Implementing a new operating model which supports innovation and acceleration through data & analytics.
Contributing data expertise to strategic projects that align with the clients goals.
We Are Looking For Someone Who
Owns a bachelor’s or master’s degree in Data Science, Business Engineering, Computer Sciences, or equivalent.
Has strong knowledge of SQL (this is a must).
Is fluent in Dutch or French and English, but notion of other language and willing to improve.
Is geographically mobile: Although you must be ready to accept assignments anywhere in Belgium, most of your assignments will be Brussels based.
Success In This Role Often Comes Down To
Strong communication skills: You can convey complex ideas clearly and persuasively.
Teamwork: You excel at collaborating and building meaningful relationships.
Organizational talent: You maintain oversight and prioritize effectively in a dynamic environment.
Problem-solving ability: You think creatively and tackle challenges proactively.
We offer a supportive, flexible, and growth-oriented workplace where your contributions make a difference. Here’s what you can expect:
A hybrid work model with up to 70% remote work.
Access to world-class learning platforms to upskill in marketing, communications, and leadership.
A dynamic, fun, and collaborative marketing team.
A brand-new, state-of-the-art office in Diegem.
Competitive salary with a flex plan to customize your benefits, including a company car or mobility budget.
Comprehensive health and group insurance, meal & eco vouchers.
32 vacation days, plus bank holidays, with options to purchase extra time off.
Opportunities for international exposure and travel to support exciting projects and events.
We'd love to hear from you if you’re passionate about communication and eager to grow in a fast-paced, innovative, and international company.
Apply today and Get The Future You Want!
