4187299559,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/solver-business-intelligence-advanced-analytics-specialist-at-exsolv%C3%A6-4187299559?position=44&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=955SYHSXhRXof7Up26Mw1g%3D%3D,Solver - Business Intelligence & Advanced Analytics Specialist,Exsolvæ,"Brussels Region, Belgium","About Exsolvæ:

Exsolvæ is a Brussels-based consultancy at the forefront of Data and Artificial Intelligence innovation. We specialize in providing expert Consultancy, Audit, and Solution Development services to empower our partners in overcoming unique challenges. Our holistic approach fosters collaboration across diverse domains, including Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and AI.
At Exsolvæ, our ""Solvers"" are passionate professionals equipped with cutting-edge tools, a culture of continuous learning, and an unwavering commitment to delivering high-impact solutions.
We are seeking a Business Intelligence & Advanced Analytics Specialist to join our expert team and help our clients unlock the power of data to drive strategic decision-making and innovation.

As a Business Intelligence & Advanced Analytics Specialist, you will design and implement data-driven solutions that enable organizations to make informed, strategic decisions. You will work alongside multidisciplinary teams, using advanced BI tools and techniques to create insightful dashboards, reports, and analytics workflows.
Educational Background: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Business Intelligence, or a related field.
Languages: Written & Spoken Fluency in English AND French or Dutch
Technical Expertise: Proficiency in data visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik, and strong SQL skills for querying databases.
Data Integration Skills: Experience with ETL/ELT processes and tools such as Azure Data Factory, SSIS, or Informatica.
Cloud Experience: Hands-on experience with cloud BI platforms like Azure Synapse Analytics, AWS QuickSight, or Google BigQuery.
Programming Skills: Familiarity with Python or R for advanced analytics and statistical modeling.
Soft Skills: Strong analytical thinking, communication, and collaboration skills to work with clients and multidisciplinary teams.
Knowledge of big data tools like Apache Spark or Hadoop.
Experience with predictive analytics and machine learning integration into BI workflows.
Familiarity with KPI frameworks and business acumen to align analytics with strategic goals.
Certifications such as Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate or Tableau Certified Professional.
Client Engagement: Collaborate with clients to assess their analytical needs and recommend BI solutions that align with their strategic goals.
Data Integration and Reporting: Design and implement data visualization solutions using tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik, creating impactful dashboards and reports.
Data Ecosystem Implementation: Build and optimize scalable data pipelines to process and transform data efficiently for BI and analytics purposes.
Data Modeling: Develop and maintain robust, scalable data models to support analytical needs.
ETL/ELT Development: Create efficient data integration workflows using ETL/ELT tools and frameworks.
Advanced Analytics: Apply statistical and predictive modeling techniques to extract actionable insights from complex datasets.
Cloud BI Solutions: Deploy and manage BI workflows on platforms such as Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud to ensure performance and scalability.
Stay updated on advancements in BI and analytics technologies, tools, and methodologies.
Explore innovative ways to integrate advanced analytics techniques, such as predictive analytics and machine learning, into BI solutions.
Lead BI and analytics projects from concept to completion, ensuring timely and high-quality delivery.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver end-to-end solutions that meet client objectives.
Conduct workshops and training sessions to empower client teams with BI and analytics capabilities.
Provide ongoing support to ensure the reliability and scalability of deployed solutions.
Impactful Projects: Contribute to diverse BI and analytics projects across industries like finance, healthcare, retail, and manufacturing.
Continuous Learning: Access the latest BI and analytics tools and training opportunities to stay at the cutting edge.
Collaborative Culture: Be part of a supportive team that values knowledge sharing and mutual growth.
Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy a balanced work model with opportunities for remote and in-office collaboration.
Competitive Compensation: Benefit from an attractive salary, performance-based bonuses, and comprehensive benefits.

If you are a driven professional with a passion for Business Intelligence and Advanced Analytics, and a proven ability to design and deploy impactful data-driven solutions, we’d love to hear from you!

About Exsolvæ:

Exsolvæ is a Brussels-based consultancy at the forefront of Data and Artificial Intelligence innovation. We specialize in providing expert Consultancy, Audit, and Solution Development services to empower our partners in overcoming unique challenges. Our holistic approach fosters collaboration across diverse domains, including Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and AI.


At Exsolvæ, our ""Solvers"" are passionate professionals equipped with cutting-edge tools, a culture of continuous learning, and an unwavering commitment to delivering high-impact solutions.


We are seeking a Business Intelligence &
column2:
Advanced Analytics Specialist to join our expert team and help our clients unlock the power of data to drive strategic decision-making and innovation.


Your Role:

As a Business Intelligence &
column3:
Advanced Analytics Specialist, you will design and implement data-driven solutions that enable organizations to make informed, strategic decisions. You will work alongside multidisciplinary teams, using advanced BI tools and techniques to create insightful dashboards, reports, and analytics workflows.


What We’re Looking For:


Required Skills and Qualifications

  • Educational Background: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Business Intelligence, or a related field.
  • Languages: Written &
column4:
Spoken Fluency in English AND French or Dutch
  • Seniority: 3-7 years of work experience
  • Technical Expertise: Proficiency in data visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik, and strong SQL skills for querying databases.
  • Data Integration Skills: Experience with ETL/ELT processes and tools such as Azure Data Factory, SSIS, or Informatica.
  • Cloud Experience: Hands-on experience with cloud BI platforms like Azure Synapse Analytics, AWS QuickSight, or Google BigQuery.
  • Programming Skills: Familiarity with Python or R for advanced analytics and statistical modeling.
  • Soft Skills: Strong analytical thinking, communication, and collaboration skills to work with clients and multidisciplinary teams.


    • Preferred Skills

    • Knowledge of big data tools like Apache Spark or Hadoop.
    • Experience with predictive analytics and machine learning integration into BI workflows.
    • Familiarity with KPI frameworks and business acumen to align analytics with strategic goals.
    • Certifications such as Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate or Tableau Certified Professional.


    What You’ll Do:


    Core Expertise

    • Client Engagement: Collaborate with clients to assess their analytical needs and recommend BI solutions that align with their strategic goals.
    • Data Integration and Reporting: Design and implement data visualization solutions using tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik, creating impactful dashboards and reports.
    • Data Ecosystem Implementation: Build and optimize scalable data pipelines to process and transform data efficiently for BI and analytics purposes.


    Technical Implementation

    • Data Modeling: Develop and maintain robust, scalable data models to support analytical needs.
    • ETL/ELT Development: Create efficient data integration workflows using ETL/ELT tools and frameworks.
    • Advanced Analytics: Apply statistical and predictive modeling techniques to extract actionable insights from complex datasets.
    • Cloud BI Solutions: Deploy and manage BI workflows on platforms such as Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud to ensure performance and scalability.


    Research and Innovation

    • Stay updated on advancements in BI and analytics technologies, tools, and methodologies.
    • Explore innovative ways to integrate advanced analytics techniques, such as predictive analytics and machine learning, into BI solutions.


    Project Management

    • Lead BI and analytics projects from concept to completion, ensuring timely and high-quality delivery.
    • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver end-to-end solutions that meet client objectives.


    Training and Support

    • Conduct workshops and training sessions to empower client teams with BI and analytics capabilities.
    • Provide ongoing support to ensure the reliability and scalability of deployed solutions.


    Why Join Us?

    • Impactful Projects: Contribute to diverse BI and analytics projects across industries like finance, healthcare, retail, and manufacturing.
    • Continuous Learning: Access the latest BI and analytics tools and training opportunities to stay at the cutting edge.
    • Collaborative Culture: Be part of a supportive team that values knowledge sharing and mutual growth.
    • Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy a balanced work model with opportunities for remote and in-office collaboration.
    • Competitive Compensation: Benefit from an attractive salary, performance-based bonuses, and comprehensive benefits.


    If you are a driven professional with a passion for Business Intelligence and Advanced Analytics, and a proven ability to design and deploy impactful data-driven solutions, we’d love to hear from you!

4142277435,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-confirm%C3%A9-h-f-at-extia-4142277435?position=47&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=sY7qjX5XhU1c8qBYGIyL9A%3D%3D,Data Analyst Confirmé (H/F),Extia,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

Bon(ne) communiquant(e), vous créez facilement du lien avec les nouvelles personnes que vous rencontrez, Méthodique, les plans d’action sont dans votre ADN, Ayant le goût du résultat, avec vous il n’y a pas de problème, il n’y a que des solutions. Attiré(e) par le challenge, vous souhaitez gagner en compétences au sein d’une équipe originale, ambitieuse et très dynamique ?

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.
Vous serez notamment en charge de :
Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises
Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 3 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :
Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,

Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.
Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence

Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération
Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :

  • Comprendre les problématiques métier,
  • Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
  • Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
  • Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
  • Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises

PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 3 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :

  • Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
  • Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
  • Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.

PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT

  • Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
  • Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
  • Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence

Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas &
column2:

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

LES PETITS PLUS

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay 🌏 Envie d’évoluer ? As a Junior Digital Customer Journey Analyst, your role is to capture and understand the end-to-end customer journey across all digital touchpoints. Your insights will help improve the customer experience and enhance the performance of the digital business.
Define tagging strategies and collaborate with Frontend developers to implement technical specifications.
Build and monitor reports, KPIs, and supporting metrics
Perform quantitative analyses for continuous improvement.
Present analytical results through compelling storytelling with data.
Foster a data-driven mindset within the organisation by educating stakeholders and facilitating data-driven decision-making
Experience with Adobe Analytics is essential.
Familiarity with Content Square, Adobe Target, Tableau Software, and SQL is advantageous
Ability to translate objectives into KPIs and supporting metrics, and tell engaging stories with data
Strong analytical and logical thinking, meticulous organisation, customer obsession, creativity, and solution orientation.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills are crucial
A master’s degree (or equivalent work experience) in mathematics, statistics, business intelligence, computer engineering, economy, digital marketing, or marketing is preferred
Join a team that values innovation, collaboration, and excellence, apply now or email Lydia.wills@church-int.com

MUST BE BASED IN BELGIUM

50% on-site in Brussels, 50% remote working


As a Junior Digital Customer Journey Analyst, your role is to capture and understand the end-to-end customer journey across all digital touchpoints. Your insights will help improve the customer experience and enhance the performance of the digital business.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Define tagging strategies and collaborate with Frontend developers to implement technical specifications.
  • Build and monitor reports, KPIs, and supporting metrics
  • Perform quantitative analyses for continuous improvement.
  • Present analytical results through compelling storytelling with data.
  • Foster a data-driven mindset within the organisation by educating stakeholders and facilitating data-driven decision-making
  • Coordinate projects ensuring high-quality deliverables


Skills and Experience Required:

  • Experience with Adobe Analytics is essential.
  • Familiarity with Content Square, Adobe Target, Tableau Software, and SQL is advantageous
  • Ability to translate objectives into KPIs and supporting metrics, and tell engaging stories with data
  • Strong analytical and logical thinking, meticulous organisation, customer obsession, creativity, and solution orientation.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills are crucial
  • A master’s degree (or equivalent work experience) in mathematics, statistics, business intelligence, computer engineering, economy, digital marketing, or marketing is preferred


Language Proficiency:

  • English: Excellent
  • French and Dutch: advantage


Join a team that values innovation, collaboration, and excellence, apply now or email Lydia.wills@church-int.com

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération
Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay 🌏 Envie d’évoluer ? Grâce à notre politique de mobilité interne, explorez de nouvelles opportunités en Belgique ou dans l’un de nos 7 autres pays !

Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui

  • Créatif, vous avez toujours une solution inédite mais adéquate à proposer
  • Curieux, poser des questions est votre seconde nature
  • Analytique, vous avez une âme d’enquêteur et les énigmes n’ont aucun secret pour vous

Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :

  • Comprendre les problématiques métier,
  • Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
  • Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
  • Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
  • Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises

PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 5 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :

  • Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
  • Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
  • Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.

PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT

  • Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
  • Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
  • Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence

Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

4189730666,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/research-data-intern-at-long-duration-energy-storage-council-ldes-council-4189730666?position=50&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=D7nIn%2BJ54Q2jxIxc6wlUQg%3D%3D,Research & Data Intern,Long Duration Energy Storage Council (LDES Council),"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Research & Data Intern

The Long Duration Energy Storage (LDES) Council is a global non-profit organization with founding members and a Board made up of executives and business leaders from leading energy companies, technology providers, investors and end-users. The LDES Council advances the decarbonisation of our world through the acceleration of long duration energy storage by providing member-driven, fact-based guidance and research on the deployment of long-duration energy storage for society's benefit.

Launched on November 4, 2021 at COP26, the LDES Council is rapidly growing and has established itself as a catalyst in driving global dialogues on long duration storage by providing fact-based guidance and information drawn from members’ expertise.
We are now seeking a Research & Data Intern to support our work tracking LDES projects, analyzing industry trends, and contributing to key research initiatives.
Location: Remote (+/- 3 hours Central European Timezone)
Employment Type: Paid internship (Full-time, 6 months with a possibility to extend)

The Research & Data Intern will play a vital role in managing and updating the LDES Council’s global project tracker, supporting industry research, and contributing to the development of key Council publications. This internship is an exciting opportunity for an individual passionate about clean energy, data management, and technology research who is looking to gain hands-on experience in the industry.
Maintain and update the global LDES project tracker, ensuring data accuracy and completeness.
Organize and enter project data, identifying and filling gaps
Conduct research to track new projects, funding announcements, and technology deployments.
Work with external partners to innovate on developing a new format for the tracker.
Work with Excel, Google Sheets, and other database tools to manage energy storage project data.
Assist in data gathering, cleaning, and analysis for internal reports and publications.
Support research on energy storage technologies, policies, and industry trends.
Assist in updating and formatting the LDES Technology Lookbook with clear, visually appealing content.
Support the development of research-based materials, including reports, presentations, and white papers.
Monitor and track new energy storage projects, policy developments, and market trends.
Summarize key findings for internal discussions, presentations, and external reports.
Compile industry insights from various sources to inform Council initiatives.
Assist with outreach to industry stakeholders to gather project data and insights.
Support team projects related to energy storage research, data tracking, and member engagement.
Contribute ideas to improve research methodologies, workflows, and Council initiatives.
Gain exposure to industry leaders, emerging technologies, and key policy discussions, providing a valuable opportunity for learning and career development within the organization.
Comfortable working with data management and analysis tools (Excel, Google Sheets, or similar).
Strong research and analytical skills, with the ability to summarize complex information clearly.
Interest in energy, sustainability, and emerging technologies.
High attention to detail and ability to organize large datasets.
Willingness to learn, take initiative, and collaborate in a fast-paced environment.
Educational background or experience in energy, engineering, policy, or data analytics is a plus.

Don’t meet every single requirement? We are dedicated to building an inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply.
· Full time, permanent, salaried, benefits-eligible, exempt status
· Healthcare provided by LDES Council for individual, including medical, dental, vision insurance
column2: family insurance available

column1: · 401k contribution with matching contributions (in the US)
· Flexible paid time off, including your birthday!
A short letter outlining your motivation and how you meet the requirements for the role
Please email your application to careers@ldescouncil.com using the subject line: “Recruiting: Research & Data Intern.""

Rejoignez un projet stratégique et mettez votre expertise Data au service de la performance !


Nous recherchons un Data Analyst expérimenté (Freelance) pour accompagner une entreprise innovante dans l’exploitation avancée de ses données et l’amélioration continue de leur qualité.


Vos principales responsabilités :

  • Explorer et analyser les données pour identifier leurs caractéristiques (type, structure, schémas récurrents, valeurs, anomalies…).
  • Évaluer la qualité des données au sein de différents datasets et détecter d’éventuelles désynchronisations.
  • Produire des rapports de profilage (complétude, validité, unicité, cohérence, véracité, actualisation) et des rapports opérationnels sur la qualité des données.
  • Automatiser les processus de profilage et reporting afin d’optimiser la gestion des données critiques.
  • Fournir des inputs pour la mise à jour des règles de Data Quality (DQ) et contribuer à l’amélioration du catalogue de données.


Profil recherché :

  • Diplôme universitaire ou supérieur en informatique, data, statistique, mathématiques ou équivalent.
  • 2 à 5 ans d’expérience en analyse de données et gestion de la qualité des données.
  • Maîtrise des outils et langages liés à la Data Analysis et à la Data Quality.
  • Capacité à travailler en autonomie tout en collaborant avec les différentes parties prenantes.
  • Anglais courant, la connaissance du français ou du néerlandais est un plus.


Localisation : Belgique

Durée du contrat : Mission freelance de courte ou longue durée


Envoyez votre CV à jour et détaillé à sara@arbalett.com

A propos de JEMS

Nous sommes le seul industriel de la donnée en Europe. Notre métier est de créer, manager et exploiter le patrimoine data de nos clients.

Nous avons la conviction que chaque entreprise peut adopter une démarche innovante de gestion de la donnée et créer des cas d’usage disruptifs en réduisant l'impact écologique et en diminuant la dette technique.

Nous comptons plus de 840 collaborateurs en mission chez nos clients grands comptes dans tout secteur d’activité : banque, assurance, santé, énergie, e-commerce, automobile, luxe, retail, transport, agritech…

Vos missions

Nous recherchons un(e) Data Analyst confirmé(e) capable d'accompagner les métiers dans l'aide à la décision.

Vous Aurez La Charge De

  • Guider / recommander le Métier dans l’exploitation et la valorisation des multiples sources de données et identifier des leviers d’optimisation et d’amélioration des processus Business
  • Être l‘intermédiaire entre le Métier et la DSI
  • Accroître la connaissance de la clientèle d’une entreprise, conduire des études sur les bases de données, suivre les outils datamining pour analyser l’impact des actions marketing
  • Mener et conduire des études (coordination/pilotage)

Vos compétences

En Tant Que Data Analyst Vous Maitrisez

  • MS Office
  • Le requêtage SQL
  • Des outils BI Fonction Expertise sur les données du Métier
  • Des solutions Analytiques (Data Science ou Data Mining / BI)
  • Des outils de datavisualisation
  • La préparation de données

Votre profil

Vous êtes diplômé(e) d’une école d’ingénieur ou d’un parcours universitaire technique. Vous justifiez d’au minimum 3 ans d’expérience professionnelle en tant que Data Analyst.

  • Une JEMS Académie au service de votre montée en compétences (formations et certifications sur les technologies de pointe)
  • Un accompagnement personnalisé et un management de proximité pour vous proposer des évolutions de carrière
  • Une intégration dans des communautés techniques et de pratiques JEMS (encadrement par des experts, échanges sur les bonnes pratiques, favoriser l'innovation...)

Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

Can’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.

Your journey with us

Join us and you’ll be immersed in a dynamic company where you’ll work with a diverse group of talented colleagues on a variety of exciting projects.

You’ll be inspired and learn every day, exploring many different industries and collaborating with our clients, ranging from large national to multinational companies to non-profit and public sector organisations.

This is the field of interest for you, if you want to conduct in-depth analyses of business and technology issues, but also make recommendations to improve or transform our clients' businesses.

Depending on the team you join, you will have different kinds of tasks:

  • You'll work on interesting and challenging assignments that inspire you daily with their diversity
  • You’ll assist in analysing data, helping our clients to unlock their data solutions and to drive analytical needs
  • You’ll put your analytical skills into practice, improving your strong analytical mind.
  • You’ll capture and translate requirements from the business as well as new existing environments.
  • You’ll extract, collect, and organise data to find correlations and patterns that produce meaningful conclusions relevant to businesses.
  • You’ll work with different kinds of software, data tools, and ERP systems.
  • You'll structure and leverage our clients’ data to improve their businesses.

The list above is a general overview. You'll receive more information during the interviews.

Let’s Talk About You

  • You are in the final year of your bachelor or master’s degree or your pre-final master year.
  • You are highly motivated, and a reliable team player with a sense of initiative.
  • You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and have a good knowledge of English.
  • You have a critical mindset and good analytical skills.
  • You have the ability to conceptualise and articulate ideas and solutions.
  • You are results oriented.
  • You are able to use MS Office tools (Excel, Word and PowerPoint).
  • You work methodically and conscientiously.
  • You are rigorous in your daily routine, but also in your working tools and methods.

Who is Deloitte?

We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.

In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.

Why Deloitte?

Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.

Never stop growing!Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.

We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.

Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:

  • Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte
  • Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents@Deloitte
  • Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
  • Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities

Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangementsremains essential in today's reality:

  • Hybrid workplace:combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).
  • Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.

Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

4192060384,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-bi-data-analyst-at-pawatech-4192060384?position=57&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=%2Ft6KX2h5Qhix5DgQYif2Fw%3D%3D,Senior BI Data Analyst,pawaTech,European Union,"pawaTech is looking for a Senior BI Data Analyst with a strong commitment to teamwork and a collaborative mindset. You will be part of the Business Intelligence and Data Warehouse team, ensuring the accuracy and integrity of financial reporting while developing tools to support internal and external stakeholders. In this role, you will work closely with finance and compliance teams, provide actionable insights, and contribute to reporting processes for country-level operations as we expand into new markets.

pawaTech is a leading iGaming solutions provider, delivering sportsbook, casino, lottery, and player management software as a service. We power betPawa - Africa’s largest betting brand, operating across multiple markets.

Our platform is designed for scale, handling millions of active users across web and mobile, processing thousands of transactions every second. With nearly a decade of industry expertise, we don’t just build software - we craft tailored solutions that drive innovation. Our expertise, commitment to quality, and client-focused approach make us a trusted partner in Africa and beyond.
Ensuring accurate and reliable financial reporting
Developing reporting tools for external stakeholders like regulators and tax authorities
Supporting financial audits with accurate data
Collaborating with finance compliance and data warehouse teams
Conducting ad-hoc analyses to support business and financial decisions
Building and maintaining dashboards and data visualisations to communicate insights effectively
Analysing large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies, ensuring data-driven decision-making
Performing quality checks and delivering country-level financial reporting as we expand.
What makes you a great candidate:
At least 5 years of experience working in data analytics, business intelligence, or a related field
Strong proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation
Experience with data visualisation tools such as Tableau or Power BI
Knowledge of Python for data manipulation and analysis
Basic understanding of finance or financial reporting (beneficial)
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field, such as Computer Science, Data Analytics, or a related discipline (Mathematics, Business, Engineering, and any scientific field with data handling)
Excellent communication skills to present findings and collaborate with cross-functional teams
We make an impact and contribute to shaping of the iGaming culture
We offer growth inside dedicated teams of seniors and career prospects
We embrace modern technological stack and innovative approach
We value balance - hybrid environment, wellness-related perks and team events are waiting for you
We play it fair with compensation that recognises and backs your achievements, team budgets and recognition milestone bonuses.
This job is accepting ongoing applications and there is no application deadline.

At pawaTech, we are dedicated to building a welcoming and diverse workplace and invite applicants from all backgrounds, regardless of race, gender, age, or other protected characteristics. Our hiring process ensures fairness, objectivity, and respect for every applicant. Applicants are welcome to redact or omit information from their resumes that identifies their age, date of birth, or dates of attendance or graduation from educational institutions.

In compliance with EU GDPR standards and PDPA in Estonia, your personal data will be treated confidentially, used purely for recruitment, and accessible only to authorised hiring team members. To request data deletion, updates, or transfers, please reach out via data.protection@pawatech.com we will fulfil your request in accordance with applicable data protection laws.

4192819014,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/freelance-data-specialist-at-vivid-resourcing-4192819014?position=59&pageNum=0&refId=JjTrskPlPqysaiLxzQtngQ%3D%3D&trackingId=UR0TH0rg6qbJVP4p7%2FpJdA%3D%3D,Freelance Data Specialist,Vivid Resourcing,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Freelance Data Specilaist

We are seeking a skilled Data Specialist with expertise in Power BI, SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), and SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) to join our dynamic data team. The ideal candidate will play a crucial role in managing, transforming, and visualizing complex datasets, enabling data-driven decision-making across the organization. You will work closely with business analysts, data engineers, and stakeholders to build robust data solutions.
Design, develop, and maintain Power BI reports and dashboards that provide actionable insights.
Create complex visualizations and metrics that represent data clearly and concisely for business users.
Troubleshoot and optimize Power BI reports for performance and usability.
Develop, implement, and maintain SSIS packages to extract, transform, and load (ETL) data from various sources.
Ensure data quality and integrity by performing necessary data cleansing and transformation tasks.
Optimize and troubleshoot SSIS packages for efficiency and scalability.
Design and maintain OLAP cubes and tabular models using SSAS for advanced data analytics.
Implement and optimize SSAS solutions for high performance and efficient querying.
Develop MDX (Multidimensional Expressions) and DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) queries to support advanced analytics.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand data requirements and build data models to meet those needs.
Implement data pipelines that ensure the seamless integration of multiple data sources into reporting systems.
Develop and manage data warehouses, ensuring optimal performance and scalability
If you are interested or know anyone who could be a good fit please send your CV to matthew.pring@vividresourcing.com or call +32 (0) 331 882 88

Freelance Data Specilaist


We are seeking a skilled Data Specialist with expertise in Power BI, SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), and SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) to join our dynamic data team. The ideal candidate will play a crucial role in managing, transforming, and visualizing complex datasets, enabling data-driven decision-making across the organization. You will work closely with business analysts, data engineers, and stakeholders to build robust data solutions.


Responsibilities:


  • Design, develop, and maintain Power BI reports and dashboards that provide actionable insights.
  • Create complex visualizations and metrics that represent data clearly and concisely for business users.
  • Troubleshoot and optimize Power BI reports for performance and usability.
  • Develop, implement, and maintain SSIS packages to extract, transform, and load (ETL) data from various sources.
  • Ensure data quality and integrity by performing necessary data cleansing and transformation tasks.
  • Optimize and troubleshoot SSIS packages for efficiency and scalability.
  • Design and maintain OLAP cubes and tabular models using SSAS for advanced data analytics.
  • Implement and optimize SSAS solutions for high performance and efficient querying.
  • Develop MDX (Multidimensional Expressions) and DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) queries to support advanced analytics.
  • Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand data requirements and build data models to meet those needs.
  • Implement data pipelines that ensure the seamless integration of multiple data sources into reporting systems.
  • Develop and manage data warehouses, ensuring optimal performance and scalability


Additional Details:


  • START DATE: Flexible
  • DURATION: Long term
  • CONTRACT: Freelance
  • ONSITE POLICY: Brussels (hybrid)
  • HOURS PER WEEK: 40
  • LANGUAGES: Dutch and English
  • INTERVIEW PROCESS: Two-stage


If you are interested or know anyone who could be a good fit please send your CV to matthew.pring@vividresourcing.com or call +32 (0) 331 882 88

Salt is working with a globally recognised brand, seeking bilingual (English and Thai) and capable Social Listening / Insight Analysts for a minimum of 12-months.

-- Work closely with the wider insights team to translate internal briefs into analytical projects, and conduct analysis using a range of in-house tools to derive actionable insights

-- Build and test queries on in-house tools, and create well-crafted visualisations, primarily in PowerPoint

SII Belgium is currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Big Data to join our team. As a Big Data Analyst, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing big data solutions to support business objectives. You will work with large, complex data sets and be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to identify trends and insights. . You would join various teams working in the Energy, Retail, Banking or Telecom sectors.

SII is a European digital and engineering services company of 16,000 experts. SII Belgium supports large businesses in adopting new technologies and innovation management. SII values empowerment and entrepreneurship, providing a fulfilling work environment for employees. Our mission is to contribute to the design and development of future products and services for customers. SII is committed to a sustainable digital world and is recognized as a Great Workplace.  

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and maintain big data solutions to support business objectives
  • Analyze and interpret large, complex data sets to identify trends and insights
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement data-driven solutions
  • Create and maintain data visualization and reporting tools to support decision-making
  • Integration between enterprise architecture and data collection.
  • Stay up to date with industry trends and technologies to identify new opportunities for data analysis

Qualifications:

  • You hold a bachelor’s or master’s degree in IT.
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience working with data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Hive…
  • Strong analytical skills and experience using statistical techniques to interpret data
  • Experience with data visualization and reporting tools such as Tableau and Power BI
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills
  • Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
  • You are fluent in Dutch and/or French, and fluent in English.

We offer:

  • A challenging and varied role in a growing company
  • Opportunity to work with the latest technologies
  • Competitive salary and benefits
  • Opportunity to improve your skills and knowledge through training and education
  • Warm and open company culture, supported by an international group

If you are passionate about Data and want to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at SII Belgium.

4142276479,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-bi-engineer-data-analyst-%C2%A0-september-2025-at-capgemini-4142276479?position=2&pageNum=2&refId=df9LLyVYuiY7jo%2BcedbC1Q%3D%3D&trackingId=7P%2BI6Xq6tRTNgpD8ybaZgA%3D%3D,Junior BI Engineer / Data Analyst -  September 2025,Capgemini,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided everyday by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of over 350,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong 55-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.
Get The Future You Want | https://www.capgemini.com/be-en

Data Analyst and BI Engineers are the foundation of the Data and AI profession, applying their expertise to ensure governance and management, and influencing business decisions by the stories they tell with data.
At Capgemini, this multifaceted specialism has significant experience across traditional warehousing technologies and databases, Big Data and Cloud. There is never a dull moment in this career path!
As a junior Data Analyst & Bi Engineer, you will be responsible for:
Integrate, transform and consolidate data from various structured and unstructured data systems.
Translate functional requirements into a scalable, fit-for-use technical design.
Own the delivery of data modelling and data pipelines.
Implementing a new operating model which supports innovation and acceleration through data & analytics.
Contributing data expertise to strategic projects that align with the clients goals.
We Are Looking For Someone Who
Owns a bachelor’s or master’s degree in Data Science, Business Engineering, Computer Sciences, or equivalent.
Has strong knowledge of SQL (this is a must).
Is fluent in Dutch or French and English, but notion of other language and willing to improve.
Is geographically mobile: Although you must be ready to accept assignments anywhere in Belgium, most of your assignments will be Brussels based.
Success In This Role Often Comes Down To
Strong communication skills: You can convey complex ideas clearly and persuasively.
Teamwork: You excel at collaborating and building meaningful relationships.
Organizational talent: You maintain oversight and prioritize effectively in a dynamic environment.
Problem-solving ability: You think creatively and tackle challenges proactively.
We offer a supportive, flexible, and growth-oriented workplace where your contributions make a difference. Here’s what you can expect:
A hybrid work model with up to 70% remote work.
Access to world-class learning platforms to upskill in marketing, communications, and leadership.
A dynamic, fun, and collaborative marketing team.
A brand-new, state-of-the-art office in Diegem.
Competitive salary with a flex plan to customize your benefits, including a company car or mobility budget.
Comprehensive health and group insurance, meal & eco vouchers.
32 vacation days, plus bank holidays, with options to purchase extra time off.
Opportunities for international exposure and travel to support exciting projects and events.
We'd love to hear from you if you’re passionate about communication and eager to grow in a fast-paced, innovative, and international company.
Apply today and Get The Future You Want!

About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided everyday by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of over 350,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong 55-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.

Get The Future You Want | https://www.capgemini.com/be-en

Your role

Data Analyst and BI Engineers are the foundation of the Data and AI profession, applying their expertise to ensure governance and management, and influencing business decisions by the stories they tell with data.

At Capgemini, this multifaceted specialism has significant experience across traditional warehousing technologies and databases, Big Data and Cloud. There is never a dull moment in this career path!

As a junior Data Analyst &
column2:
Bi Engineer, you will be responsible for:

  • Integrate, transform and consolidate data from various structured and unstructured data systems.
  • Create and design data models.
  • Translate functional requirements into a scalable, fit-for-use technical design.
  • Own the delivery of data modelling and data pipelines.
  • Implementing a new operating model which supports innovation and acceleration through data &
column3:
analytics.

4205241108,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-confirm%C3%A9-h-f-at-extia-4205241108?position=3&pageNum=2&refId=df9LLyVYuiY7jo%2BcedbC1Q%3D%3D&trackingId=aitbtXJxH6UZQ%2Fyp9Er9EA%3D%3D,Data Analyst Confirmé (H/F),Extia,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

Bon(ne) communiquant(e), vous créez facilement du lien avec les nouvelles personnes que vous rencontrez, Méthodique, les plans d’action sont dans votre ADN, Ayant le goût du résultat, avec vous il n’y a pas de problème, il n’y a que des solutions. Attiré(e) par le challenge, vous souhaitez gagner en compétences au sein d’une équipe originale, ambitieuse et très dynamique ?

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.
Vous serez notamment en charge de :
Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises
Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 3 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :
Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,

Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.
Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence

Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération
Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay 🌏 Envie d’évoluer ? Grâce à notre politique de mobilité interne, explorez de nouvelles opportunités en Belgique ou dans l’un de nos 7 autres pays !

Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui

Bon(ne) communiquant(e), vous créez facilement du lien avec les nouvelles personnes que vous rencontrez, Méthodique, les plans d’action sont dans votre ADN, Ayant le goût du résultat, avec vous il n’y a pas de problème, il n’y a que des solutions. Attiré(e) par le challenge, vous souhaitez gagner en compétences au sein d’une équipe originale, ambitieuse et très dynamique ?

Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :

  • Comprendre les problématiques métier,
  • Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
  • Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
  • Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
  • Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises

PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 3 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :

  • Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
  • Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
  • Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.

PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT

  • Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
  • Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
  • Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence

Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas &
column2:
Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

4204097332,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-accountable-4204097332?position=4&pageNum=2&refId=df9LLyVYuiY7jo%2BcedbC1Q%3D%3D&trackingId=aLn4nAgn4PQrcv5WelAm2w%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Accountable,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","About AccountableAccountable is revolutionising financial management for the self-employed. Our platform simplifies taxes, accounting, and financial administration for the self-employed - and we're even expanding into banking. With a proven product and a growing customer base, we are now looking for a Data Analyst to drive data-driven decision making.

As a data analyst, you will play a critical role in optimising conversion to paid, ARPA, and monetisation strategies by running deep analyses, translating complex data into actionable recommendations and driving experimentation. Additionally, you will support our Performance Marketing team by identifying patterns, improving marketing efficiency, and helping optimise our key metrics.
Analyse conversion funnels, pricing models, and customer behaviour to proactively identify revenue growth opportunities.
Identify friction points in the user journey and recommend data-backed optimisations.
Oversee tracking of key revenue metrics, including Conversion to paid, ARPA, cost of acquisition (CAC), lifetime value (LTV), Churn, and Retention in the company.
Build dashboards and visualisations to provide real-time insights to the company.
Take part in the Revenue Growth meeting, to come up with and implement data-driven growth experiments.
Support A/B testing and experimentation within the company, ensuring statistical analysis of results.
Identify patterns in user acquisition that can help optimise performance marketing campaigns.
Analyse and recommend levers to improve LTV & CAC.
Work with the Performance Marketing team to refine audience targeting and budget allocation.
Help the Content Marketing Team with data requests to enrich their content operations.
A quick word about data infrastructure
At Accountable, data is currently hosted in different services:
Our own database & its analytical datalake
It will be expected of you that you can retrieve, combine & analyze data from those different sources to come up with the relevant insights.
We are constantly looking at ways to do things better and will likely, thanks to your help, improve this infrastructure.
Using programs such as Amplitude and Spreadsheets, you can turn raw data into meaningful insights and actionable recommendations.
You understand A/B testing, conversion optimisation, and monetisation strategies.
You have great intuition when it comes to building product & having a meaningful impact for the company/our users.
You take ownership, work independently, and thrive in cross-functional teams.
You understand digital marketing metrics, CAC/LTV, and how to optimise acquisition strategies.
A university degree in Data Analysis or a related field is preferred
Min. 3 years of experience in Data Analytics
🌍 Work at a fast-growing fintech that’s making self-employment easier.
🥊 Make a direct impact on the growth and profitability of our business.
🎯 Join a data-driven culture that believes in rapid iteration, and making decisions based on data.
💡You will have the freedom to drive your own projects and influence key business decisions.
🤝 Work closely with Product, Marketing, and Engineering to bring data to life.

About AccountableAccountable is revolutionising financial management for the self-employed. Our platform simplifies taxes, accounting, and financial administration for the self-employed - and we're even expanding into banking. With a proven product and a growing customer base, we are now looking for a Data Analyst to drive data-driven decision making.


About the role


As a data analyst, you will play a critical role in optimising conversion to paid, ARPA, and monetisation strategies by running deep analyses, translating complex data into actionable recommendations and driving experimentation. Additionally, you will support our Performance Marketing team by identifying patterns, improving marketing efficiency, and helping optimise our key metrics.


Tasks

Key Responsibilities
Revenue Growth &
column2:
Experimentation (80%)



  • Analyse conversion funnels, pricing models, and customer behaviour to proactively identify revenue growth opportunities.

  • Identify friction points in the user journey and recommend data-backed optimisations.

  • Oversee tracking of key revenue metrics, including Conversion to paid, ARPA, cost of acquisition (CAC), lifetime value (LTV), Churn, and Retention in the company.

  • Build dashboards and visualisations to provide real-time insights to the company.

  • Take part in the Revenue Growth meeting, to come up with and implement data-driven growth experiments.

  • Support A/B testing and experimentation within the company, ensuring statistical analysis of results.


Performance Marketing Support (20%)



  • Identify patterns in user acquisition that can help optimise performance marketing campaigns.

  • Analyse and recommend levers to improve LTV &
column3:
CAC.
  • Work with the Performance Marketing team to refine audience targeting and budget allocation.

  • Help the Content Marketing Team with data requests to enrich their content operations.


    • A quick word about data infrastructure


    At Accountable, data is currently hosted in different services:



    • Our own database &
column4:
its analytical datalake
  • Amplitude (user in-app events &
column5:
visualization)
  • Intercom (CRM)

  • BigQuery (ETL engine)

  • Gsheet &
column6:
Looker (visualization)

It will be expected of you that you can retrieve, combine &
column7:
analyze data from those different sources to come up with the relevant insights.


We are constantly looking at ways to do things better and will likely, thanks to your help, improve this infrastructure.


Requirements

Who you are



  • Data-driven problem solver


Using programs such as Amplitude and Spreadsheets, you can turn raw data into meaningful insights and actionable recommendations.



  • Growth &
column8:
experimentation mindset

You understand A/B testing, conversion optimisation, and monetisation strategies.



  • Business &
column9:
product sense

You have great intuition when it comes to building product &
column10:
having a meaningful impact for the company/our users.



  • Technical skills


Proficiently in basic programming (Python)



  • Proactive &
column11:
collaborative

You take ownership, work independently, and thrive in cross-functional teams.



  • Bonus: marketing analytics experience


You understand digital marketing metrics, CAC/LTV, and how to optimise acquisition strategies.


Requirements



  • Based in Berlin

  • Fluent in German

  • A university degree in Data Analysis or a related field is preferred

  • Min. 3 years of experience in Data Analytics


Benefits

Why join Accountable?


🌍 Work at a fast-growing fintech that’s making self-employment easier.


🥊 Make a direct impact on the growth and profitability of our business.


🎯 Join a data-driven culture that believes in rapid iteration, and making decisions based on data.


💡You will have the freedom to drive your own projects and influence key business decisions.


🤝 Work closely with Product, Marketing, and Engineering to bring data to life.

column1: <icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

4198440376,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/crm-data-analyst-at-nestl%C3%A9-nespresso-sa-4198440376?position=6&pageNum=2&refId=df9LLyVYuiY7jo%2BcedbC1Q%3D%3D&trackingId=F3l0eQDDUgd7cai5kuOzUA%3D%3D,CRM Data Analyst,Nestlé Nespresso SA,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","CRM Data Analyst, this is your challenge

Do you have a passion for data, insights, and coffee? Do you want to work together with energized teams towards the most performing plans for the Belux market? By joining our CX&I team, you will be in charge of customers insights, be the database guardian and also further optimize our analytics corner.
A day in the life of a CRM Data Analyst:
In charge of monthly B2C & B2B CRM reporting from basic KPIs to forecasting net acquisition.
Perform statistical analysis through different tools (Nespresso is working with Adobe, Knime, Snowflake, PowerBI) and present recommendations to the business.
Optimize analytical worklfows through automation and forecasting with pre-built data science tools.
Maintain DataHub knowledge & documentation, share best pratices and be the first point of contact locally.
Lead & implement the new Martech solution followed by continuous improvement in usage & roll-out.
Lead yearly deep dives across departments (collect requests, time & build & deliver analytics to stakeholders).
Adhoc analysis for internal departments (boutique, e-sales, trade, B2B), both re-actively and pro-actively.

The Nespresso Marketing team consists of 17 persons operating in 4 distinct teams: Brand, Product, B2B and Customer experience & insights. You would be part of the later one which is a dynamic analytical team of 5 persons. The CX&I team collaborates with all the departments (Channels, Demand & supply, B2C,..) to nurture the company with insights thanks to Nespresso’s direct to consumer model. Our team is also the guardian of net acquisition and subscription on top of insights.
Degree in mathematics/statistics, or economic studies with large quantitative component.
More than 3 years of experience in data / analytics related activities in a business-oriented environment.
Understand SQL language & Snowflake (or having experience in coding).
Master OS office (Excel, Powerpoint, Word) and Power BI.
You have an open mindset and enjoy discovering new tools & approaches.
Knowledge about Adobe campaign and Adobe experience platform is a plus.
Fluent in Dutch and/or French AND English is mandatory.
A full-time position located in Brussels.
Excellent benefits, including an annual target bonus.
A variety of professional trainings and development programs.
Various career opportunities, both in Benelux and internationally.
Professional working environment, team spirit, company pride and passionate colleagues.
You will contribute to make Belux a better coffee place
Our recruiters would be glad to ask any pending questions. Feel free to send your questions to careers@be.nestle.com and you will receive an answer within 3 working days.
Applying for the role of CRM Data Analyst?
Great! If you see a match with the description as described above, we will gladly receive your cv and motivation. You can upload these via the link.

We use an Artificial Intelligence (AI) Tool to schedule interviews with our candidates. So keep an eye on your email for the interview invitation! When registering your application, you will be asked if we may send you whatsapp messages
column2: if you answer 'yes' to this, you will receive communication via whatsapp in addition to messages via email. Communication through our AI tool is in English, but our recruiters speak Dutch, English, and French.

if you answer 'yes' to this, you will receive communication via whatsapp in addition to messages via email. Communication through our AI tool is in English, but our recruiters speak Dutch, English, and French.

4195458275,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-lending-data-analyst-at-ing-belgium-4195458275?position=7&pageNum=2&refId=df9LLyVYuiY7jo%2BcedbC1Q%3D%3D&trackingId=IlFgkFl6zJ73ix8JF8IXWA%3D%3D,Business Lending Data Analyst,ING Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Your role & work environment
As part of the development towards a “More Digital- and Data driven Bank”, ING is renewing the data management capabilities globally.

As a data analyst in Business Lending, you work on a daily basis with (cross-border) colleagues having different expertise in self-steering feature teams (squads), contributing to the objectives of the tribe Business Lending which are supporting the business overall. These objectives are challenging, as regulatory and risk requirements are strengthening, client expectations are changing and there is a continuous pressure to increase efficiency. Within this context, you contribute to the design of an efficient and customer-oriented value proposition thanks to an extensive use of data analytics, but also including products and services, harmonized when possible between Belgium and the Netherlands. You will cover several customer segments from self-employed to mid-corporates.

Develop and automate Management Information reports (1) enabling the senior leaders to make appropriate decisions or (2) helping the bank to follow-up it’s compliancy against regulations or internal policies.
Translating the bank and tribe strategy to concrete initiatives within the scope of your squad
Analyzing the feasibility and the value of opportunities
Evaluating our way of working with the aim to continuously improve
Liaise with Customer Journey Experts to ensure reporting & data quality requirements are covered as from the design of the process.
Actively participating and taking initiative to improve the collaboration between different stakeholders and colleagues in other teams
Understanding and applying business principles and ensure compliancy with external regulation and internal minimum requirements

A colleague with a talent for taking it on and making it happen, enthusiasm for helping others to be successful and a knack for always being a step ahead. In other words, you strive to bring fresh ideas to life and embrace challenges in a fast changing and complex environment. You are a naturally collaborative person who listens and invests in others to achieve common goals. You love to challenge the status quo and are eager to propose creative solutions to problems.
As a Business Lending Data Analyst you will also need:
To be customer driven and focused, loving to collaborate with different people, ready to explore
An entrepreneurial attitude – taking initiative and making things happen, manage and solve problems with the support of senior colleague
To act as process owner in the business lending domain with the support of a more senior colleague
To be interested in innovation in the domain, experiment by challenging existing trends, be curious
To manage projects involving one or 2 stakeholders with the support of a more senior colleague
affinity with data and good analytical skills, previous experience with data management/analysis
Knowledge of reporting software such as SAS Enteprise Guide, SAS Visual Analyics, PowerBI, Cognos, …
Planning & organizational skills and ability to develop them with coaching
Clear communication skills : written and oral, be able to adapt your speech to the audience with the help of a more senior colleague
Previous experience in a (credit) risk oriented role is a plus
Knowledge of business lending products/services is recommended
Fluent in English and Dutch or French
Master degree or Bachelor degree with relevant work experience (e.g. Business Analyst, Data Analyst, .. )
