4157911762,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/associate-it-officer-and-business-analyst-based-at-our-luxembourg-at-european-investment-bank-eib-4157911762?position=49&pageNum=0&refId=up0NnzPToC6bMNV9F32jKw%3D%3D&trackingId=W%2B%2BONgnBLgnlBkMcMz3ShA%3D%3D,(Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst - based at our Luxembourg,European Investment Bank (EIB),"Rome, Latium, Italy","This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence. The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.

The EIB, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Legal Directorate (JU) – Coordination Division (COORD) – at its headquarters in Luxembourg, an (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst* - This is a full time position at grade 4/5 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.
internal benchmark (Associate) Officer Business Support for IT Applications
Panel interviews are forseen as of March 2025.

This role is based in the Coordination Division of the Legal Directorate. As an (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst, you will work in coordination with a Senior Legal Engineering and Innovation Officer to: (i) co-ordinate the prospecting of new applications suitable for the Legal Directorate, (ii) ensure maintenance, assistance, development and deployment of IT applications for the Legal Directorate, (iii) liaise with stakeholders in the Legal Directorate to ensure close alignment with business needs, and (iv) contribute to successful IT project delivery and change management. You will also contribute to the development and maintenance of the Legal Directorate’s intranet presence and to compliance with the Bank’s data governance and data quality frameworks.

You will report to and work under the supervision of the Head of Division of JU Coordination. You will work closely with the senior management team of the Legal Directorate, JU divisions and various other counterparts. You will cooperate with central IT Services with other Data Officers and with external consultants.
Contribute to the development and deployment of new IT applications in the Legal Directorate to ensure broad-based, timely and efficient take up of new technologies
Provide support to internal clients concerning existing IT applications used by the Legal Directorate
Develop, deploy and provide ongoing support for the intranet presence of the Legal Directorate
Find new use cases for existing or new IT applications, taking into account the needs of the Legal Directorate relative to the overall IT environment of the Bank

Perform the role of JU Data Officer by: (i) taking the lead in matters related to compliance with EIBG’s data governance, data management and data quality framework, (ii) identifying and remedying data governance issues adversely affecting the functioning of the Legal Directorate
column2: and (iii) participating in meetings of the Information Governance Steering Committee and analogous bodies to represent the interests of the Legal Directorate

column1: Contribute to streamlining of JU internal processes and map, standardize, control, and automate legal workflows, documents, templates, and electronic records
Provide change management support to IT, Legal Tech & Innovation projects in the Legal Directorate
University degree, preferably in Business Administration, Computer Science/Engineering and / or in another area relevant to the job
At least 3 years of relevant professional experience in a role related to IT engineering and/or innovation
Familiarity with the SDLC (software development lifecycle), ideally at the EIBG or other relevant organization, is required
Business analysis and change management experience would be a strong asset
Knowledge of all or most of the following: Microsoft Sharepoint online, Business Object, Microsoft 365, OpenText Livelink, Smart-IT is required
Excellent organisational skills and ability to prioritise and meet deadlines, with strong result and customer orientation
Understanding of the EIB ’s mission, organisation and activities
Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (*) with a good command of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage
Find out more about EIB core competencies here
To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here

(*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.

We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.

We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
Deadline for applications: This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.

This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence. The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.

The EIB, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Legal Directorate (JU) – Coordination Division (COORD) – at its headquarters in Luxembourg, an (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst* - This is a full time position at grade 4/5 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.

  • internal benchmark (Associate) Officer Business Support for IT Applications

Panel interviews are forseen as of March 2025.

Purpose

This role is based in the Coordination Division of the Legal Directorate. As an (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst, you will work in coordination with a Senior Legal Engineering and Innovation Officer to: (i) co-ordinate the prospecting of new applications suitable for the Legal Directorate, (ii) ensure maintenance, assistance, development and deployment of IT applications for the Legal Directorate, (iii) liaise with stakeholders in the Legal Directorate to ensure close alignment with business needs, and (iv) contribute to successful IT project delivery and change management. You will also contribute to the development and maintenance of the Legal Directorate’s intranet presence and to compliance with the Bank’s data governance and data quality frameworks.

Operating Network

You will report to and work under the supervision of the Head of Division of JU Coordination. You will work closely with the senior management team of the Legal Directorate, JU divisions and various other counterparts. You will cooperate with central IT Services with other Data Officers and with external consultants.

Accountabilities

  • Contribute to the development and deployment of new IT applications in the Legal Directorate to ensure broad-based, timely and efficient take up of new technologies
  • Provide support to internal clients concerning existing IT applications used by the Legal Directorate
  • Develop, deploy and provide ongoing support for the intranet presence of the Legal Directorate
  • Find new use cases for existing or new IT applications, taking into account the needs of the Legal Directorate relative to the overall IT environment of the Bank
  • Perform the role of JU Data Officer by: (i) taking the lead in matters related to compliance with EIBG’s data governance, data management and data quality framework, (ii) identifying and remedying data governance issues adversely affecting the functioning of the Legal Directorate
column2:
and (iii) participating in meetings of the Information Governance Steering Committee and analogous bodies to represent the interests of the Legal Directorate
  • Contribute to streamlining of JU internal processes and map, standardize, control, and automate legal workflows, documents, templates, and electronic records
  • Provide change management support to IT, Legal Tech &
column3:
Innovation projects in the Legal Directorate

Qualifications

  • University degree, preferably in Business Administration, Computer Science/Engineering and / or in another area relevant to the job
  • At least 3 years of relevant professional experience in a role related to IT engineering and/or innovation
  • Familiarity with the SDLC (software development lifecycle), ideally at the EIBG or other relevant organization, is required
  • Business analysis and change management experience would be a strong asset
  • Knowledge of all or most of the following: Microsoft Sharepoint online, Business Object, Microsoft 365, OpenText Livelink, Smart-IT is required
  • Excellent organisational skills and ability to prioritise and meet deadlines, with strong result and customer orientation
  • Understanding of the EIB ’s mission, organisation and activities
  • Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (*) with a good command of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage

Competencies

Find out more about EIB core competencies here

To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here

(*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.

We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.

We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.

Deadline for applications: This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.

Per ampliamento dell’organico ricerchiamo la figura di un Data Scientist.
Ambiente di lavoro dinamico ed orientato alla crescita professionale
Piattaforma di e-commerce con scontistiche riservate ai dipendenti
Confronto all'interno di un team strutturato e coeso
Inquadramento contrattuale e retributivo commisurato alla Seniority
Programma di Buddy: un collega dedicato che ti affiancherà nel periodo iniziale per facilitare l'integrazione nel team e supportarti nell'apprendimento dei processi aziendali
Il Gruppo EIES rappresenta l'alleanza strategica di quattro aziende italiane leader nel settore informatico, unite per offrire al mercato una copertura completa, integrata e sinergica.

Composto da Energent, I&M Consulting, Enway e Skienda, il Gruppo è una realtà che eroga consulenza, progettualità e servizi in ambito ICT, fornendo soluzioni ad alto valore aggiunto per i propri clienti. Con sedi a Roma, Napoli e Milano, operiamo in settori come Finance, Insurance, Telco, Energy e Pubblica Amministrazione, collaborando con aziende di primaria importanza ed i principali System Integrator.

Il gruppo è organizzato in practices tematiche afferenti a diverse aree di competenza: Infrastrutture & Security, Application Modernization & Cloud Transformation, Data Science e Artificial Intelligence e Consulting. Inoltre, il Gruppo dispone di due Factory specializzate in Sviluppo Software e Dati che lavorano sinergicamente per progettare soluzioni innovative, affidabili e personalizzate e per la delivery di progetti chiavi in mano.

Unirsi al Gruppo EIES significa entrare a far parte di una realtà dinamica e all'avanguardia, dove il contributo di ciascuno viene valorizzato e l'innovazione è al centro di ciò che facciamo. Se cerchi una sfida stimolante in un ambiente in continua evoluzione, il nostro gruppo è il posto giusto per te.
Il presente annuncio è rivolto a entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77

4194675434,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-centers-expert-gartner-analyst-remote-emea-at-gartner-4194675434?position=53&pageNum=0&refId=up0NnzPToC6bMNV9F32jKw%3D%3D&trackingId=N52Z%2FFGQ%2Fn3o8us2xgutYw%3D%3D,"Data Centers Expert, Gartner Analyst, Remote EMEA",Gartner,"Rome, Latium, Italy","As a Director Analyst specializing in Cloud and Data Centers at Gartner, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of digital infrastructure by providing strategic advice to CIOs and IT leaders on infrastructure, operations, and cloud strategies. With a focus on emerging technologies and trends, you will deliver actionable insights and thought leadership to our clients. Your expertise will be sought after for keynote speaking engagements and advisory roles across various sectors, including enterprises, governments, and technology providers.
Research and Analysis: Conduct comprehensive research on data center trends, technologies, and strategies. Key areas of focus can include:
Colocation and Datacenters: Explore trends and strategies in colocation services and data center management.
Hybrid Cloud and Multicloud Strategies: Provide insights into hybrid and multicloud environments, including cloud lock-in, portability, and cloud operating models.
Cloud Hyperscalers and Specialty Providers: Analyze the offerings and strategies of major cloud hyperscalers and specialty cloud providers.
Data Center Transformation and Consolidation: Offer strategies for transforming and consolidating data center operations to enhance efficiency and sustainability.
Edge Computing and Future Data Infrastructure: Examine the role of edge computing in modern data infrastructure and its integration with cloud services.
Resilience and Disaster Recovery: Develop strategies for cloud resilience, disaster recovery, and backup solutions, including hyperconverged and integrated systems.
Industry Insight: Offer expert guidance on cloud strategies and the future of data centers, advising executives in large and small enterprises, investors, and service providers.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to develop in-depth research and analysis that addresses the needs of IT leaders and decision-makers.
Client Advisory: Act as a trusted advisor, delivering actionable insights and recommendations to clients across various sectors, including government and technology providers.
Publishing: Author and contribute to research papers, articles, and publications, enhancing Gartner's visibility as a thought leader in data center management and IT infrastructure trends.

Presentations and Conferences: Serve as a keynote speaker at industry events, webinars, and client meetings, engaging with key stakeholders and leading projects such as conference chair for Gartner I&O events.
Bachelor’s or advanced degree preferably in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
10 years of experience, with significant expertise in data center industry standards, design, operations, trends and strategies, cloud strategies, and IT infrastructure.
Strong blend of technical and business skills, with a track record of advising executives and leading strategic projects.
Excellent analytical and research skills, with the ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
Strong communication and presentation skills, with experience as a keynote speaker.
Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams.
Track record of thought leadership through publications, presentations, and contributions to the data center and IT infrastructure community.

Relevant certifications, such as Certified Data Center Professional (CDCP), Certified Data Center Management Professional (CDCMP), or others that validate expertise in data center technologies and practices are an asset.
Competitive salary, generous paid time off policy, charity match program, and more!
Group Medical Insurance, Parental Leave, Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Collaborative, team-oriented culture that embraces diversity.
Professional development and unlimited growth opportunities
At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.

Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to more than 20,000 associates globally who support ~15,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
What makes Gartner a great place to work?

Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.

We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.

In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.

The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.

Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.

As a Director Analyst specializing in Cloud and Data Centers at Gartner, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of digital infrastructure by providing strategic advice to CIOs and IT leaders on infrastructure, operations, and cloud strategies. With a focus on emerging technologies and trends, you will deliver actionable insights and thought leadership to our clients. Your expertise will be sought after for keynote speaking engagements and advisory roles across various sectors, including enterprises, governments, and technology providers.

Location: United Kingdom

Position Type: Full-time

What You Will Do:

  • Research and Analysis: Conduct comprehensive research on data center trends, technologies, and strategies. Key areas of focus can include:
  • Colocation and Datacenters: Explore trends and strategies in colocation services and data center management.
  • Hybrid Cloud and Multicloud Strategies: Provide insights into hybrid and multicloud environments, including cloud lock-in, portability, and cloud operating models.
  • Cloud Hyperscalers and Specialty Providers: Analyze the offerings and strategies of major cloud hyperscalers and specialty cloud providers.
  • Data Center Transformation and Consolidation: Offer strategies for transforming and consolidating data center operations to enhance efficiency and sustainability.
  • Edge Computing and Future Data Infrastructure: Examine the role of edge computing in modern data infrastructure and its integration with cloud services.
  • Resilience and Disaster Recovery: Develop strategies for cloud resilience, disaster recovery, and backup solutions, including hyperconverged and integrated systems.
  • Industry Insight: Offer expert guidance on cloud strategies and the future of data centers, advising executives in large and small enterprises, investors, and service providers.
  • Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to develop in-depth research and analysis that addresses the needs of IT leaders and decision-makers.
  • Client Advisory: Act as a trusted advisor, delivering actionable insights and recommendations to clients across various sectors, including government and technology providers.
  • Publishing: Author and contribute to research papers, articles, and publications, enhancing Gartner's visibility as a thought leader in data center management and IT infrastructure trends.
  • Presentations and Conferences: Serve as a keynote speaker at industry events, webinars, and client meetings, engaging with key stakeholders and leading projects such as conference chair for Gartner I&
column2:
O events.

What You Will Need:

  • Bachelor’s or advanced degree preferably in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
  • 10 years of experience, with significant expertise in data center industry standards, design, operations, trends and strategies, cloud strategies, and IT infrastructure.
  • Strong blend of technical and business skills, with a track record of advising executives and leading strategic projects.
  • Excellent analytical and research skills, with the ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
  • Strong communication and presentation skills, with experience as a keynote speaker.
  • Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams.
  • Track record of thought leadership through publications, presentations, and contributions to the data center and IT infrastructure community.

Certifications:

  • Relevant certifications, such as Certified Data Center Professional (CDCP), Certified Data Center Management Professional (CDCMP), or others that validate expertise in data center technologies and practices are an asset.

What You Will Get:

  • Competitive salary, generous paid time off policy, charity match program, and more!
  • Group Medical Insurance, Parental Leave, Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
  • Collaborative, team-oriented culture that embraces diversity.
  • Professional development and unlimited growth opportunities

Who are we?

At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.

Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.

Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to more than 20,000 associates globally who support ~15,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.

What makes Gartner a great place to work?

Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.

We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.

Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.

We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.

What do we offer?

Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.

In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.

Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.

The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.

Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.

Siamo alla ricerca di un Data Engineer da integrare nel team IT. La risorsa sarà responsabile dell’analisi e della gestione dei dati aziendali. Desideriamo un candidato con esperienza nella progettazione e gestione di data wharehouse, con un forte focus sui processi ETL. La figura ricercata è mossa dalla passione dei dati e dalla voglia di migliorarsi.
Di cosa hai bisogno per aver successo
Esperienza di almeno 3 anni come Data Engineer
Ottima conoscenza del ciclo di elaborazione dei dati: Ingestion, Processing, Storage, Visualization
Considerata un plus la conoscenza in ambito Azure e Databricks
Gradita esperienza in progetti legati a Machine Learning, Data Streaming, BI, Big Data, Advanced Analytics e Data Management.

Un ambiente di lavoro stimolante con ottime opportunità di crescita.

Business Intelligence per realtà operanti sia in Italia che in Europa.


Il tuo nuovo ruolo

Siamo alla ricerca di un Data Engineer da integrare nel team IT. La risorsa sarà responsabile dell’analisi e della gestione dei dati aziendali. Desideriamo un candidato con esperienza nella progettazione e gestione di data wharehouse, con un forte focus sui processi ETL. La figura ricercata è mossa dalla passione dei dati e dalla voglia di migliorarsi.


Di cosa hai bisogno per aver successo


  • Laurea in discipline STEM
column3: • Esperienza di almeno 3 anni come Data Engineer
column4: • Ottima conoscenza del ciclo di elaborazione dei dati: Ingestion, Processing, Storage, Visualization
column5: • Solide competenze di programmazione Python
column6: • Ottima conoscenza di SQL
column7: • Livello di Inglese: B1
column8: • Considerata un plus la conoscenza in ambito Azure e Databricks
column9:
• Gradita esperienza in progetti legati a Machine Learning, Data Streaming, BI, Big Data, Advanced Analytics e Data Management.


    • Cosa avrai in cambio

    Il cliente offre un contratto a tempo indeterminato, una RAL commisurata all’esperienza con

    benefit e bonus inclusi.

    Un ambiente di lavoro stimolante con ottime opportunità di crescita.

    Modalità di lavoro: Ibrido 60%

    Sede: Roma


    Cosa devi fare ora

    Se sei interessato a questa opportunità, clicca su ""Candidarsi ora"" per inviare una copia aggiornata del tuo CV.

    Se questa opportunità non è in linea con le tue aspettative, ma sei alla ricerca di un nuovo lavoro, visita il nostro sito Internet per scoprirne di nuove.

    #LI-DNI

4020145611,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-quantitative-analyst-and-data-scientist-at-ep-produzione-4020145611?position=55&pageNum=0&refId=up0NnzPToC6bMNV9F32jKw%3D%3D&trackingId=xO1LPeO0f6lxFEopOm14VA%3D%3D,SENIOR QUANTITATIVE ANALYST AND DATA SCIENTIST,EP Produzione,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Descrizione azienda

EP Produzione è la società italiana di generazione elettrica del Gruppo energetico ceco EPH. Con una capacità di generazione complessiva di 5,2 GW, attraverso cinque impianti a gas e uno a carbone, è il 5° produttore di energia in Italia
La risorsa verrà inserita nella Direzione Energy Management e sarà dedicata principalmente allo sviluppo di algoritmi strategici.
Nello Specifico, La Figura Professionale Avrà La Responsabilità Di
Sviluppare modelli di ottimizzazione delle strategie sui vari segmenti di mercato in cui opera l’azienda sulla base delle necessità delle aree funzionali della Direzione Energy Management.
Condurre analisi di dati per esaminare i processi della Direzione e migliorare l'efficienza e le operazioni.
Interpretare i dati e analizzare i risultati utilizzando tecniche statistiche.
Redazione reportistica periodica e/o on demand per la formulazione di previsioni di indirizzo relativamente all’andamento dei mercati e delle principali variabili macroeconomiche.
Approfondire novità e best practice relative agli ambiti progettuali di propria competenza.

Svolgere attività di business intelligence attraverso l'analisi dei dati e seguire progetti di trasformazioni Data & Analytics definendo le migliori strategie basate sull’utilizzo dei dati per facilitare il raggiungimento degli obiettivi di business.
Percorso di studi in ambito matematico/statistico/economico
Capacità quantitative e di problem solving supportate da un mindset analitico
Propensione a lavorare in team e a collaborare con i colleghi anche delle altre funzioni
Conoscenza dei principali applicativi Office e dei linguaggi di programmazione (a titolo esemplificativo: Python, Matlab, Visual Basic, C++)
Competenza nell'uso di strumenti di Business Intelligence (Power BI)
Orario Full-time, con possibilità di effettuare lo Smart Working per alcuni giorni della settimana.
Disponibilità ad effettuare brevi ed occasionali trasferte.

4185628252,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-system-engineer-defence-sector-at-rina-4185628252?position=59&pageNum=0&refId=up0NnzPToC6bMNV9F32jKw%3D%3D&trackingId=ppam32FlD%2BWc4UwzHYmRYw%3D%3D,Junior System Engineer (Defence Sector),RINA,"Rome, Latium, Italy","RINA is currently recruiting for a Junior System Engineer (Defence Sector) to join its office in ROME within the Electronics and Systems Engineering Division.

The system engineer consultant support the client to develop tailor-made system solutions that meet specific requirements and provide added value through design and process optimization and efficiency. System Specification activities through the definition and allocation of clear and comprehensive requirements, collaborating with both client stakeholders and end-users to understand system needs.
Requirement Analysis: Collaborate with client development team to specify system requirements, including functional, non-functional, and interface requirements.
System Functionality Definition: Identify and describe the key functionalities of the system, considering requirements and final user needs.
System Specification Development: Organize and structure the System Specification clearly and coherently.
Review and Approval: Conduct periodic reviews of the System Specification with key client stakeholders to ensure the accuracy and completeness of requirements and obtain formal approval.
Change Management: Manage changes in system requirements during the development process, ensuring they are evaluated, documented, and implemented appropriately
Bachelor’s Degree in Aerospace Engineering or Electronics
Technical Knowledge: basic knowledge in front-edge technologies and Space & Defence systems: experience in drafting system requirements for an air/naval defense system
column2: experience in verifying system requirements for an air/naval defense system.

column1: Programming Skills: basic knowledge of at least one programming language.
Knowledge of Best Practices: knowledge of international standards (eg. ISO 15288, ECSS-E-ST-10, MIL-STD-498, DO-254, DO-178, etc.),
knowledge of SW modelling tools (eg. Matlab / Simulink)..
Reporting: Ability to analyze and process data and represent them synthetically (reports, metrics, graphs).
Use of Engineering tools: e.g. IBM DOORS, Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
ADDRESS THE WAY - Have a big picture of different situations and reinterpret it in a perspective way
BUILD NETWORK - Forge trust relationships, across departments, and outside the organization
CLIENT INTIMACY - Embrace internal and external client needs, expectations, and requirements to ensure maximum satisfaction
EARN TRUST - Take everyone's opinion into account and remain open to diversity
MAKE EFFECTIVE DECISIONS - Structure activities according to priorities, actions, resources and constraint
MANAGE EMOTIONS - Recognise one's and other's emotions and express and regulate one's reactions
PIONEER CHANGE - Actively embrace change and benefit from the new circumstances
PROMOTE SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT - Promote commitment by keeping promises as a Role Model
THINK FORWARD - Capitalise on experiences and translate them into action plans for the future

With over 5,800 employees and 200 offices in 70 countries worldwide, RINA is a multinational player which provides certification, marine classification, product testing, site supervision and vendor inspection, training and engineering consultancy services across a wide range of sectors. Our business model covers the full process of project development, from concept to completion. The aim is to guarantee a project’s technical, environmental and safety - and sometimes also economic and financial - sustainability.

At RINA, we endeavor to create a work environment where every single person is valued and encouraged to develop new ideas. We provide equal employment opportunities and are committed to creating a workplace where everyone feels respected and safe from discrimination or harassment of any kind. We are also compliant to the Italian Law n. 68/99.

RINA is currently recruiting for a Junior System Engineer (Defence Sector) to join its office in ROME within the Electronics and Systems Engineering Division.

Mission

The system engineer consultant support the client to develop tailor-made system solutions that meet specific requirements and provide added value through design and process optimization and efficiency. System Specification activities through the definition and allocation of clear and comprehensive requirements, collaborating with both client stakeholders and end-users to understand system needs.

Key Accountabilities

  • Requirement Analysis: Collaborate with client development team to specify system requirements, including functional, non-functional, and interface requirements.
  • System Functionality Definition: Identify and describe the key functionalities of the system, considering requirements and final user needs.
  • System Specification Development: Organize and structure the System Specification clearly and coherently.
  • Review and Approval: Conduct periodic reviews of the System Specification with key client stakeholders to ensure the accuracy and completeness of requirements and obtain formal approval.
  • Change Management: Manage changes in system requirements during the development process, ensuring they are evaluated, documented, and implemented appropriately

Education

Bachelor’s Degree in Aerospace Engineering or Electronics

Qualifications

Technical Knowledge: basic knowledge in front-edge technologies and Space &
column2: Defence systems: experience in drafting system requirements for an air/naval defense system
column3:
experience in verifying system requirements for an air/naval defense system.

Programming Skills: basic knowledge of at least one programming language.

Knowledge of Best Practices: knowledge of international standards (eg. ISO 15288, ECSS-E-ST-10, MIL-STD-498, DO-254, DO-178, etc.),

knowledge of SW modelling tools (eg. Matlab / Simulink)..

Reporting: Ability to analyze and process data and represent them synthetically (reports, metrics, graphs).

Use of Engineering tools: e.g. IBM DOORS, Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).

Competencies

  • ADDRESS THE WAY - Have a big picture of different situations and reinterpret it in a perspective way
  • BUILD NETWORK - Forge trust relationships, across departments, and outside the organization
  • CLIENT INTIMACY - Embrace internal and external client needs, expectations, and requirements to ensure maximum satisfaction
  • EARN TRUST - Take everyone's opinion into account and remain open to diversity
  • MAKE EFFECTIVE DECISIONS - Structure activities according to priorities, actions, resources and constraint
  • MANAGE EMOTIONS - Recognise one's and other's emotions and express and regulate one's reactions
  • PIONEER CHANGE - Actively embrace change and benefit from the new circumstances
  • PROMOTE SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT - Promote commitment by keeping promises as a Role Model
  • THINK FORWARD - Capitalise on experiences and translate them into action plans for the future

With over 5,800 employees and 200 offices in 70 countries worldwide, RINA is a multinational player which provides certification, marine classification, product testing, site supervision and vendor inspection, training and engineering consultancy services across a wide range of sectors. Our business model covers the full process of project development, from concept to completion. The aim is to guarantee a project’s technical, environmental and safety - and sometimes also economic and financial - sustainability.

At RINA, we endeavor to create a work environment where every single person is valued and encouraged to develop new ideas. We provide equal employment opportunities and are committed to creating a workplace where everyone feels respected and safe from discrimination or harassment of any kind. 4187484005,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-engineer-at-iconsulting-4187484005?position=1&pageNum=2&refId=2MLIlXP4%2BULem4TjVIx08A%3D%3D&trackingId=Cs5Zo0s1MDwLYPYX%2BB4aFg%3D%3D,Junior Data Engineer,ICONSULTING,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Siamo una Data Driven Transformation & Consulting Company specializzata nel gestire e trasformare il più importante asset del mercato odierno: I Dati.

Grazie ad oltre 20 anni di esperienza e 500 dipendenti divisi in 4 sedi (Bologna HQ, Milano, Roma e Napoli) supportiamo l’evoluzione di grandi gruppi italiani operanti in tutti i principali settori, dal bancario al manifatturiero, passando per il Fashion, il Retail, l’Energy e le Telco senza dimenticare le grandi pubbliche amministrazioni centrali.

Il nostro portfolio progetti spazia da servizi di Advisory quali la realizzazione di Data Strategy fino ad attività di implementazione con il design e la realizzazione di soluzioni di Business Analytics, Big Data Platform & Artificial Intelligence.

Siamo un’azienda dinamica, con un Dna che si è plasmato in questi anni grazie al fatto di aver coltivato oltre l’80% delle nostre risorse dall’università, e in continua trasformazione così come il mercato in cui operiamo e del quale siamo fra i player più riconosciuti e grandi del panorama italiano.
Iconsulting è alla ricerca di talentuosi neolaureati da inserire nei team di progetto con il ruolo di Junior Data Engineer.

Entrando a far parte della nostra squadra, avrai l'opportunità di lavorare a stretto contatto con un team di esperti su progetti innovativi e tecnicamente avanzati nell'ambito dati, con l’obiettivo di aiutare i clienti a sviluppare le loro strategie IT.

Al tuo ingresso in Azienda riceverai una formazione strutturata e sarai supportato da un tutor dedicato che ti guiderà nell'apprendimento delle principali tecnologie di mercato e ti aiuterà a sviluppare le competenze necessarie.
Laurea Magistrale in Ingegneria Informatica o Informatica
Esperienza pratica con database relazionali e competenza nell'utilizzo di SQL
Una buona conoscenza dei linguaggi Python e Java
Conoscenza preferenziale in ambito Data integration e Database (Relazionali es. MySql)
Interesse per le tecnologie NoSQL e Big Data
Preferibile familiarità con strumenti di Data Visualization come Tableau, Power BI o Qlik
Curiosità, voglia di imparare, proattività e interesse per i principali trend tecnologici del momento
Ai candidati selezionati verrà offerto un percorso di sviluppo di carriera e crescita strutturato per obiettivi, con processi formativi sia in ambito tech sia in ambito soft skills.

Nel pacchetto retributivo sono compresi assicurazione medica integrativa, buoni pasto, welfare e convenzioni dipendenti usufruibili su tutto il territorio nazionale, dotazioni integrative per lo smart working.
Sede di lavoro: Roma o Napoli. E' previsto lo smart working.

4201266999,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-experis-italia-4201266999?position=2&pageNum=2&refId=2MLIlXP4%2BULem4TjVIx08A%3D%3D&trackingId=FXrrWujLU7fXAqMKPM3xLQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Experis Italia,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Experis ricerca un Data Analyst per potenziare la nostra divisione Aerospace & Defence nella sede di Roma.

Come Data Analyst, ti occuperai di supportare la definizione dell'architettura dei sistemi AI per l’analisi di dati provenienti da sensori, piattaforme e sistemi embedded della nave militare e definire strategie per la gestione e la qualità dei dati operativi, la progettazione e l’estrazione di dati rilevanti in ogni fase del ciclo di vita del prodotto.
Le caratteristiche della persona che si unirà al Team Experis

*6 months paid internship in the Customer Care and Field Force Effectiveness team
*Being part of one of the main players in the VET industry, leader in its sector, ranked among Best Workplace 2023 & Best Workplace for Women 2023
*Collaboration and participation in international projects/teams within SEC
*Developing proficiency with CRM Tools, databases, Excel, Power BI, PowerPoint
Department: Customer Care and Field Force Effectiveness
*The candidate will support the Customer Care and Field Force Effectiveness team
* Degree in Economics, Marketing or similar
*Knowledge of Spanish and/or experience abroad (Eg. Erasmus program) is a plus.
*Team player, proactive and open to innovation
Personal and professional development - being part of one of the main VET players

At Zoetis, our purpose is to nurture the world and humankind by advancing care for animals. As a Fortune 500 company and the world leader in animal health, we discover, develop, manufacture and commercialize vaccines, medicines, diagnostics and other technologies for companion animals and livestock. We know our people drive our success. Our award-winning culture, built around our Core Beliefs, focuses on our colleagues' careers, connection and support. We offer competitive healthcare and retirement savings benefits, along with an array of benefits, policies and programs to support employee well-being in every sense, from health and financial wellness to family and lifestyle resources.

Connected to our purpose and Core Beliefs, at Zoetis, we lead with inclusion. Our Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DE&I) focus helps create an environment where each colleague can thrive. Our commitment to DE&I begins with our leadership team of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ethnicities, and it is demonstrated in our support of our colleagues and the animal health industry. We have nine colleague resources groups whose members spread awareness, foster inclusivity and make a positive impact on our business and communities.

Our commitment to advancing Diversity, Equity and Inclusion has earned us recognitions as a 2024 Catalyst Award recipient and a Top 50 Company for Workplace Fairness by Fair360 (formerly DiversityInc). Zoetis has also been named a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ+ Equality, a Best Company for Working Parents, a Top Company for Executive Women, among many others. Learn more here.

TRAINEE CRM BUSINESS ANALIST (post - graduate)

OPPPORTUNITY:

*6 months paid internship in the Customer Care and Field Force Effectiveness team

*Being part of one of the main players in the VET industry, leader in its sector, ranked among Best Workplace 2023 &
column2:
Best Workplace for Women 2023

*Collaboration and participation in international projects/teams within SEC

*Developing proficiency with CRM Tools, databases, Excel, Power BI, PowerPoint

Location: Rome - hybrid

Department: Customer Care and Field Force Effectiveness

MAIN ACTIVITIES:

*The candidate will support the Customer Care and Field Force Effectiveness team

with a particular focus on

  • Data analysis and KPIs monitoring
  • Territories alignment and optimization
  • Customer segmentation
  • Field Force training activities

TARGET PROFILE:

* Degree in Economics, Marketing or similar

*English proficient

*Knowledge of Spanish and/or experience abroad (Eg. Erasmus program) is a plus.

*Team player, proactive and open to innovation

*Creative and problem solver

*Good communicator

OFFICE and PERKS:

  • Personal and professional development - being part of one of the main VET players
  • Central office location (Vatican Area)
  • Smart working policy (2days/week)
  • Company events/team building/collaborative environment
  • Mobile and laptop.

At Zoetis, our purpose is to nurture the world and humankind by advancing care for animals. As a Fortune 500 company and the world leader in animal health, we discover, develop, manufacture and commercialize vaccines, medicines, diagnostics and other technologies for companion animals and livestock. We know our people drive our success. Our award-winning culture, built around our Core Beliefs, focuses on our colleagues' careers, connection and support. We offer competitive healthcare and retirement savings benefits, along with an array of benefits, policies and programs to support employee well-being in every sense, from health and financial wellness to family and lifestyle resources.

4203348967,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/specialist-data-analyst-at-iqera-italia-s-p-a-4203348967?position=4&pageNum=2&refId=2MLIlXP4%2BULem4TjVIx08A%3D%3D&trackingId=gvATBz4sSlMfngVvKbVFsQ%3D%3D,Specialist Data Analyst,iQera Italia S.p.A.,"Rome, Latium, Italy","CHI SIAMO:
iQera Italia S.p.A. è una società italiana leader nel settore del Recupero Crediti, Real Estate, Due Diligence e Outsourcing di processi aziendali.

Siamo attivi nel mercato italiano degli NPL (Non Performing Loans) e UTP (Unlikely to Pay) come branch locale di iQera Group e come Servicer specializzato nella gestione integrata del credito e dei beni immobiliari.

I servizi offerti da iQera si basano su una professionalità maturata in oltre 30 anni di esperienza, creando un modello integrato di supporto e gestione a 360° nel settore del Credito e del Real Estate, attraverso competenze, intelligenza relazionale e un ampio utilizzo della tecnologia e dell'intelligenza artificiale.
Cerchiamo, per la nostra sede di lavoro a Roma, un Data Analyst Expert da inserire all’interno della divisione PORTFOLIO & DATA MANAGEMENT.
Gestione progetti e attività di analisi di portafogli NPL
Attività di PMO nelle due Diligence e Business Plan su portafogli NPL
Creazione, adattamento ed esecuzione di modelli statistici di interpretazione dei dati
Creazione di report e documenti con i risultati delle analisi da presentare ai clienti interni ed esterni.
Laurea magistrale in discipline tecniche, preferibilmente in Data Science, Ingegneria, Matematica, Fisica e Scienze Statistiche
Esperienza di almeno 3 anni come Data Analyst
Buona capacità nella modellazione dei dati
Ottima conoscenza dei metodi di analisi dei Big Data e dei tool di analisi (Excel, R, Phyton, Sas)
Buon team working e problem solving, ottimo orientamento al risultato
Rappresenterà un valore aggiunto l’esperienza maturata come Data Analyst nella valutazione di portafogli NPL
Contratto di lavoro subordinato, CCNL Commercio, da commisurare in base all’esperienza.
La ricerca è rivolta ad entrambi i sessi (L.903/77). Gli interessati possono inoltrare il proprio CV dando l'autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali, ai sensi D.Lgs.196/03

4205803215,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-at-lottomatica-4205803215?position=5&pageNum=2&refId=2MLIlXP4%2BULem4TjVIx08A%3D%3D&trackingId=t%2BIrCZI9FSadO0eg15G63Q%3D%3D,Data Engineer,Lottomatica,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Siamo il Gruppo Lottomatica, leader nel settore del gioco regolamentato in Italia e uno dei maggiori operatori europei, in tutte le aree di attività: scommesse sportive, gioco online e macchine da intrattenimento. Offriamo ai nostri clienti esperienze di gioco sicure e di qualità, attraverso tutti i canali, ponendo la responsabilità e la sostenibilità al centro del business. Essere in Lottomatica è molto più che far parte di un'azienda: significa contribuire a un progetto imprenditoriale grande e responsabile.

Siamo alla ricerca di un profilo di un Data Engineer che entrerà a far parte del del team di Advanced Analytics Data Platform, per lo sviluppo dei flussi dati della Data Platform aziendale e la distribuzione di soluzioni integrate di Intelligenza Artificiale verso tutte le aree aziendali.
Almeno 2 anni di esperienza nel ruolo
Conoscenza del framework Apache Spark e dell’ecosistema Hadoop
Conoscenza dello sviluppo di pipeline ETL
La risorsa si occuperà di una o più delle seguenti attività a seconda della seniority:
Implementazione di processi di Data Preparation
Implementazione di pipeline di consume del dato ( pipeline di export, API)
Conoscenza base bash e sistemi operativi Unix
Conoscenza di processi di Data Quality
Conoscenza di MongoDB e dei database NoSQL
Conoscenza di SQL Server e del relativo Integration Services (SSIS)
Esperienza di design architetturale di integrazioni componenti cloud-onpremise
Esperienza nella progettazione di database, strategie e i meccanismi di accesso ai dati, sicurezza e controllo dell’integrità, servizi di ingegneria e i sistemi distribuiti
Opportunità di lavorare nella più grande azienda di scommesse e giochi in Italia e una delle più grandi al mondo
Lavorare in un ambiente molto dinamico e migliorare le proprie competenze acquisendone di nuove
Essere sfidati a fornire soluzioni d'impatto per grandi organizzazioni e avere un impatto diretto sui loro dipendenti
Possibilità di partecipare a progetti di beneficenza, legalità e responsabilità attraverso l'impegno in Fondazione Lottomatica
Un modello di DNA aziendale definito in cui Inclusione, Valore della Diversità, Eccellenza e Collaborazione sono i pilastri
Far parte dell'azienda numero uno al mondo nel settore per impegno ESG
Contratto a tempo indeterminato e opportunità di lavoro ibrido
Formazione continua su hard skills e soft skills
Lottomatica attua una politica che garantisce pari opportunità e promuove diversità e inclusione, contro ogni forma di discriminazione.
In Lottomatica crediamo che ogni persona sia unica e consideriamo la diversity come una fonte di arricchimento personale e organizzativo.

Ci impegniamo ogni giorno affinché il nostro sia un ambiente aperto, sicuro e inclusivo, dove ogni persona possa essere pienamente se stessa indipendentemente da genere, religione, sesso, età, etnia, nazionalità, disabilità, stato civile o orientamento sessuale.

We are the Lottomatica Group, leader in regulated gaming in Italy and one of the largest European operators, in all areas of activity: sports betting, online gaming and amusement machines. We offer our customers safe and quality gaming experiences, through all channels, putting responsibility and sustainability at the core of the business. Being in Lottomatica is much more than being part of a company: it means contributing to a great and responsible entrepreneurial project.

We are looking for a Data Engineer to join the Advanced Analytics Data Platform team for the development of data flows within the company's Data Platform and the distribution of integrated Artificial Intelligence solutions across all business areas.
At least 2 years of experience in the role
Familiarity with Apache Spark and the Hadoop ecosystem
Depending on seniority, the candidate will be responsible for one or more of the following activities:
Implementation of data consumption pipelines (export pipelines, APIs)
Basic knowledge of Bash and Unix operating systems
Familiarity with MongoDB and NoSQL databases
Experience with SQL Server and Integration Services (SSIS)
Experience in designing cloud-on-premise integration architectures
Expertise in database design, data access strategies and mechanisms, data security and integrity control, engineering services, and distributed systems
What you will find in Lottomatica:
Opportunity to work in the largest betting and gaming company in Italy and one of the largest in the world
Work in a dynamic environment and improve your skills while acquiring new ones
Being challenged to provide impactful solutions for large organisations and have a direct impact on their employees
Opportunity to participate in charity, legality and responsibility projects through engagement in Fondazione Lottomatica
A defined corporate DNA model in which Inclusion, Value of Diversity, Excellence and Collaboration are the pillars
Being part of the world's number one company in the industry for ESG commitment
Permanent contract and hybrid work opportunities
Continuous training on hard and soft skills
Annual gross salary commensurate with experience (40-45K)

Lottomatica implements a policy that guarantees equal opportunities and promotes diversity and inclusion, against all forms of discrimination. At Lottomatica we believe that each person is unique and we consider diversity as a source of personal and organizational enrichment. We strive every day for ours to be an open, safe and inclusive environment, where each person can be fully himself or herself regardless of gender, religion, sex, age, ethnicity, nationality, disability, marital status or sexual orientation.

Siamo il Gruppo Lottomatica, leader nel settore del gioco regolamentato in Italia e uno dei maggiori operatori europei, in tutte le aree di attività: scommesse sportive, gioco online e macchine da intrattenimento. Offriamo ai nostri clienti esperienze di gioco sicure e di qualità, attraverso tutti i canali, ponendo la responsabilità e la sostenibilità al centro del business. Essere in Lottomatica è molto più che far parte di un'azienda: significa contribuire a un progetto imprenditoriale grande e responsabile.


Siamo alla ricerca di un profilo di un Data Engineer che entrerà a far parte del del team di Advanced Analytics Data Platform, per lo sviluppo dei flussi dati della Data Platform aziendale e la distribuzione di soluzioni integrate di Intelligenza Artificiale verso tutte le aree aziendali.


Requisiti:

  • Almeno 2 anni di esperienza nel ruolo
  • Conoscenza del linguaggio SQL
  • Conoscenza del linguaggio Python
  • Conoscenza del framework Apache Spark e dell’ecosistema Hadoop
  • Conoscenza base di DevOps
  • Conoscenza dello sviluppo di pipeline ETL


Principali attività:

La risorsa si occuperà di una o più delle seguenti attività a seconda della seniority:

  • Implementazione di flussi di ingestion
  • Implementazione di processi di Data Preparation
  • Implementazione di pipeline di consume del dato ( pipeline di export, API)
  • Disegni architetturali e di processo


Sarà considerato un plus:

  • Conoscenza Azure Databricks
  • Conoscenza Docker Container
  • Conoscenza base bash e sistemi operativi Unix
  • Conoscenza di processi di Data Quality
  • Conoscenza Azure Data Factory
  • Conoscenza di MongoDB e dei database NoSQL
  • Conoscenza di SQL Server e del relativo Integration Services (SSIS)
  • Esperienza pratica MLOps
  • Esperienza di design architetturale di integrazioni componenti cloud-onpremise
  • Esperienza nella progettazione di database, strategie e i meccanismi di accesso ai dati, sicurezza e controllo dell’integrità, servizi di ingegneria e i sistemi distribuiti


Cosa troverai in Lottomatica:

  • Opportunità di lavorare nella più grande azienda di scommesse e giochi in Italia e una delle più grandi al mondo
column2: • Lavorare in un ambiente molto dinamico e migliorare le proprie competenze acquisendone di nuove
column3: • Essere sfidati a fornire soluzioni d'impatto per grandi organizzazioni e avere un impatto diretto sui loro dipendenti
column4: • Possibilità di partecipare a progetti di beneficenza, legalità e responsabilità attraverso l'impegno in Fondazione Lottomatica
column5: • Un modello di DNA aziendale definito in cui Inclusione, Valore della Diversità, Eccellenza e Collaborazione sono i pilastri
column6: • Far parte dell'azienda numero uno al mondo nel settore per impegno ESG
column7:
• Eccellenti opportunità di crescita.


    • Cosa offriamo:

    • Contratto a tempo indeterminato e opportunità di lavoro ibrido
column8: • Laptop aziendale
column9: • Formazione continua su hard skills e soft skills
column10:
• Stipendio annuo lordo commisurato all'esperienza (40-45K)



    • Lottomatica attua una politica che garantisce pari opportunità e promuove diversità e inclusione, contro ogni forma di discriminazione.

    In Lottomatica crediamo che ogni persona sia unica e consideriamo la diversity come una fonte di arricchimento personale e organizzativo.

    Ci impegniamo ogni giorno affinché il nostro sia un ambiente aperto, sicuro e inclusivo, dove ogni persona possa essere pienamente se stessa indipendentemente da genere, religione, sesso, età, etnia, nazionalità, disabilità, stato civile o orientamento sessuale.



    ******

    We are the Lottomatica Group, leader in regulated gaming in Italy and one of the largest European operators, in all areas of activity: sports betting, online gaming and amusement machines. We offer our customers safe and quality gaming experiences, through all channels, putting responsibility and sustainability at the core of the business. Being in Lottomatica is much more than being part of a company: it means contributing to a great and responsible entrepreneurial project.


    We are looking for a Data Engineer to join the Advanced Analytics Data Platform team for the development of data flows within the company's Data Platform and the distribution of integrated Artificial Intelligence solutions across all business areas.


    Requirements:

    • At least 2 years of experience in the role
    • Knowledge of SQL
    • Knowledge of Python
    • Familiarity with Apache Spark and the Hadoop ecosystem
    • Basic DevOps knowledge
    • Experience in developing ETL pipelines


    Main Responsibilities:

    Depending on seniority, the candidate will be responsible for one or more of the following activities:

    • Implementation of data ingestion flows
    • Implementation of Data Preparation processes
    • Implementation of data consumption pipelines (export pipelines, APIs)
    • Architectural and process design


    Nice to Have:

    • Knowledge of Azure Databricks
    • Experience with Docker Containers
    • Basic knowledge of Bash and Unix operating systems
    • Understanding of Data Quality processes
    • Knowledge of Azure Data Factory
    • Familiarity with MongoDB and NoSQL databases
    • Experience with SQL Server and Integration Services (SSIS)
    • Hands-on experience with MLOps
    • Experience in designing cloud-on-premise integration architectures
    • Expertise in database design, data access strategies and mechanisms, data security and integrity control, engineering services, and distributed systems


    What you will find in Lottomatica:

    • Opportunity to work in the largest betting and gaming company in Italy and one of the largest in the world
column11: • Work in a dynamic environment and improve your skills while acquiring new ones
column12: • Being challenged to provide impactful solutions for large organisations and have a direct impact on their employees
column13: • Opportunity to participate in charity, legality and responsibility projects through engagement in Fondazione Lottomatica
column14: • A defined corporate DNA model in which Inclusion, Value of Diversity, Excellence and Collaboration are the pillars
column15: • Being part of the world's number one company in the industry for ESG commitment
column16:
• Excellent growth opportunities.


    • What we offer:

    • Permanent contract and hybrid work opportunities
column17: • Company laptop
column18: • Continuous training on hard and soft skills
column19:
• Annual gross salary commensurate with experience (40-45K)



    • Lottomatica implements a policy that guarantees equal opportunities and promotes diversity and inclusion, against all forms of discrimination. At Lottomatica we believe that each person is unique and we consider diversity as a source of personal and organizational enrichment. We strive every day for ours to be an open, safe and inclusive environment, where each person can be fully himself or herself regardless of gender, religion, sex, age, ethnicity, nationality, disability, marital status or sexual orientation.

4190755252,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/experienced-data-science-ai-at-deloitte-4190755252?position=6&pageNum=2&refId=2MLIlXP4%2BULem4TjVIx08A%3D%3D&trackingId=frL8bRjBOK61IvxGi44d1w%3D%3D,Experienced - Data Science & AI,Deloitte,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Experienced - Data Science And AI
Stiamo cercando una figura consultant/senior consultant da inserire nel team Regulatory and Compliance Solution - Banking nella sede di Milano e Roma, che lavorerà in modalità Hybrid.

Il business Regulatory and Compliance Solution - Banking si occupa di fornire servizi di Digital Transformation, che hanno l’obiettivo di supportare la digitalizzazione dei processi interni dei nostri clienti, mettendo in atto attività che prevedono l’utilizzo di strumenti di Data Analytics, Machine Learning, IoT e AI.
La risorsa Experienced verrà inserita in un team di lavoro e si occuperà di:
Integrare le proposte ai clienti con soluzioni basate su utilizzo di analytics e nuove tecnologie
Coordinare i colleghi junior e fungere da punto di riferimento per clienti nazionali e internazionali.
Esperienza di almeno 2/3 anni nella gestione end-to-end di progetti di Data Science e Machine Learning: disegno, sviluppo e test di soluzioni AI
Ottima conoscenza di Python e delle librerie per manipolazione dati e sviluppo modelli (Python, Pandas, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, PyTorch, ecc.)
Esperienza con tecnologie di Generative AI e modelli LLM
Esperienza con strumenti di containerizzazione e MLOps (e.g. docker)
Conoscenze/esperienze in alcuni dei seguenti ambiti di competenza:

Progettazione, sviluppo e rilascio in produzione di soluzioni di Data Science e/o Intelligent Automation, a partire dalla comprensione dell’esigenza di business, raccolta dei requisiti utente e costruzione del business case, fino alla comunicazione efficace delle analisi effettuate, delle evidenze e degli insights estratti a diverse tipologie di stakeholders (es. IT, funzioni di business, executives)
Principali ambienti Cloud (es. Azure, AWS, GCP, IBM) e relativi strumenti di Data Analytics & AI
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese e del pacchetto Office

Deloitte è un network leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, presente in oltre 150 Paesi con 457 mila professionisti. Offriamo soluzioni innovative e sostenibili in Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory, Tax e Legal. Il nostro obiettivo è supportare le aziende nello sviluppo e nell'implementazione di strategie al passo con il mercato.

In Deloitte la sostenibilità è un tema centrale. Per questo, attraverso le strategie e le progettualità legate alle tematiche Environmental, Social e Governance (ESG), ci impegniamo a promuovere una crescita responsabile, sostenibile e inclusiva per il Pianeta, le nostre persone e la società. Scopri di più sulle nostre strategie di Corporate Sustainability, tra cui Well-being, la strategia volta a migliorare il benessere fisico, mentale e sociale delle nostre persone, affinché siano felici e piene di energia in tutti gli ambiti della loro vita e WorldClimate, la strategia globale di Deloitte per diventare un’organizzazione Net Zero e per guidare scelte responsabili all’interno e all’esterno dell’organizzazione.
Sei pront* a #MakeAnImpactThatMatter insieme? Candidati ora!

Le persone interessate possono inviare la propria candidatura con autorizzazione ai sensi del dlgs. 196/2003. La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed è aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio è stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell’inclusività.

4184809706,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/artificial-intelligence-intern-at-renault-group-4184809706?position=8&pageNum=2&refId=2MLIlXP4%2BULem4TjVIx08A%3D%3D&trackingId=8K%2Bt0U7jTmx0%2FB2%2FoISZgA%3D%3D,Artificial Intelligence Intern,Renault Group,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Il Gruppo Renault è alla ricerca di un/una tirocinante da inserire all’interno della Direzione Sistemi Informativi di Mobilize Financial Services, società finanziaria del Gruppo.
La risorsa affiancherà il tutor nelle seguenti attività:
Creazione di una piattaforma di Intelligenza Artificiale basata su strumenti Open Source quali KubeFlow
Addestramento della IA alla risoluzione di problemi specifici, quali l’analisi di codice e la proposizione di suggerimenti migliorativi sullo stesso
Laurea in Discipline STEM, il master in Intelligenza Artificiale sarà considerato un plus
Buona conoscenza della piattaforma di orchestrazione e containerizzazione Kubernetes
Buona conoscenza delle architetture e delle componenti per la costruzione di una Intelligenza Artificiale
Ottime competenze relazionali e di precisione
Si offre un tirocinio di sei mesi con un rimborso spese di 800 euro lordi mensili, accesso gratuito alla mensa e al parcheggio interno.

Il Gruppo Renault si impegna ad offrire Pari Opportunità, a promuovere un ambiente inclusivo per tutte e tutti, indipendentemente dalla provenienza, dal genere, dall'origine sociale o etnica, dall'età, dalla religione, dall'orientamento sessuale, disabilità o problema di salute. Proponiamo un luogo di lavoro rispettoso delle competenze, opinioni ed esperienze individuali. Crediamo fermamente che le nostre differenze ci permettano di essere una squadra migliore creando valore e sviluppando il talento di ognuno.

Il Gruppo Renault è alla ricerca di un/una tirocinante da inserire all’interno della Direzione Sistemi Informativi di Mobilize Financial Services, società finanziaria del Gruppo.


Attività


La risorsa affiancherà il tutor nelle seguenti attività:


  • Creazione di una piattaforma di Intelligenza Artificiale basata su strumenti Open Source quali KubeFlow
  • Addestramento della IA alla risoluzione di problemi specifici, quali l’analisi di codice e la proposizione di suggerimenti migliorativi sullo stesso

Requisiti e Conoscenze


  • Laurea in Discipline STEM, il master in Intelligenza Artificiale sarà considerato un plus
  • Buona conoscenza della piattaforma di orchestrazione e containerizzazione Kubernetes
  • Buona conoscenza delle architetture e delle componenti per la costruzione di una Intelligenza Artificiale
  • Ottima conoscenza dell’inglese
  • Ottime competenze relazionali e di precisione


Ulteriori informazioni

Si offre un tirocinio di sei mesi con un rimborso spese di 800 euro lordi mensili, accesso gratuito alla mensa e al parcheggio interno.


Il Gruppo Renault si impegna ad offrire Pari Opportunità, a promuovere un ambiente inclusivo per tutte e tutti, indipendentemente dalla provenienza, dal genere, dall'origine sociale o etnica, dall'età, dalla religione, dall'orientamento sessuale, disabilità o problema di salute. 4200891965,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/customer-master-data-analyst-at-kenvue-4200891965?position=9&pageNum=2&refId=2MLIlXP4%2BULem4TjVIx08A%3D%3D&trackingId=99wNowU%2FKFAtOaw3c88YFg%3D%3D,Customer Master Data Analyst,Kenvue,"Pomezia, Latium, Italy","Job Description
Customer Master Data Analyst – Fixed term contract
This position reports into Sales Analytics & Operation Manager and is based in Pomezia – Santa Palomba (Rome).

At Kenvue , we realize the extraordinary power of everyday care. Built on over a century of heritage and rooted in science, we’re the house of iconic brands - including NEUTROGENA®, AVEENO®, TYLENOL®, LISTERINE®, JOHNSON’S® and BAND-AID® that you already know and love. Science is our passion
column2: care is our talent. Our global team is made by 22,000 diverse and brilliant people, passionate about insights, innovation and committed to deliver the best products to our customers. With expertise and empathy, being a Kenvuer means to have the power to impact life of millions of people every day. We put people first, care fiercely, earn trust with science and solve with courage – and have brilliant opportunities waiting for you! Join us in shaping our future–and yours. For more information, click here .

column1: The role of the Customer Master Data Analyst will ensure the correctness of customers master data for correct billing, optimize data collection processes and system data entry in order to guarantee correct orders entry by Sales Forces and master data update through data entry and creation of new customers .
The role will involve, but not be restricted to, the following activities-
Code new customers in SAP-ERP System both for Pharma channel (pharmacies, parapharmacies and health care shops) and Mass channel (shops and large-scale distribution groups).
Change personal data on the customers already available in the registry both for Pharma and Mass market channels.
Set up fiscal and financial data necessary for billing purposes and for electronic invoicing.
Check and monitor Customers Master Data in key systems, supporting to the Sales Force and to the Sales Operations Manager when needed.
Work with IT to implement Master data management initiatives in systems and applications.
Work with International English team to ensure master data integrity in key systems as well as to maintain the processes to support the data quality for Mass and Pharma channels.

Interactions with different departments, such as Customer Service (for the setting of the delivery methods of the goods), Finance (for setting payment methods and checking account statements), IT (for solving problems in viewing personal data), International English team (to ensure master data integrity in key systems).
Previous experience in Customer Master Data team in pharmaceutical and / or cosmetic.
Knowledge and full understanding of master data management and tools.
Good knowledge of the Office package.
Strong customer orientation, teamwork aptitude, flexibility, professional and cooperative approach.
Precision, attention to details and strong attention to the sales force needs.
Ability to relate in a clear and precise way, availability to listening and sharing ideas.

Kenvue is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Job Description

Kenvue is currently recruiting for-

Customer Master Data Analyst – Fixed term contract

This position reports into Sales Analytics &
column2:
Operation Manager and is based in Pomezia – Santa Palomba (Rome).

Who We Are

At Kenvue , we realize the extraordinary power of everyday care. Built on over a century of heritage and rooted in science, we’re the house of iconic brands - including NEUTROGENA®, AVEENO®, TYLENOL®, LISTERINE®, JOHNSON’S® and BAND-AID® that you already know and love. Science is our passion
column3:
care is our talent. Our global team is made by 22,000 diverse and brilliant people, passionate about insights, innovation and committed to deliver the best products to our customers. With expertise and empathy, being a Kenvuer means to have the power to impact life of millions of people every day. We put people first, care fiercely, earn trust with science and solve with courage – and have brilliant opportunities waiting for you! Join us in shaping our future–and yours. For more information, click here .

What You Will Do

The role of the Customer Master Data Analyst will ensure the correctness of customers master data for correct billing, optimize data collection processes and system data entry in order to guarantee correct orders entry by Sales Forces and master data update through data entry and creation of new customers .

RESPONSIBILITIES-

The role will involve, but not be restricted to, the following activities-

  • Code new customers in SAP-ERP System both for Pharma channel (pharmacies, parapharmacies and health care shops) and Mass channel (shops and large-scale distribution groups).
  • Change personal data on the customers already available in the registry both for Pharma and Mass market channels.
  • Set up fiscal and financial data necessary for billing purposes and for electronic invoicing.
  • Check and monitor Customers Master Data in key systems, supporting to the Sales Force and to the Sales Operations Manager when needed.
  • Manage of electronic data archives.
  • Work with IT to implement Master data management initiatives in systems and applications.
  • Work with International English team to ensure master data integrity in key systems as well as to maintain the processes to support the data quality for Mass and Pharma channels.
  • Interactions with different departments, such as Customer Service (for the setting of the delivery methods of the goods), Finance (for setting payment methods and checking account statements), IT (for solving problems in viewing personal data), International English team (to ensure master data integrity in key systems).

Required Qualifications

  • Previous experience in Customer Master Data team in pharmaceutical and / or cosmetic.
  • Good level of English.
  • Knowledge and full understanding of master data management and tools.
  • Good knowledge of the Office package.
  • Good knowledge of ERP-SAP system.
  • Strong customer orientation, teamwork aptitude, flexibility, professional and cooperative approach.
  • Precision, attention to details and strong attention to the sales force needs.
  • Ability to relate in a clear and precise way, availability to listening and sharing ideas.
  • Seriousness and reliability.

What’s In It For You
