- Progettare ed erogare percorsi formativi specializzati in ambito Data Analysis per i nostri clienti corporate
- Lavorare a stretto contatto con il cliente per raccogliere requisiti, presentare dashboard e fornire consulenza su ottimizzazioni di analisi dati
- Progettare e sviluppare dashboard avanzate utilizzando Power BI per soddisfare esigenze di analisi e reporting aziendale
- Automatizzare processi e flussi di dati tramite l’utilizzo avanzato di query SQL e integrazioni con Power BI
- Analizzare e interpretare grandi moli di dati provenienti da varie fonti, fornendo insight utili per supportare decisioni strategiche aziendali
-Capacità di progettare percorsi formativi chiari ed efficaci in Data Analysis
- Padronanza avanzata di SQL per l'estrazione, manipolazione e automazione dei dati
- Capacità di comprendere velocemente i requisiti di business e tradurli in soluzioni analitiche efficienti ed user-friendly
- Esperienza comprovata nell’automazione di processi e reportistica tramite query SQL e integrazione dati
- Laurea Magistrale in Statistica, Informatica, Ingegneria o campi correlati
- Almeno 5 anni di esperienza nel ruolo di Data Analyst con specializzazione in dashboarding e automazioni dati
- Ottime capacità comunicative e di presentazione
- Buona padronanza della lingua inglese (livello C1)
- Certificazioni avanzate in Power BI o strumenti correlati

Questa posizione richiede una persona altamente qualificata, autonoma, orientata alla soluzione e al risultato, in grado di lavorare efficacemente sia in autonomia sia all’interno di team multidisciplinari
In UniversiData contano più i risultati che gli orari. Per questo offriamo:
- Modalità di lavoro ibrida: 50% remoto e 50% in presenza presso le nostre sedi di Roma

UniversiData è alla ricerca di un Senior Data Analyst da inserire nella nostra business unit dedicata ai servizi di formazione e consulenza per il corporate.


Responsabilità principali:


- Progettare ed erogare percorsi formativi specializzati in ambito Data Analysis per i nostri clienti corporate

- Lavorare a stretto contatto con il cliente per raccogliere requisiti, presentare dashboard e fornire consulenza su ottimizzazioni di analisi dati

- Progettare e sviluppare dashboard avanzate utilizzando Power BI per soddisfare esigenze di analisi e reporting aziendale

- Automatizzare processi e flussi di dati tramite l’utilizzo avanzato di query SQL e integrazioni con Power BI

- Analizzare e interpretare grandi moli di dati provenienti da varie fonti, fornendo insight utili per supportare decisioni strategiche aziendali


Competenze ed esperienze richieste:


-Capacità di progettare percorsi formativi chiari ed efficaci in Data Analysis

- Padronanza avanzata di SQL per l'estrazione, manipolazione e automazione dei dati

- Capacità di comprendere velocemente i requisiti di business e tradurli in soluzioni analitiche efficienti ed user-friendly

- Esperienza comprovata nell’automazione di processi e reportistica tramite query SQL e integrazione dati


Requisiti:


- Laurea Magistrale in Statistica, Informatica, Ingegneria o campi correlati

- Almeno 5 anni di esperienza nel ruolo di Data Analyst con specializzazione in dashboarding e automazioni dati

- Ottime capacità comunicative e di presentazione

- Esperienza pregressa nell'ambito della formazione

- Buona padronanza della lingua inglese (livello C1)


Plus:

- Competenze in ambito Data Engineering

- Certificazioni avanzate in Power BI o strumenti correlati

- Conoscenza di linguaggi complementari (Python, R)


Questa posizione richiede una persona altamente qualificata, autonoma, orientata alla soluzione e al risultato, in grado di lavorare efficacemente sia in autonomia sia all’interno di team multidisciplinari


In UniversiData contano più i risultati che gli orari. Per questo offriamo:


- Orari flessibili

- Modalità di lavoro ibrida: 50% remoto e 50% in presenza presso le nostre sedi di Roma

- Buoni pasto

- Computer aziendale

- Contratto a tempo indeterminato

4194675434,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-centers-expert-gartner-analyst-remote-emea-at-gartner-4194675434?position=3&pageNum=5&refId=2uM4KtfihCN%2B1v5oIbc%2FYg%3D%3D&trackingId=R0KN1dWaDQi%2FcmBiRXelUw%3D%3D,"Data Centers Expert, Gartner Analyst, Remote EMEA",Gartner,"Rome, Latium, Italy","As a Director Analyst specializing in Cloud and Data Centers at Gartner, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of digital infrastructure by providing strategic advice to CIOs and IT leaders on infrastructure, operations, and cloud strategies. With a focus on emerging technologies and trends, you will deliver actionable insights and thought leadership to our clients. Your expertise will be sought after for keynote speaking engagements and advisory roles across various sectors, including enterprises, governments, and technology providers.
Research and Analysis: Conduct comprehensive research on data center trends, technologies, and strategies. Key areas of focus can include:
Colocation and Datacenters: Explore trends and strategies in colocation services and data center management.
Hybrid Cloud and Multicloud Strategies: Provide insights into hybrid and multicloud environments, including cloud lock-in, portability, and cloud operating models.
Cloud Hyperscalers and Specialty Providers: Analyze the offerings and strategies of major cloud hyperscalers and specialty cloud providers.
Data Center Transformation and Consolidation: Offer strategies for transforming and consolidating data center operations to enhance efficiency and sustainability.
Edge Computing and Future Data Infrastructure: Examine the role of edge computing in modern data infrastructure and its integration with cloud services.
Resilience and Disaster Recovery: Develop strategies for cloud resilience, disaster recovery, and backup solutions, including hyperconverged and integrated systems.
Industry Insight: Offer expert guidance on cloud strategies and the future of data centers, advising executives in large and small enterprises, investors, and service providers.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to develop in-depth research and analysis that addresses the needs of IT leaders and decision-makers.
Client Advisory: Act as a trusted advisor, delivering actionable insights and recommendations to clients across various sectors, including government and technology providers.
Publishing: Author and contribute to research papers, articles, and publications, enhancing Gartner's visibility as a thought leader in data center management and IT infrastructure trends.

Presentations and Conferences: Serve as a keynote speaker at industry events, webinars, and client meetings, engaging with key stakeholders and leading projects such as conference chair for Gartner I&O events.
Bachelor’s or advanced degree preferably in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
10 years of experience, with significant expertise in data center industry standards, design, operations, trends and strategies, cloud strategies, and IT infrastructure.
Strong blend of technical and business skills, with a track record of advising executives and leading strategic projects.
Excellent analytical and research skills, with the ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
Strong communication and presentation skills, with experience as a keynote speaker.
Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams.
Track record of thought leadership through publications, presentations, and contributions to the data center and IT infrastructure community.

Relevant certifications, such as Certified Data Center Professional (CDCP), Certified Data Center Management Professional (CDCMP), or others that validate expertise in data center technologies and practices are an asset.
Competitive salary, generous paid time off policy, charity match program, and more!
Group Medical Insurance, Parental Leave, Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Collaborative, team-oriented culture that embraces diversity.
Professional development and unlimited growth opportunities
At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.

Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to more than 20,000 associates globally who support ~15,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
What makes Gartner a great place to work?

Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.

We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.

In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.

The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.

Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.

As a Director Analyst specializing in Cloud and Data Centers at Gartner, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of digital infrastructure by providing strategic advice to CIOs and IT leaders on infrastructure, operations, and cloud strategies. With a focus on emerging technologies and trends, you will deliver actionable insights and thought leadership to our clients. Your expertise will be sought after for keynote speaking engagements and advisory roles across various sectors, including enterprises, governments, and technology providers.

Location: United Kingdom

Position Type: Full-time

What You Will Do:

  • Research and Analysis: Conduct comprehensive research on data center trends, technologies, and strategies. Key areas of focus can include:
  • Colocation and Datacenters: Explore trends and strategies in colocation services and data center management.
  • Hybrid Cloud and Multicloud Strategies: Provide insights into hybrid and multicloud environments, including cloud lock-in, portability, and cloud operating models.
  • Cloud Hyperscalers and Specialty Providers: Analyze the offerings and strategies of major cloud hyperscalers and specialty cloud providers.
  • Data Center Transformation and Consolidation: Offer strategies for transforming and consolidating data center operations to enhance efficiency and sustainability.
  • Edge Computing and Future Data Infrastructure: Examine the role of edge computing in modern data infrastructure and its integration with cloud services.
  • Resilience and Disaster Recovery: Develop strategies for cloud resilience, disaster recovery, and backup solutions, including hyperconverged and integrated systems.
  • Industry Insight: Offer expert guidance on cloud strategies and the future of data centers, advising executives in large and small enterprises, investors, and service providers.
  • Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to develop in-depth research and analysis that addresses the needs of IT leaders and decision-makers.
  • Client Advisory: Act as a trusted advisor, delivering actionable insights and recommendations to clients across various sectors, including government and technology providers.
  • Publishing: Author and contribute to research papers, articles, and publications, enhancing Gartner's visibility as a thought leader in data center management and IT infrastructure trends.
  • Presentations and Conferences: Serve as a keynote speaker at industry events, webinars, and client meetings, engaging with key stakeholders and leading projects such as conference chair for Gartner I&
column2:
O events.

What You Will Need:

  • Bachelor’s or advanced degree preferably in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
  • 10 years of experience, with significant expertise in data center industry standards, design, operations, trends and strategies, cloud strategies, and IT infrastructure.
  • Strong blend of technical and business skills, with a track record of advising executives and leading strategic projects.
  • Excellent analytical and research skills, with the ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
  • Strong communication and presentation skills, with experience as a keynote speaker.
  • Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams.
  • Track record of thought leadership through publications, presentations, and contributions to the data center and IT infrastructure community.

Certifications:

  • Relevant certifications, such as Certified Data Center Professional (CDCP), Certified Data Center Management Professional (CDCMP), or others that validate expertise in data center technologies and practices are an asset.

What You Will Get:

  • Competitive salary, generous paid time off policy, charity match program, and more!
  • Group Medical Insurance, Parental Leave, Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
  • Collaborative, team-oriented culture that embraces diversity.
  • Professional development and unlimited growth opportunities

Who are we?

At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.

Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.

Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to more than 20,000 associates globally who support ~15,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.

What makes Gartner a great place to work?

Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.

We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.

Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.

We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.

What do we offer?

Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.

In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.

Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.

The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.

Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.

Job Requisition ID:98262

By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.

Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy

For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.

4020145611,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-quantitative-analyst-and-data-scientist-at-ep-produzione-4020145611?position=5&pageNum=5&refId=2uM4KtfihCN%2B1v5oIbc%2FYg%3D%3D&trackingId=0ku2YsVYhXwMqMVJMIno4g%3D%3D,SENIOR QUANTITATIVE ANALYST AND DATA SCIENTIST,EP Produzione,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Descrizione azienda

EP Produzione è la società italiana di generazione elettrica del Gruppo energetico ceco EPH. Con una capacità di generazione complessiva di 5,2 GW, attraverso cinque impianti a gas e uno a carbone, è il 5° produttore di energia in Italia
La risorsa verrà inserita nella Direzione Energy Management e sarà dedicata principalmente allo sviluppo di algoritmi strategici.
Nello Specifico, La Figura Professionale Avrà La Responsabilità Di
Sviluppare modelli di ottimizzazione delle strategie sui vari segmenti di mercato in cui opera l’azienda sulla base delle necessità delle aree funzionali della Direzione Energy Management.
Condurre analisi di dati per esaminare i processi della Direzione e migliorare l'efficienza e le operazioni.
Interpretare i dati e analizzare i risultati utilizzando tecniche statistiche.
Redazione reportistica periodica e/o on demand per la formulazione di previsioni di indirizzo relativamente all’andamento dei mercati e delle principali variabili macroeconomiche.
Approfondire novità e best practice relative agli ambiti progettuali di propria competenza.

Svolgere attività di business intelligence attraverso l'analisi dei dati e seguire progetti di trasformazioni Data & Analytics definendo le migliori strategie basate sull’utilizzo dei dati per facilitare il raggiungimento degli obiettivi di business.
Percorso di studi in ambito matematico/statistico/economico
Capacità quantitative e di problem solving supportate da un mindset analitico
Propensione a lavorare in team e a collaborare con i colleghi anche delle altre funzioni
Conoscenza dei principali applicativi Office e dei linguaggi di programmazione (a titolo esemplificativo: Python, Matlab, Visual Basic, C++)
Competenza nell'uso di strumenti di Business Intelligence (Power BI)
Orario Full-time, con possibilità di effettuare lo Smart Working per alcuni giorni della settimana.
Disponibilità ad effettuare brevi ed occasionali trasferte.

4192737589,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-at-ced-digital-servizi-4192737589?position=7&pageNum=5&refId=2uM4KtfihCN%2B1v5oIbc%2FYg%3D%3D&trackingId=fQwYhB%2Fh4riIz1XMTJl9Bw%3D%3D,Data Scientist,CED Digital & Servizi,"Rome, Latium, Italy","CED Digital & Servizi è alla ricerca di una risorsa da inserire nel team come Data Scientist.

CED Digital & Servizi è la società del Gruppo Caltagirone Editore (Il Messaggero, Il Mattino, Il Gazzettino, il Corriere Adriatico, Il Nuovo Quotidiano di Puglia e Leggo) che si occupa di: progettazione, innovazione, sviluppo e gestione digital delle testate del gruppo, gestione infrastrutturale dei sistemi IT e consulenza digital per clienti e partner commerciali.
La persona che stiamo cercando, affiancherà la Senior Data Scientist occupandosi di:
Sviluppo di modelli di Machine Learning e Deep Learning
Il tuo profilo sarà in linea se risponderà ai seguenti requisiti
Hai conseguito il titolo di Laurea Magistrale in Data Science o in Ingegneria/Statistica/Matematica/Fisica
Conosci i linguaggi R e Python
Hai un forte interesse per le nuove tecnologie e per l’informatica
Hai una buona conoscenza della lingua inglese
Aver portato a termine un Master in ambito Data o PhD in ambito scientifico
La tua sede di lavoro sarà
Inviare Curriculum Vitae, provvisto di autorizzazione al trattamento dati personali (D.lgs.196/2003 e GDPR 679/16).
Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91.

4197905335,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-science-expert-at-outlier-4197905335?position=8&pageNum=5&refId=2uM4KtfihCN%2B1v5oIbc%2FYg%3D%3D&trackingId=%2F8Mrma3FoQ1%2F5lD%2BWmhUmg%3D%3D,Data Science Expert,Outlier,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Outlier helps the world’s most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced data science engineer who wants to lend your expertise to train AI models? Join our team of experts to train AI models for data science generation!

We partner with organizations to train large AI language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models improve their output. Projects typically involve predictive modeling, classification, clustering, optimization, a/b testing, and/or anomaly detection that require interacting with these models as they learn. No previous AI experience is required.
Outlier is looking for talented Data Scientists to help train generative artificial intelligence models.
This freelance opportunity is remote with flexible hours, so you can work whenever is best for you. The general expectation is 30-40 hours of availability per week.
You Can Contribute With Your Expertise By
Developing and answering data science questions to help train AI models
Evaluating and classifying responses generated by AI models
Currently pursuing or having completed a bachelor’s degree or higher in Data Science from a selective institution.
Proficiency in working with Data Science
Ability to articulate complex concepts fluently in written and spoken English.
Excellent attention to detail, including grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines.
If you already have an Outlier account, please apply here:
Please apply only if you meet the required skills and have a strong interest in the role.

PLEASE NOTE: We collect, store, and use personal data for our business purposes, including notifying you about opportunities that may be of interest to you and sharing it with our affiliates. We limit the personal data we collect to what we believe is appropriate and necessary to manage the needs of applicants, provide our services, and comply with applicable laws. Any information we collect related to your application will be handled in accordance with Outlier's Privacy Policy and our internal policies and programs designed to protect personal data.

This is a 1099 contract opportunity on the Outlier.ai platform. Since this is a freelance opportunity, we do not offer internships, sponsorship, or employment. You must be authorized to work in your country of residence. If you are an international student, you may be able to register with Outlier if you have a visa. You should contact your tax and/or immigration advisor for specific questions about your circumstances.

Outlier helps the world’s most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced data science engineer who wants to lend your expertise to train AI models? Join our team of experts to train AI models for data science generation!

Projects typically involve predictive modeling, classification, clustering, optimization, a/b testing, and/or anomaly detection that require interacting with these models as they learn. 4185628252,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-system-engineer-defence-sector-at-rina-4185628252?position=9&pageNum=5&refId=2uM4KtfihCN%2B1v5oIbc%2FYg%3D%3D&trackingId=qD%2F4w0X2iv%2Fg7H2MQN6y0A%3D%3D,Junior System Engineer (Defence Sector),RINA,"Rome, Latium, Italy","RINA is currently recruiting for a Junior System Engineer (Defence Sector) to join its office in ROME within the Electronics and Systems Engineering Division.

The system engineer consultant support the client to develop tailor-made system solutions that meet specific requirements and provide added value through design and process optimization and efficiency. System Specification activities through the definition and allocation of clear and comprehensive requirements, collaborating with both client stakeholders and end-users to understand system needs.
Requirement Analysis: Collaborate with client development team to specify system requirements, including functional, non-functional, and interface requirements.
System Functionality Definition: Identify and describe the key functionalities of the system, considering requirements and final user needs.
System Specification Development: Organize and structure the System Specification clearly and coherently.
Review and Approval: Conduct periodic reviews of the System Specification with key client stakeholders to ensure the accuracy and completeness of requirements and obtain formal approval.
Change Management: Manage changes in system requirements during the development process, ensuring they are evaluated, documented, and implemented appropriately
Bachelor’s Degree in Aerospace Engineering or Electronics
Technical Knowledge: basic knowledge in front-edge technologies and Space & Defence systems: experience in drafting system requirements for an air/naval defense system
column2: experience in verifying system requirements for an air/naval defense system.

column1: Programming Skills: basic knowledge of at least one programming language.
Knowledge of Best Practices: knowledge of international standards (eg. ISO 15288, ECSS-E-ST-10, MIL-STD-498, DO-254, DO-178, etc.),
knowledge of SW modelling tools (eg. Matlab / Simulink)..
Reporting: Ability to analyze and process data and represent them synthetically (reports, metrics, graphs).
Use of Engineering tools: e.g. IBM DOORS, Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
ADDRESS THE WAY - Have a big picture of different situations and reinterpret it in a perspective way
BUILD NETWORK - Forge trust relationships, across departments, and outside the organization
CLIENT INTIMACY - Embrace internal and external client needs, expectations, and requirements to ensure maximum satisfaction
EARN TRUST - Take everyone's opinion into account and remain open to diversity
MAKE EFFECTIVE DECISIONS - Structure activities according to priorities, actions, resources and constraint
MANAGE EMOTIONS - Recognise one's and other's emotions and express and regulate one's reactions
PIONEER CHANGE - Actively embrace change and benefit from the new circumstances
PROMOTE SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT - Promote commitment by keeping promises as a Role Model
THINK FORWARD - Capitalise on experiences and translate them into action plans for the future

With over 5,800 employees and 200 offices in 70 countries worldwide, RINA is a multinational player which provides certification, marine classification, product testing, site supervision and vendor inspection, training and engineering consultancy services across a wide range of sectors. Our business model covers the full process of project development, from concept to completion. The aim is to guarantee a project’s technical, environmental and safety - and sometimes also economic and financial - sustainability.

At RINA, we endeavor to create a work environment where every single person is valued and encouraged to develop new ideas. We provide equal employment opportunities and are committed to creating a workplace where everyone feels respected and safe from discrimination or harassment of any kind. We are also compliant to the Italian Law n. 68/99.

RINA is currently recruiting for a Junior System Engineer (Defence Sector) to join its office in ROME within the Electronics and Systems Engineering Division.

Mission

The system engineer consultant support the client to develop tailor-made system solutions that meet specific requirements and provide added value through design and process optimization and efficiency. System Specification activities through the definition and allocation of clear and comprehensive requirements, collaborating with both client stakeholders and end-users to understand system needs.

Key Accountabilities

  • Requirement Analysis: Collaborate with client development team to specify system requirements, including functional, non-functional, and interface requirements.
  • System Functionality Definition: Identify and describe the key functionalities of the system, considering requirements and final user needs.
  • System Specification Development: Organize and structure the System Specification clearly and coherently.
  • Review and Approval: Conduct periodic reviews of the System Specification with key client stakeholders to ensure the accuracy and completeness of requirements and obtain formal approval.
  • Change Management: Manage changes in system requirements during the development process, ensuring they are evaluated, documented, and implemented appropriately

Education

Bachelor’s Degree in Aerospace Engineering or Electronics

Qualifications

Technical Knowledge: basic knowledge in front-edge technologies and Space &
column2: Defence systems: experience in drafting system requirements for an air/naval defense system
column3:
experience in verifying system requirements for an air/naval defense system.

Programming Skills: basic knowledge of at least one programming language.

Knowledge of Best Practices: knowledge of international standards (eg. ISO 15288, ECSS-E-ST-10, MIL-STD-498, DO-254, DO-178, etc.),

knowledge of SW modelling tools (eg. Matlab / Simulink)..

Reporting: Ability to analyze and process data and represent them synthetically (reports, metrics, graphs).

Use of Engineering tools: e.g. IBM DOORS, Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).

Competencies

  • ADDRESS THE WAY - Have a big picture of different situations and reinterpret it in a perspective way
  • BUILD NETWORK - Forge trust relationships, across departments, and outside the organization
  • CLIENT INTIMACY - Embrace internal and external client needs, expectations, and requirements to ensure maximum satisfaction
  • EARN TRUST - Take everyone's opinion into account and remain open to diversity
  • MAKE EFFECTIVE DECISIONS - Structure activities according to priorities, actions, resources and constraint
  • MANAGE EMOTIONS - Recognise one's and other's emotions and express and regulate one's reactions
  • PIONEER CHANGE - Actively embrace change and benefit from the new circumstances
  • PROMOTE SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT - Promote commitment by keeping promises as a Role Model
  • THINK FORWARD - Capitalise on experiences and translate them into action plans for the future

With over 5,800 employees and 200 offices in 70 countries worldwide, RINA is a multinational player which provides certification, marine classification, product testing, site supervision and vendor inspection, training and engineering consultancy services across a wide range of sectors. Our business model covers the full process of project development, from concept to completion. The aim is to guarantee a project’s technical, environmental and safety - and sometimes also economic and financial - sustainability.

At RINA, we endeavor to create a work environment where every single person is valued and encouraged to develop new ideas. We provide equal employment opportunities and are committed to creating a workplace where everyone feels respected and safe from discrimination or harassment of any kind. We are also compliant to the Italian Law n. 68/99.

Who should Apply

Ideal for freelancers, students, stay-at-home parents, or anyone seeking flexible remote work to improve AI models. No previous experience is required.


Role Description

Join RWS Group as an evaluator to enhance search engine results. Provide feedback on text, audio, images, and videos to refine AI data used by major search engines, social media sites, streaming platforms and more.


Work benefits

  • Flexible home-based work.
  • Work-life balance.
  • Potential side-hustle.
  • Payments via PayPal/Bank Account.
  • Access to more opportunities through our TrainAI Community.

Job requirements

  • High-speed internet connection
  • PC with Windows or Mac OS X operating system and Google Chrome.
  • Fluency in English
